description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PURPOSE
This person is responsible for promoting SITA FOR AIRCRAFT’s products and solutions to drive growth with existing customers and reach new customers in the ANSP market (Air Navigation Service Providers). Candidate will be tasked with uncovering, pursuing and closing multi-million dollar deals in assigned geography. This position is meant for an established professional that can deliver results in a dynamic environment.

What you will do
Deliver millions of dollars of yearly business growth
Working with all relevant stakeholders to develop the solution target market, the value proposition and the differentiators
Promoting value and benefit of the solutions/product to customers
Acting as an authority to advise customers on the best match between SITA FOR AIRCRAFT solutions and business requirements
Identifying customer needs/drivers and providing feedback to SITA FOR AIRCRAFT Product Teams about solution requirements, issues and challenges to drive the market
Managing and maintaining excellent business relationships with local partners in assigned region
Who you are
Solid academic qualification preferred in both technical, and commercial domains, or equivalent business experience.
10+ years-experience in the aerospace market
Subject matter expert in software solutions for the aerospace domain
Subject matter expert in Airline Operations Applications and Aircraft Communications
Proven experience working in complex, multi-cultural and highly-matrixed organizations
Experience of interfacing directly with senior levels of management internally and externally
Proven experience in a management role or customer facing position and establishing customer relationships
Knowledge & Skills

• Outstanding external and internal communication skills
• Competitive knowledge of industry
• Airline operations and applications product / solution knowledge
• Airline operations processes experience (business jet experience an asset)
• Airline passenger connectivity solution experience an asset
• Strong consultative approach
• Commercially minded, driven by results
• Team player


What we offer
SITA’s workplace is all about diversity: many different countries and cultures are represented in our workforce, and colleagues who’ve been working here for decades collaborate with those just out of college and early in their careers. SITA is a place of change and constant improvement, where we're always pushing ourselves to find better ways of doing things: smarter, quicker, easier, for us and our customers and for their customers too.
And we offer all the good stuff you’d expect like holidays, bonus, flexible benefits, medical policy, pension plan and access to world class learning.

Welcome to SITA
SITA is the world’s leading specialist in air transport communications and information technology. We don’t just connect the global aviation industry. We apply decades of experience and expertise to address almost every core business, operational, baggage, and passenger process in air transport.
We design, build, and support technology solutions all with one vision to create easy air travel every step of the way. As an organization, we cover 95% of all international air travel destinations and work with over 2,800 air transport and government customers in every corner of the globe. Are you ready to explore the opportunities?
Keywords: Software solutions, Stakeholder management, Airline Applications, Airport communications

title: Distributor Business Manager (Sports Footwear / Apparels)
company_info: At Tahlia Waters, we always listen to understand your career aspirations and aspire to fulfill them. Because this is your career.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary:
· Achieve Budgeted Sales & Contribution Targets.
· Establish strong working relationships with Distributor partner. Strategic alliances & business plans are built & developed.
· Increased Brand Share achieved within the Distributors Business.

The Role:
1) Distributor Business Management:
Set and achieve Budgeted Net Sales and contribution targets for the Distributor.
Maintain & present on time budget & reforecasting as per the required timelines.
Build and maintain strong positive relationship with distributor partner across the region by developing Global Alignment to drive brand share within their markets.
Ensure 3 year rolling business plans are built and maintained.
Ensure all sell in and go to market materials are provided on time by Distributor – Including price lists, marketing plans, forecasts & other relative material.
All lock forecasts and forecast timelines are to be met and maintained on time.
Conduct consolidated monthly business review meetings. (MBRs)
Maintain & execute monthly Scorecards/Reports.
Ensure Global Key Accounts standards and requirements are met & maintained by Distributor where applicable.
Ensure that the Distributor complies to the required Organisation Structure.
Provide Monthly Business reports to regional management on how they are performing against Budget/Plan.
Put in place and maintain an NB Brand Share tracker by key categories for all Markets.
Conduct weekly/Biweekly work in progress meetings.
2) Trade Shows & Travel:
Ensure regular & Budgeted planned travel to each Distributors markets are maintained on 6-8-week cycles. Attending trade shows when possible.
Attend Regional Sales Meetings where required.
3) Product/Marketing & Retail:
Ensure all Product & Marketing plans with Distributors are aligned and in order.
Work with regional GKA product & marketing managers to ensure all Distributor needs are met.
Work closely with GKA regional product & marketing teams to ensure regular visits are made to the Distributors markets.
Work with Regional Retail teams to ensure all Distributor NB owned retail stores are being supported & complying to Global/Regional standards. Including E Commerce.
Ensure quarterly pricing & competitive reviews are conducted for all markets. As well as making sure all product segmentation standards are being met.
Responsible for all Distributor markets meeting company VM & in-store standards.
4) Operations
Work closely with NBIL Operations and Customer Service personal to ensue all Distributors orders and business needs are being maintained and met.
Responsible for ensuring all forecasts are met and delivered on time to the appropriate personal.
Pursue continual operational & business improvement opportunities with Distributor markets.

Distributor Markets include:
Indonesia
Thailand
Philippines
Vietnam
Cambodia

What You Need to Have?
Candidates must possess at least 10 years of working experience in managing distributors/business partners in regional markets in the sports wear/sports apparel industry.

title: MARKETING MANAGER
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Extra Space Asia Self-Storage is seeking a dynamic and experienced Marketing Manager to lead our marketing efforts across Singapore, Malaysia, Korea, and Hong Kong. The Marketing Manager will play a pivotal role in shaping the marketing strategy, managing a lean and talented team, and driving the success of our brand across Asia. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in various aspects of marketing, be data-driven in decision-making, and have a proven track record in social media management and public relations.

Key Duties & Responsibilities:

Marketing Strategy and Planning:
Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies for Singapore, Malaysia, Korea, and Hong Kong markets, in alignment with company goals.
Collaborate with the Marketing Director to define long-term marketing objectives and KPIs.
Analyse market trends and competitor activities to identify opportunities and threats.
Lead Generation and Qualification:
Develop and implement lead generation strategies to acquire new customers and prospects.
Collaborate with the Operations team to define lead criteria and establish lead qualification processes.
Monitor lead flow, track conversion rates, and continuously optimize lead generation efforts.
Ensure Marketing and Sales teams are aligned on lead quality and quantity targets.
Content Marketing:
Drive our content marketing efforts, creating engaging and valuable content to reach our target audience.
Develop a content calendar, oversee content creation, and ensure consistency in messaging across all platforms.
Digital Marketing:
Drive our digital marketing efforts, overseeing campaigns across various digital channels, including social media, email marketing, SEM, SEO, and display advertising.
Leverage data analytics to optimize digital campaigns and improve ROI.
Website and App Management:
Work closely with web developers to manage our website presence, ensuring it reflects our brand's values and meets user experience standards.
Oversee updates, improvements, and ensure the CMS is optimized for SEO and user engagement.
Oversee our digital presence, ensuring our mobile application is optimised to deliver a seamless user experience. Manage and promote our loyalty program within the app to enhance customer engagement and retention.
PR and Brand Management:
Manage PR agency and oversee public relations activities, including media relations, press releases, and crisis management.
Maintain and enhance the company's brand image in the respective markets.
Develop and nurture relationships with key stakeholders, influencers, and partners.
Ensure a seamless and consistent brand experience across all touchpoints.
Budget Management:
Manage the marketing budget effectively, allocating resources for maximum ROI.
Track and report on marketing expenditures and performance against budget.
Market Research and Customer Insights:
Conduct market research to identify customer needs, preferences, and trends.
Use customer insights to develop targeted marketing campaigns and product/service improvements.
Data-Driven Decision-Making:
Utilize data to make informed marketing decisions.
Monitor and evaluate marketing campaign performance, optimizing strategies as necessary.
Ensure the team uses data insights to continuously improve marketing efforts.
Process Improvement and Optimisation:
Continuously assess and analyse marketing processes and workflows to identify inefficiencies.
Propose and implement process changes and optimisations to improve marketing effectiveness and efficiency.
Monitor the impact of process changes and measure results against defined KPIs.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field; Master's degree is a plus.
Preferably with at least 6 years’ of relevant work experience.
Data-driven mindset with proficiency in marketing analytics tools.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including a flair for writing.
Strong leadership, team management, and team-building skills.
Ability to work independently, prioritise tasks, and meet deadlines.
Fluent in English.

title: MARKETING MANAGER
company_info: Seonggong Pte. Ltd. brings Seorae - Korean Charcoal BBQ with a unique selling point, Galmaegisal, a Korean royal dish. This restaurant brand has more than 230 outlets all over South Korea, 17 outlets in China, 4 outlets in Hong Kong and 4 outlets in Indonesia. We are the first to bring Galmaegisal to Singapore. We are opening new outlets in Singapore and inviting you to join our team.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Marketing Plan & Budget:
Develop specific marketing activities based on the Brands requirements.
Prepare and present marketing budget for respective Brands that is in line with brand standards and overall financial budget.
Support and facilitate the implementation of marketing plan at respective brand outlets.
Work closely with Operations team in monitoring the effectiveness of the marketing plan for specific brand(s).
Responsible for all aspects of advertising and promotional activities and execute integrated marketing plan.
Manage Marketing Suppliers & Corporate Communication:
Negotiate with media agencies and other vendors to secure agreements for translation of materials into other form of media.
Develop promotional material including marketing collateral and print copies.
Ensure marketing materials are prepared according to the approved specification requirements.
Ensure Internal and External Communications system are in place and carried out professionally and according to brand requirements.
Monitor and manage the public relations activities and ensure the standard operating procedures are in place based on brand/franchise requirements.
Manage and ensure effectiveness of corporate responsibility events are carried out according to plan and within schedule and budget such as sponsorship, opening of new outlets, launching of new products, or other activities effectively to gain public attention through various media.
Observe and report on social, economic and political trends that might affect the Company’s operations.
Competitive Benchmarking:
Understand customer’s needs and link it back to the respective brand(s).
Conduct and do competitive benchmarking and product comparison for respective brand(s).
Work with branding consultant to strengthen respective brand (s), rebranding and/or create new brands.
Study trends and conduct marketing intelligence to gain competitive data for analysis.
Coordinate with Operations team and ensure implementation and full rollout of the new products and/or services.
Track and evaluate effectiveness of campaigns, new products and/or services results and track ROI to formulate effective campaign strategies.
Customer Relationship Management (CRM):
Coordinate with Operations team on designing and implementing prospective client contact systems.
Organize and rollout special marketing events to mine relevant data on customers’ profile and ultimately build a robust CRM database.
Conduct customer satisfaction survey in order to gain information on customer needs and overall satisfaction level.
Monitor customer feedback and complaints and channel to relevant stakeholders for resolution.
Based on CRM database, develop appropriate marketing interventions and activities in line with brand requirements.
Manage, monitor the effectiveness and maintain the brand’s website and tapping on social media to reach out to customers.
Loyalty Program:
Responsible for designing the program benefits and continuous enhancement of program to drive revenue.
Develop loyalty program calendar and drive execution of marketing campaigns, initiatives and events to increase members.
Assess market trends and competitor analysis to ensure competitiveness of loyalty program.
Others:
Manage the POS system menu and price changes.
Handle and manage 3rd party online delivery platforms.
Perform any other additional responsibilities as assigned by the Immediate Superior.

Requirements:
Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor Degree in Marketing, Business, Public Relations, Communications or other relevant professional certification such as CIM.
At least 5 years of related working experiences in a managerial role.
Exposure with F&B or retail related business coupled with advertising client servicing background in advertising firms is a plus.
Possess marketing management and strategic planning experience with ability to develop and rollout end-to-end marketing plans.
Possess exceptional F&B industry knowledge and familiar with different strategies used by industry players and competitors.
Familiar with market research methodology and market intelligence function and activities.
Strong proficiency in English and able to communicate effectively in both written and verbal forms.
Analyses and present plan and ideas in a convincing and impactful manner, ultimately influencing a positive outcome.
Able to manage projects and small team and track progress for improvement.
Recognize and be responsive to the needs of all internal & external customers of the organization.
Detail-oriented, mature, with excellent analytical & quantitative skills
Team player with good negotiation, interpersonal & presentation skills
Self-discipline and self-motivated with dynamic personality to always strive for better results.
Possess enthusiasm in learning and keen to get feedback for improvement.
Possess leadership qualities to lead, communicate and motivate restaurant team towards meeting/ exceeding the marketing goals and objectives.
May require to work during weekends and public holidays for promotion events.

title: Assistant Marketing Manager
company_info: Inspired by Alvar Aalto’s take on beauty, our design philosophy is Harmony. Good design is not merely the artistic expression or inspired musings of our designers. It is a product of a long and carefully curated process that distils the multi-faceted needs of our clients, melding that with our understanding of basic human behaviours and infusing our touches of creativity and flair. The result? Designs that perfectly balance purpose and form. Defying labels, debunking conventions, and transcending trends – EightyTwo designs are the distilled essence of people and how they live. Everything you touch, feel, and perceive is the metamorphism of a long, tedious creative process and a carefully curated collection of artistic decisions. Just like our name, our designs are open-ended, allowing for multiple interpretations, a symbolic representation of our creativity.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
company_info: PropertyGuru.com.sg, Singapore's leading property portal and a flagship website of PropertyGuru's Network – Asia's Property Guru. PropertyGuru.com.sg is used by over 4.5 million consumers who view over 50 million pages. A favourite with local property seekers, PropertyGuru.com.sg is the largest online property database in Singapore, with several awards under its belt and features real time access to multi-media rich content covering property and home-related products, services, news, advice, guides and tools. It works closely with prominent real estate developers in Singapore and overseas, over 20,000 housing agents, and home-related firms.
address: PAYA LEBAR QUARTER, 1 PAYA LEBAR LINK 408533
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Make A Real Difference at PropertyGuru.
Real Aspirations. Real People. Real impact.

PropertyGuru is Southeast Asia’s leading PropTech company, and the preferred destination for over 41 million property seekers to connect with more than 63,000 agents monthly to find their dream home. PropertyGuru empowers property seekers with more than 3.2 million real estate listings, in-depth insights, and solutions that enable them to make confident property decisions across Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, and Vietnam.

PropertyGuru.com.sg was launched in Singapore in 2007 and since then PropertyGuru Group has made the property journey a transparent one for property seekers in Southeast Asia. In the last 15 years, PropertyGuru has grown into a high-growth PropTech company with a robust portfolio of leading property marketplaces across its core markets; award-winning mobile apps; mortgage marketplace, PropertyGuru Finance; and a host of enterprise solutions now under PropertyGuru For Business, including a high-quality developer sales enablement platform, FastKey, DataSense, ValueNet, Awards, events and publications across Asia.

Responsibilities:
PropertyGuru has decided to fundamentally reshape how users finance homes! Our vision is to marry the home search and home financing journey, making owning a home friction free. We launched our business in early 2020 and are ramping up to ignite the next phase of growth. We are looking for an ambitious, seasoned Product Marketing Manager to join our dedicated FinTech team and help us develop and execute marketing strategies that drive acquisition, adoption, and growth.

About your dream role:
Bring the PropertyGuru Finance Brand positioning to life in collaboration with the brand team.
Devise strategies to enhance brand awareness and consideration among Home seekers.
Collaborate closely with our dedicated product managers to determine our product positioning, messaging, and benefits.
Formulate and execute product marketing strategies and go-to-market plans for our range of digital home financing products.
Stitch together insights from across all the touchpoints and channels in a user’s homebuying journey, identifying areas to improve acquisition and engagement
Oversee and drive marketing campaigns in coordination with dedicated marketing functions, covering agency management, media planning, SEO, paid advertising, and social media.
Develop content strategies, ranging from educational content, market deep dives, and key opinion leader pieces.
Analyze and track marketing metrics to assess the success of initiatives.
Requirements:
8+ years of experience in product marketing.
Strong understanding of product marketing principles and best practices and experience in executing these for online products/services.
Ability to think strategically and provide clear direction for digital product go-to-market while effectively managing rollout details.
Proven experience in developing marketing plans spanning multiple channels, including SEO, Paid, and Social Media, among others.
Proficiency in crafting concise and effective marketing copy for diverse audiences, including both technical and non-technical segments.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and collaborate with various cross-functional stakeholders.
Solid grasp of marketing analytics, understanding user journeys and how to measure their effectiveness.
Positive attitude, unbounded curiosity and comfort in a fast-paced environment.
PropertyGuru Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative an learning environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to gender, identity, race, religion, nationality, age, marital status, disability, or any other protected status, per applicable law. If there is anything we can do to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are actively seeking a passionate and performance-driven individual who will be responsible for all thought leadership and integrated programs from design to overseeing the delivery of high impact programs that will elevate our relevance to the C-suite, by tying client's transformational solutions to the business imperatives that CXOs care about most across our executive engagements, including our flagship executive programs and C-Suite Events.

Key Responsibilities
Handle strategy to execution manage all CXO (Chief Experience Officer) Engagement thought leadership, content, campaign messaging, events and drive cohesive narratives across multiple platforms and touch points in partnership with sales and local marketing teams
Build and lead a planning framework for cohesively connecting and strategizing cross-functionally with teams, such as corporate comms and our customer engagement leads, to develop thought leadership that supports all executive programs, including those at our annual user conference Knowledge
Explore ongoing storytelling and narratives that support regional C-level engagements with agency partners, professional associations and industry bodies
Develop and scope team projects that map to critical business goals such as topics that drive CXO conversation and engagement
Help identify opportunities to bring CXOs together, aligned to common beliefs, values, and interests
Act as a ‘voice of the CxO’ in helping to formulate messaging and approaches for relevant programs and touchpoints
Build and maintain an audience acquisition strategy that is supported by a series of nurture programs that win, attract, and grow our CXO audiences
Work effectively across the organization in partnership with APAC Field Marketing, APJ communications, APAC ABM and Campaign teams
Act as a customer listening board, participate in C-suite experiences and interviews, using the insights to inform future narratives and strategic initiatives

To be successful in this role you have:
8+ years of relevant exp with some of that managing individuals and agencies
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, or technology related field is preferred or relevant working exp in lieu of a degree
Domain expertise in Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) and Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS)
Experience working with C-suite, Sales and Field Marketing
Effective team player who can lead efforts across disciplines and organizations within a high velocity, shifting environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, must have the ability to communicate with team members at varying levels (including Executive leadership), conceptually and tactically
The ability to organize different teams (internally and externally) around shared goals and managing the ambiguity that sometimes comes from working cross-functionally
Experience successfully interfacing with external vendors and external marketing agencies
B2B marketing experience with software or technology products
Interested candidates may apply through the application system or send it to sg-techcontracting@morganmckinley.com. Shortlisted candidates will be notified.

By sending us your personal data and curriculum vitae (CV), you are deemed to consent to Morgan Mckinley Pte Ltd and its affiliates to collect, use, and disclose your personal data for the purposes set out in the Privacy Policy available at https://www.morganmckinley.com/sg/privacy-policy. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a motivated Marketing Executive with a focus on cloud technology to join our team. In this role, you will primarily collaborate with our SEO specialist to write industry news and blog articles for regular updates on our website. Having a basic understanding of SEO and cloud technology will be advantageous. Proficiency in English copywriting is essential, and knowledge of Mandarin would be a plus. You will be responsible for researching and staying updated on industry news, particularly within the Singapore and English market IT industry. Additionally, you will assist the marketing manager with various ad-hoc tasks, including event planning and social media management.

Job Description:
- Collaborate with the SEO specialist to create compelling and engaging content related to cloud technology for regular updates on the company website.
- Maintain a good understanding of SEO practices and incorporate them into content creation.
- Research industry news, trends, and emerging technologies within the IT industry, particularly within the Singapore and English markets.
- Write clear, concise, and grammatically correct content in English.
- Assist with event planning, social media management and coordination for marketing initiatives.
- Support the manager with any ad-hoc tasks as required.

What we are looking for:
- Diploma in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
- Previous experience in copywriting, content creation, or digital marketing would be advantageous.
- Familiarity with SEO best practices and basic knowledge of cloud technology.
- Excellent English copywriting skills with the ability to write clear, compelling content.
- Proficiency in Mandarin would be a plus.
- Strong research and analytical skills to stay updated on industry trends and news.
- Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
- Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.
- Experience in event planning and coordination would be an asset.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
An exciting opportunity for like-minded individuals passionate about eCommerce who wants to make a difference in the transformational journey awaits you! You will be deputy to the Head of Branding & Communications of iShopChangi as well as a member of the omni-marketing team for promotion of the broader omni-retail business in Changi Airport.

We are looking for a team member who loves the dynamism of the eCommerce landscape, is energized by the opportunities to craft strategies and implement projects from end-to-end and thrives in a multi-stakeholder environment. If you have a strong entrepreneurial mindset, project leadership and people management skills and enjoy working in a diverse yet vibrant company who values its people and innovation, join us!

Job Description
Develop and build iShopChangi’s branding strategy both from a corporate and business lens to favorably position the business to the target audiences locally, regionally and globally. These include:
(i) Conducting research on industry news, trends and compelling angles and fleshing them into scalable campaign and communications strategies and programmes
(ii) Conceptualising independent branding, media-related campaigns, award cultivation initiatives when necessary
Play a business partner role to the rest of the marketing teams, particularly the Travel Retail Promotion/Campaigns team on the development of integrated marketing communications, PR, and content strategies to maximise project ROI. You will be the lead in spearheading full 360 marketing activations that covers multi-channel platforms including paid media, social and content marketing and out-of-home publicity channels focused on driving maximum reach, customer engagement and retention
Spearhead strategy and content direction of iShopChangi’s editorial column, iShopCurates
Foster a strong and synergistic collaborations with internal corporate communications stakeholders to maximise performance on iShopChangi’s brand initiatives as well as maximise enterprise value
Maintain all brand budget planning and management
Other operational / managerial responsibilities will include:
a) Management reporting via email / powerpoint presentations
b) Manage multiple stakeholders per campaign including external vendor relationships and internal stakeholders for campaign approvals
c) Write, develop and manage approvals for media-related materials and maintain relationships with key business, consumer and trade media and micro to macro influencers
d) Build and maintain brand assets such as toolkits, press kits, and more
e) Help build best practices and new processes to enhance team efficiency
Separately, develop the roadmap of an integrated omni-marcom plan for the broader commercial business as a key member under the omni-marketing team
Key Performance Indicators
Brand health performance
Media, content partner and KOL coverage and performance
iShopCurates content performance
Social media channel performance
Job Requirements
Minimally 6 years of working experience developing and evaluating brand strategies
A background in e-Commerce and/or Travel Retail will be advantageous
Displays strategic and analytical thinking and a proven track record of driving innovation and brand growth
Has strong consumer media and influencer connections that can be immediately tapped on for campaign amplification
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Copywriting in both short and long formats is your forte
Experience in working with multiple internal and external stakeholders across multiple campaigns. You have strong interpersonal skills to broadly influence and effectively forge partnerships both internally and externally
Disciplined organizational skills with strong attention to detail
You are a self-starter: you thrive on taking ownership of initiatives with limited oversight
Able to work to tight deadlines, adjust to changes in priorities, and balance short term needs with long term strategic initiatives

title: Manager, Recruitment & Admissions, Lee Kong Chian School of Business
company_info: RecruiterPal is a cloud-based recruitment platform that helps you to recruit staff faster and easier, giving you full control and overview of your entire recruitment process.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together – building a strong collegiality and morale within the university.

Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities – all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Outreach & Events
Represent and promote LKCSB Postgraduate and Professional Doctorate Programmes through outreach events in Singapore and overseas.
This includes participation and presentations in physical and virtual events both local and overseas, such as information sessions, recruitment fairs, coffee sessions, visiting school talks, and others.
Recruitment
Responsible for on-target recruitment of quality students for LKCSB Postgraduate and Professional Doctorate Programmes.
Advising prospects and candidates from various sources and to answer enquiries from walk-ins, calls, emails.
Admissions
Manage admissions process for LKCSB Postgraduate and Professional Doctorate Programmes smoothly and efficiently, including overseeing end-to-end processes to ensure that the admin process for respective programmes is adhered to.
This include managing prospects’ admissions experience from pre-to-post application, up to point of matriculation.
Marketing
Work with respective Corporate Marketing managers and ensure the effective marketing and representation of LKCSB Postgraduate and Professional Doctorate Programmes in both local and overseas markets.
This includes the strategising, planning, implementation, and execution of all marketing and promotion related tasks and activities through both traditional and digital media.
IT Systems
Ensure that our IT systems (eDMS, CRM, website, social media etc.) are supporting our recruitment efforts effectively.
Candidate will also work with internal/external stakeholders to increase efficiency as well as efficacy, and be able to do some data analysis.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree.
At least 5 years of work experience, with experience in marketing education products, wholesale and retail in an Institute of Higher Learning, would be advantageous.
Good interpersonal skills, prior event planning and administrative/recruitment experience would be advantageous.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Good event management skills.
Understanding of postgraduate programmes or higher education environment a plus.
Self-starter with initiative, and a good problem-solver.
Familiar with MS Office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word) and video conferencing tools (WebEx, Bluejeans, Zoom, MS Teams).
Ability to review marketing platforms and their effectiveness.
Ability to present confidently in front of a sizeable crowd.
Knowledge of Asian markets and their postgraduate study needs will be beneficial.
Strong team player.
Willing to travel.
OTHER INFORMATION
#LI-EH1
Candidates who do not possess the stipulated qualifications but have relevant work experience may still apply. Remuneration and appointment terms shall commensurate with qualifications and experience. SMU reserves the right to modify the appointment terms where necessary.
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Singapore Management University

title: marketing manager
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Customer Service, Events / Promotions, F&B, General Management, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
To help company on marketing
To plans and coordinates marketing activities, such as identifying potential customers, developing marketing campaigns and organizing focus groups. She is responsible for developing marketing plans that align with the business’ strategy.
To do Advertisements online and on television are the product of hard work by a marketing manager and her team. After researching the market and identifying potential customers, commercials or advertisements are made using key marketing strategies to encourage potential customers to purchase the company’s product. Some of these efforts focus on attracting new customers while others serve to retain their existing customer base.
The marketing approach differs for new customers and existing customers because company goals are different for each. Marketing campaigns with a focus on attracting new customers introduce potential customers to the company’s product. The marketing manager must use her experience and knowledge to help customers see that they need the product. Alternatively, campaigns that focus on retention serve to remind customers why the product is the best choice in the market.

title: Marketing Manager
company_info: CANADIAN INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL PTE LTD The Canadian International School is an international school located in Singapore. We are proud to be an IB World School and have a passion for education. The Canadian International School (CIS) opened its doors in 1990 and has always focused on excellence in all facets of education. We believe that through years of successful practice and from a firm understanding and implementation of educational research and teaching methodologies tailored for the global student, that our students are engaged, enlightened and empowered by participating in what we believe to be an outstanding programme. The Canadian International School in Singapore offers the International Baccalaureate Primary Years Programme (IB PYP), International Baccalaureate Middle Years Programme (IB MYP) and International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme (IB DP), for students from Early Childhood Education to Grade 12. The IBDiploma, is recognised around the world by major universities. We are also very pleased to be an associate member in the Council of International Schools. This prestigious designation puts us in the forefront of education leaders in the world. The CIS student body of over 3,000 represents a truly diverse population from over 65 countries and is served by a comprehensive and challenging curriculum taught by highly qualified and dedicated teachers. Our focus is on the needs of each individual, stimulating their inherent curiosity thereby inspiring them to become lifelong learners. Our students pursue excellence in the mastery of creative problem solving, effective communication, leadership, international understanding, and responsible citizenship. CIS has two campuses throughout Singapore – our Lakeside campus (Early Childhood to Grade 12) in the West, and the Tanjong Katong Campus (Early Childhood to Grade 8) in the East.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Key accountability (Main purpose of this job):
Reporting to the Director of Marketing and Admissions, the Marketing Manager will play a key role in creating and driving the marketing strategy to build brand awareness and positioning. This role will oversee the effective and timely execution of all strategic marketing initiatives and ensure projects are delivered on time and on budget. The Marketing Manager should lead with a “marketing led” ethos, and understand the target market to drive lead acquisition and brand awareness through marketing campaigns.

Responsibilities (Key areas of Responsibilities):
Contribute to the overall Marketing strategy and business plans, while ensuring compliance with EduTrust requirements.
Oversee and guide the team on all Marketing matters.
Develop and manage the end to end process of marketing campaigns and CIS’s major events across all channels, including brief development.
Develop existing referral, partner sites or lists.
Manage the service level and quality of marketing agencies.
Manage the marketing budget, including expenditure and ROI.
Prepare routine reporting on marketing metrics, goals/successes, demand for CIS’s servicesand features, competitors’ market and recommendations for improvement.
Oversee the production of all marketing videos.
Oversee all marketing components of the CRM system.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Marketing or equivalent
Minimum 7 years’ experience as a Communications and Marketing professional
Experience with marketing including content, SEO, digital and paid media
Demonstrated ability in developing and driving marketing campaigns and strategic plans
Demonstrated ability in creating targeted content that generates measurable ROI
Excellent interpersonal, presentation and communication skills
Excellent organisational skills with the ability to meet deadlines with minimal supervision
Ability to quickly adapt to change
Experience in the international school sector, either as a parent, educator or communications professional, will be beneficial

title: Marketing Manager
company_info: BENJAMIN BARKER AUST PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
In Benjamin Barker Group, marketing is about understanding people and building awareness of how the products and services can satisfy their needs. We’re looking for an experienced and versatile Marketing Manager who’s eager to do this and more for the group’s fashion and F&B brands.

The ideal candidate has experience in developing and executing marketing campaigns, CRM, PR and communications while managing and inspiring a team of Marketing Executives. The manager should be equally proficient with day-to-day marketing activities and long-term strategizing, and strive under tight deadlines to meet the company's changing needs.

Your Marketing responsibilities will include:
· Developing strategic marketing campaigns to help achieve business results
· Ensuring that plans and messaging are aligned with business strategy, reinforce brand positioning, provide value-added content that is suited to customer’s needs as well as interests and are delivered effectively to targeted audiences
· Supporting integrated marketing and communications across a variety of channels and vehicles– internal, external, PR, social, web and digital.
· Collaborating across teams to develop key messages for campaigns, EDMs, marketing platforms and content syndication including thought leadership, market trends, reports, surveys, and customer satisfaction stories
· Collaborating with different stakeholders to ensure successful implementation of strategic marketing plans including defining success criteria, measuring the effectiveness of initiatives, and reporting on results
Your Customer Relationship Management responsibilities will include:
· Development, execution, and continuous refinement of multi-channel Customer Relations and the development of programs, roadmaps, and Customer Relation strategies, also focusing on loyalty and retention marketing strategies
· Analyse customer insights, consumer trends, market analysis, and marketing best practices to build successful strategies
· Customer Journey Mapping analysing touch points with the organisation and maximizing commercial opportunities
· Deciding on the CRM platform structure and architecture ensuring it works seamlessly across the organization and captures all required information at key points in the customer life cycle
· Developing testing strategies for all aspects of the CRM to ensure the most effective approach for the company and its products
· Ensuring the database is segmented effectively for targeted marketing activities
· Monitor and maximize customer lifetime value strategies ensuring maximum profitability
· Overseeing direct communications with customers through the CRM

title: Regional Performance Marketing Manager
company_info: Chope wants you to dive into the good things in life by getting out — and what better way to do so than with food? In our mission to be Asia’s premier dining platform, our goal is to match millions of restaurants to billions of diners, ensuring that people can regularly and easily make the most out of their dining experiences. Having seated more than 100 million diners to date, Chope is well-positioned to understand what gets people excited about dining out, and how best to maximise business for our 5,000 restaurant partners. With Chope, diners can discover restaurants, make instant bookings, and save with great dining deals. Chope’s demand generating diner platform is seamlessly incorporated with a suite of integrated solutions that encompass reservation, call, queue, and table management. This technology frees restaurants up to focus on what they do best: Providing their customers with the best food and service. Founded in 2011 and currently in seven cities (Singapore, Hong Kong, Bangkok, Phuket, Shanghai, Bali, and Jakarta), Chope has grown consistently over the past 10 years, and despite the effects of COVID-19 on the F&B industry this past year, are bouncing back stronger than ever. Powering this growth is Chope’s close relationships with top restaurant partners, which include The Lo & Behold Group, JUMBO Group, Soho Hospitality, Lost Heaven, Dining Concepts, Hospitality Management Asia, Ismaya Group and The Union Group. Chope’s ecosystem is further enriched by key partnerships with the likes of Alipay, Google, TripAdvisor, Meituan Dianping, DBS, and CapitaLand. Visit www.chope.co and download the app (www.chope.co/app) for more information.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company Introduction:
Chope is dining made easy. As the leading dining platform in Asia, we connect diners to restaurants for memorable experiences, more often.
Having seated more than 100 million diners, Chope understands what gets people excited about dining out, and how best to maximise business for over 13,000 restaurant partners. With Chope, diners can discover restaurants, make bookings, save with deals, and order pick-up and delivery on the app. Chope’s demand generating diner platform is seamlessly incorporated with a suite of integrated restaurant solutions that encompass reservation, call, queue, and table management.
Founded in 2011 and currently in seven cities (Singapore, Hong Kong, Bangkok, Phuket, Shanghai, Bali, and Jakarta), Chope has grown consistently over the past 10 years. We are inviting motivated and enthusiastic candidates to join our team at a very exciting stage in our growth journey. You will be part of a team that leads the way in developing technology for the benefit of the whole restaurant ecosystem, including diners like yourself!

At a glance
As a key member of Chope’s Regional Marketing team, the Performance Marketing Manager will drive development and execution of acquisition and retargeting strategies for Chope across a variety of marketing channels, primarily (but not limited to) search engines and social media channels.

As a Performance Marketing Manager, you’ll be working closely with the rest of the regional marketing team, local marketing teams and DEP (design, engineering and product teams) in the hunt for growth and efficiencies. You will also be expected to engage and influence management and key stakeholders in the process.
What you’ll be doing..
Be our performance marketing expert. Strategize, execute and optimize a strong performance marketing plan across all our markets in line with Chope’s business objectives
Lead the management of all Chope performance marketing channels; to ensure campaigns are hitting ROI, acquisition and retention targets
Formulate and implement a data-led approach across paid and non-paid channels. (e.g. SEM and SEO, paid social and display, owned and earned social)
Lead and own the SEO strategies which includes technical website audit, content gap analysis, competitive analysis, on-page and off-page optimisation to improve organic search visibility, increase website traffic and enhance search engine rankings
Collaborate closely with the brand, product and local marketing teams to develop and implement SEO strategies
Develop and implement a testing framework in the hunt for efficiencies and results across all channels, campaigns and audiences
Build and support our performance marketing stack - tracking, measurement, attribution, analysis, optimization and automation
Prepare and present regular reviews for local markets and management
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, algorithm updates, and best practices in SEM and SEO to drive innovation and continuous improvement
What Are We Looking For (Requirements):
Has at least 5 years of relevant working experience in-house or a performance agency
Is independent and proactive mindset, with the ability to be productive and efficient with minimal or no supervision in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment
Has thorough knowledge of online marketing and a strong interest in the technology behind it, including cookies, SDKs, tracking, tagging, attribution, optimization, etc
Is Google-certified Professional and Facebook Blueprint certified preferred
Has experience with copywriting and other forms of digital marketing (social media marketing etc.) is highly desirable
Has a passion for the food and beverage and technology ecosystem, particularly in the areas of dining, discovery, and deals
What To Look Forward To:
Hands-on action: Sink your teeth into opportunities that’ll deliver both impact and meaning to the Chope customer experience.
Autonomy & ownership: Show up, work it, and strut your stuff! Take on challenges, hone new skills, and adopt a test-and-learn mindset.
Open & collaborative culture: Build networks and expertise across functions and markets, with insightful pow-wows and valuable feedback.
Flexible work: Make work revolve around life, not the other way round. Boost efficiency with flexible arrangements that support your well-being and needs.

Roles & Responsibilities
REGIONAL MARKETING SENIOR MANAGER
SINGAPORE
Coty is one of the world’s largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. COTY is the global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics. COTY’s products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes as well as seek to minimize its impact on the environment. For additional information about Coty Inc., please visit www.coty.com.

ROLE AND DEPARTMENT
The Regional Marketing Manager is a key contributor in the Asia Pacific’s Regional Marketing team where the incumbent will be managing the full brand management aspect of the assigned brands including the acceleration of the brands’ growth in the region that encompass the right product portfolio, distributions and investments with relevant KPIs as well as ensuring ROIs. The incumbent has to focus his/her energy on ensuring the icons and pillars of the assigned continue to grow and launch new innovations strongly.
The incumbent needs to maximize the potential of the assigned brands in the Region/Markets through regular local market connect and market study to get the relevant insights to chart white space opportunities, formulate a competitive strategy to gain market share of assigned brands to provide value & guidance to the local markets to accelerate growth.
He/she will be consolidating the marketing calendar of assigned brands for the APAC region, pre-launch strategy with investment in the new innovation, and tracking their performance.

THE ROLE
New Launches’ 360 Marketing Plan
· Ambitions (Sales/Ranking/Etc)
· Communication / Publicity/ Media
· Promotions
· Sampling
· Animations
· O2O Strategy
- Post Launch Reports
- Alignment of Brand strategy with both the Local And Global Teams
- Provide guidance to local Marketing teams
- Consolidate needs of local markets to share and seek support from the Global Team
- Taking on any adhoc assignments as per assigned

We’d love to see candidates who have:
· A minimum 8-10 years of holistic marketing experience in Luxury Beauty. Regional marketing experience will be highly regarded
· Possess strong business acumen with good analytical and problem-solving skills
· Team player with strong collaborative skills, having the ability to develop effective working relationships both internally & externally and excel in a multicultural environment
· Proactive, agile, and resilient character
· Results-orientated and with proven track records

Competency

• CRM
Education

WHAT WE OFFER
This is unique role with a genuine opportunity to make an impact. You’ll get to work in a diverse and environment with a team who are passionate about the work they do and know how to have some fun along the way.

Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Associate / Assistant Manager (Credit Marketing Dept)

About The Company
Sing Investments & Finance Limited has more than 50 years of lending experience in the financing arena in Singapore. Our core activities include the acceptance of fixed and saving deposits from the public as well as the provision of loans and credit facilities to individuals and corporations, particularly the Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in Singapore. The relationships that have been built over the years have earned us the reputation as one of Singapore's trusted finance companies. We are seeking dynamic individuals to grow with us and to continue building relationships with our valued customers.
Job Description
Acquire and build a strong network of customers for loan products and credit facilities by providing one-stop financing solutions to SMEs/ large corporates including listed companies as well as personal mortgage loans
Develop new portfolio with an aim to achieve revenue and customer retention goals while increasing portfolio’s profitability through cross-selling and referral development
Achieve individual sales revenue targets
Analyse financial statements and structure credit facilities to ensure good credit quality
Strong understanding of financial compliance and regulatory requirements
Requirements:
Minimally Diploma level
2 to 5 years of proven track record in banking/ finance industry with relevant experience in a lending environment and working knowledge of mortgage loans, hire purchase financing, receivables financing or other types of loans (e.g. property development, land & construction, invoice factoring)
Preferably with an established network of business contacts especially in the SME sector or tie-up with loan/ mortgage brokers. Strong ability to source and generate leads independently
Good understanding of financial analysis is preferred
Good writing, communication and interpersonal skills
A self-starter and team player
*Corporate rank and remuneration will commensurate with experience

title: Creative Marketing Manager
company_info: BENJAMIN BARKER AUST PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Who we want
Our inhouse creative marketing team needs you – if you’re able to undertake market research, forecast business trends, understand customer patterns and manage marketing campaigns – based on human data, human insight and human behaviour.

Through creative lens.

What we need
• Creative thinking ability
• Solid analytical skills
• Sound business acumen
• Meticulous attention to detail
• Impeccable aesthetic sense
• Enthusiastic curator of cool
• Natural human collaborator and communicator
• Keen follower of all things online and offline

What we are
The Benjamin Barker Group are not just a chain of menswear stores, a bespoke tailor, an athleisure apparel brand, a Web2-2-Web3 platform bridging art, fashion and culture or a popular dining establishment.
We’re a lifestyle holding company with a human-centric focus on the art of life – from the moment you wake up to the time you head off to bed.
We’re also an equal opportunity workplace with real growth opportunities, attractive staff benefits, equal work/life balance, a strong community vibe and a genuine kampong spirit.

Who you will report to
You will report to the Chief Strategy Officer and work closely with him. You will also collaborate with a team of creative marketing professionals who are designers, thinkers, curators, content creators and workmates for life.

How we hire
Please email our Head of Human Resources with a two-page resume (in bullet point format) and a one-page write-up of what you’ll do if you were Head of Marketing of The Benjamin Barker Group.

We’d love to have a coffee with you if you fit the bill

Develop compelling brand stories and sales pitches for marketing campaigns that generate membership and sales growth, engagement, lead generation, and brand awareness.
Copy write and produce shareable and engaging digital media content, such as infographics, videos, and images, etc. that inspires and moves hearts and minds.
Collaborating with content owners to ideate and develop communications tactics and materials to facilitate the business objectives and marketing outcomes, including EDMs, Brochures, pull-up banners, standees, and video storyboards, etc.
Support content updates to creative assets, websites, mobile apps, videos, and other online and offline collaterals to upkeep branding, marketing messaging, and engagement efforts.
Execute a quarterly content marketing calendar that supports a wide variety of marketing and communications activities online.
Project manage tasks under your portfolio and help ensure that project/department milestones/goals are met and adhering to approved budgets.
Educate internal departments on best practices for social content creation and marketing.
Job Requirements
Tertiary degree or internationally recognised qualification in Marketing, Mass Communications, Public Relations, or Digital Marketing.
3 - 5 years as an individual contributor in the area of branding, content creation, and/or marketing and communications, with 1-2 years of staff management experience.
You have a proven ability to work at both strategic and tactical levels, and you're not afraid to dive into details and execute.
Strong content strategy and development skills: able to piece together disparate or silo-ed marketing campaigns or material into one overarching coherent story.
Experience running integrated marketing campaigns with both traditional and digital media in Singapore.
Proficient in Social Media Platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and YouTube; as well as Google AdWords, Google Analytics, Microsoft Excel, and pivot tables with ease to interpret the results; and familiarity with Google Tag Manager and DoubleClick Campaign Manager.
Independent, meticulous, resourceful and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as a keen eye for detail and design aesthetics.
Experience with multiple content formats from thought leadership pieces to infographics to videos to editorial is a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication in English. Good command in a second language is also preferred.
Strategic planning skills, display excellent leadership and be a good team player that is able to perform well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Confidence in suggesting new ideas and challenging senior stakeholders if required.
Please send us your detailed resume stating your expected salary and availability together with a content portfolio.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Your Role and Responsibilities:

If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for building successful alliance partnerships through innovative marketing strategies, we would love to hear from you. Join our team and play a leadership role in driving our business growth through impactful alliance field marketing initiatives across the Asia region.
In this pivotal role, you will report to the Asia Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) for Kyndryl and take charge of formulating and implementing field marketing programs and initiatives designed to elevate awareness, foster engagement, and stimulate Kyndryl’s revenue growth across the region. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, alliances, and WW marketing, to create impactful program to achieve business objectives and establish a world class program.


Role Responsibilities:

1. Lead strategic market planning with alliance partners across Asia:design, develop and execute field marketing plans to accelerate our go-to-market initiatives

2. Alignment and collaboration: Collaborate with alliance partners to align on marketing priorities and develop campaigns to maximize joint value propositions

3. Construct go-to-market business plans using MDF (Market Development Funds): Leverage market research, analyze industry trends to identify key opportunities for alliance-driven focus for Account Based Marketing (ABM) and broader marketing campaigns

4. Results-driven approach: Apply an analytical mindset to track and report on the effectiveness of alliance marketing programs, including ABM reflecting Relationship, Reputation and Signings impact

5. Compelling Content Creation: Develop compelling marketing content, including collateral, presentations, case studies, and success stories, to promote alliance offerings and differentiate joint solutions across the markets in Asia

6. Project Management Expertise: Demonstrate excellent project management skills, prioritizing multiple joint market initiatives and stakeholder management across partners and within Kyndryl

7. Performance Management: track, measure, and report on the efficacy of marketing program performance by country. Key metrics are ABM pipeline acceleration and signings impact

8. Build and maintain strong relationships with alliance partners, internal sales teams, and cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and successful execution of joint marketing programs

9. Innovative Thinking: Showcase creative thinking by developing innovative marketing campaigns and content to drive market differentiation across our hyper-scaler

10. Be a Kyndryl Brand ambassador: Promote consistent messaging, positioning, and adherence to brand guidelines in all marketing activities


Required Professional and Technical Expertise:

Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field
Proven experience in alliance marketing or channel marketing within the technology industry
Strong understanding of alliance partnerships and the ability to develop and execute joint marketing strategies. Proven track-record in delivering ABM alignment
Excellent project management skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously
Exceptional communication and presentation skills. Possess exceptional communication and presentation skills to effectively collaborate with internal and external stakeholders
Analytical mindset with the ability to track, measure, and report on marketing metrics
Results-driven mindset with a focus on achieving signing growth objectives and marketing goals
Strong relationship-building skills and the ability to foster collaboration among geo cross-functional teams and external partners

title: Manager, Social Media & Content
company_info: Klook is the leading travel and leisure e-commerce platform for experiences and services anytime, anywhere. We curate the most joyful experiences so that users can satisfy their relentless curiosity for adventure and experiences at home and around the world. With our website and app, users can experience a world of joy, from attractions, tours to local transportation and stays. Founded in 2014, we are here to inspire and enable more moments of joy through over 490,000 activities in over 1,000 destinations.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Klook
Klook is the go-to travel and leisure e-commerce platform for experiences and services anytime, anywhere. Founded in Hong Kong in 2014 out of passion for discovery, our purpose today is to inspire and enable more moments of JOY. Even when the COVID-19 pandemic hit, we held on to our conviction and successfully unlocked the domestic travel business. To date, we are already offering over 490,000 activities in over 1,000 destinations. With cross-border travel resuming, we have made it our mission to reshape the world of travel. Isn’t this exciting?!

It certainly is for our international community of over 1,200 employees, based in over 20 locations globally! Joymakers at heart, Klookers are not only curating joyful experiences for others, but also co-creating our world of joy in the Klookiverse. We are on a journey to foster a strong company culture that supports a high-performing and successful business, and we are guided by our core beliefs - Push boundaries, Ask for and give feedback, Take ownership, and Help each other - in everything we do. We are excited about building and realizing endless possibilities in the new era of travel. Care to be a part of this revolution?

Job Summary:
We are looking for a highly motivated Social Media Marketing Manager to lead our social media marketing efforts at Klook. As the Social Media Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing rich, inspiring and quality content including attraction features, seasonal highlights, and how-to-guides for the Klook website, App, and blog. You will also spearhead the local social media strategy for Klook Singapore's Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, and TikTok channels.


Key Responsibilities:
Lead a team that is responsible for the development of rich, inspiring and quality content including but not limited to attraction features, seasonal highlights, and how-to-guides for the Klook website, App, and blog
Spearhead local social media strategy for Klook Singapore's Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, and TikTok channels, as well as work with team to ensure that social calendars are aligned with business objectives
Drive paid content partnerships with local/regional media outlets such as The Straits Times, The Smart Local, etc. to create branded, episodic content
Lead conversations with Klook's preferred video production agencies or in-house video team to develop destination/attraction-specific branded content •
Develop overall tonality and copy for key seasonal campaigns throughout the year
Ensure optimization of all content through SEO and performance marketing efforts, with the aim of acquiring high quality traffic and conversions
Acquire, manage and nurture a pipeline of content affiliate partners including KOL's, bloggers and other media websites
Other duties as may arise from time to time and as may be assigned to the employee

Qualifications and Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field
At least 5 years of experience in social media marketing with a proven track record of success
Experience managing a team
Strong understanding of social media platforms and their audiences • Strong writing skills and attention to detail
Experience with paid content partnerships and working with video production agencies
Experience with content affiliate partnerships
Strong analytical skills with experience in data-driven decision making
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
If you are passionate about social media and want to join a dynamic team that is focused on driving growth and engagement, then we want to hear from you.

title: Manager, Partnership & Marketing (Insurance Services)
company_info: Klook is the leading travel and leisure e-commerce platform for experiences and services anytime, anywhere. We curate the most joyful experiences so that users can satisfy their relentless curiosity for adventure and experiences at home and around the world. With our website and app, users can experience a world of joy, from attractions, tours to local transportation and stays. Founded in 2014, we are here to inspire and enable more moments of joy through over 490,000 activities in over 1,000 destinations.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Klook
Klook is the go-to travel and leisure e-commerce platform for experiences and services anytime, anywhere. Founded in Hong Kong in 2014 out of passion for discovery, our purpose today is to inspire and enable more moments of JOY. Even when the COVID-19 pandemic hit, we held on to our conviction and successfully unlocked the domestic travel business. To date, we are already offering over 490,000 activities in over 1,000 destinations. With cross-border travel resuming, we have made it our mission to reshape the world of travel. Isn’t this exciting?!

It certainly is for our international community of over 1,200 employees, based in over 20 locations globally! Joymakers at heart, Klookers are not only curating joyful experiences for others, but also co-creating our world of joy in the Klookiverse. We are on a journey to foster a strong company culture that supports a high-performing and successful business, and we are guided by our core beliefs - Push boundaries, Ask for and give feedback, Take ownership, and Help each other - in everything we do. We are excited about building and realizing endless possibilities in the new era of travel. Care to be a part of this revolution?

The Insurance team is a relatively new team within Klook that manages our insurance products offered to customers across the region. Having created a joint venture (JV) with ZA Tech, we are in an exciting phase of growing the insurance business and team exponentially. In particular this role manages our extensive network of partners across the region, a core aspect of the business.

What you will do:
Own the partnership strategy to cultivate strong relationships with insurance industry players regionally that can support the team's product pipeline and initiatives.
Collaborate with our partners and internal teams, pushing boundaries and being creative when needed, to deliver great-value and highly relevant insurance to Klook’s customers. This may involve new product innovation and co-creation with insurers based on user research.
Gain a sound understanding of the competitive landscape to identify and monitor market trends, sales potential, and drive strong commercial negotiations.
Own the insurance marketing strategy, maintaining a close relationship with Klook's local and central marketing teams to maximise sales potential and ensure merchant success for a long-term sustainable partnership.
Secure promotional deals and sponsorships with partners to support marketing efforts. Develop forecasts, evaluate appropriate budgets, and track results of campaigns.
Be the key external representative of the team, stepping in where needed to manage conversations during implementation and further product experiment/ optimisation initiatives post-launch.
What you will need:
Min 3 years work experience with at least 2 years in a partnership role. Experience in the travel or insurance industry is a plus.
Excellent communication skills - able to communicate effectively with external and internal stakeholders across all levels, including senior managements, to build high trust and gain commitment.
Embraces challenges and uncertainty - you will be a member of a team that aims to trailblaze and push boundaries in the highly regulated insurance industry.
A champion of the team's key values - collaborative and open to feedback, experimentative and ready to fail, customer-focused and always asking what is best for the customer.

title: Channel Operations Manager
company_info: Trellix is a global company redefining the future of cybersecurity. The company’s open and native extended detection and response (XDR) platform helps organizations confronted by today’s most advanced threats gain confidence in the protection and resilience of their operations. Trellix’s security experts, along with an extensive partner ecosystem, accelerate technology innovation through machine learning and automation to empower over 40,000 business and government customers. More at https://trellix.com. McAfee Enterprise and FireEye have combined strengths and are building an extraordinary portfolio of security capabilities. address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Trellix (www.trellix.com)
Trellix is a global company redefining the future of cybersecurity. The company’s open and native extended detection and response (XDR) platform helps organizations confronted by today’s most advanced threats gain confidence in the protection and resilience of their operations. Trellix’s security experts, along with an extensive partner ecosystem, accelerate technology innovation through machine learning and automation to empower over 40,000 business and government customers.
Emerged from McAfee’s Enterprise business in July 2021, when Symphony Technology Group a leading Menlo Park-based private equity firm focused on the software, data, and analytics sectors acquired it. The brand “Trellix” was launched in January 2022.
The name “Trellix” is coined from the word trellis, a strong and safe framework to support growth of climbing plants and trees. Just like how we support our customers growth through living security. Always learning. Always adapting.

The Channel Operations Manager will be responsible for building and driving elements to support the relationship with channel partners and system integrators.

About the Role:
Plan, define and execute channel strategy aligning with the overall organization strategy.
Define, develop, and establish new channel programs with clear goals, objectives, metrics, and governance that enable immediate business operation needs as well as support long-term priorities required for partner/distribution route to market
Work closely with global partner enablement, and other cross-functional stakeholders to build and implement programs focused on Trellix partner ecosystem growth
Increase partner investments in Trellix’ s technologies, solutions, skills, marketing, and go-to-market programs
Ensure the partners have both sales and technical capability to successfully sell and promote Trellix’ s offerings
Execute a country level well-structured enablement plan for Distributors and growth/strategic partners in the region
Drive the Partner Prime series – a strategic initiative to drive key actions around the channel enablement, marketing, executive alignment, and program adoption metrics
Promote executive engagement on an ongoing basis to ensure key strategies for increasing Trellix’ s footprint in partner customer accounts
Maintain and manage the key performance indicators (KPIs) for distribution & partner route by country and overall APAC region
Lead the annual VOP initiative - Identify and analyze partner experience patterns to acts as a voice of partner (VOPs) to directionally inform relevant business groups. Leverage partner's feedback to provide input on business plans developed by the country channel team.
Maintain practice memberships (communities of practices)
Provide leadership and guidance to promote integration, collaboration, and alignment between global enablement teams and APAC; facilitate excellent communication and community development
Own partner utilization of Market Development Funds (MDF) and enable appropriate spend of MDF on marketing initiatives by being an SME on process, guidelines, and options for partners
Creating operational efficiency and agility through continuous improvement
Engage with the region partner and field marketing manager and senior sales and channel sales leadership in the region to define, prioritize, and implement marketing programs and campaigns with the local partners and alliances ecosystem, taking full account of partners’ operations and delivery model for their business users
Pro-actively address and simplify complex processes working closely with the various cross functional teams and stakeholders
About You:
A strong understanding of the Channel ecosystem.
At least 10-12 years of experience with designing partner programs, channel enablement and business intelligence
Good understanding of Trellix technology products and the ability to advocate enablement path for channel partners
Excellent communication and negotiation skills with the ability to identify customer and partner needs and to overcome challenges;
Ability to work in fast-paced environment.
Highly detailed and process oriented, strategic thinking, problem solving skills.
Company Benefits and Perks:
We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits to all of our employees.
Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage
Paid Time Off
Paid Parental Leave
Support for Community Involvement
We're serious about our commitment to diversity which is why we prohibit discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.

We are seeking an innovative marketing manager to promote our company's brand and services. In this role, you will be optimizing our marketing strategies, managing the marketing department's budget and staff, as well as preparing forecasts.

· The ability to work under pressure.
