job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services, Sciences / Laboratory / R&D, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
THE ROLE
You will be handling a portfolio of products covering crucial therapeutic areas and managing regulatory activities across the APAC region.
You should be detail-oriented and able to navigate complex regulatory requirements, while also possessing strategic thinking skills and the ability to adapt to changing circumstances.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Utilize exceptional interpersonal skills and influence to establish strong relationships with stakeholders and develop effective regulatory strategies for the long term.
Manage the product lifecycle and regional submission pipelines in an efficient manner, leveraging technical and strategic expertise.
Ensure that all regulatory processes are aligned with global standards and frameworks, while collaborating with internal and external stakeholders.
Monitor regulatory intelligence both locally and internationally, anticipate potential issues, and develop strategies to mitigate them.
Provide regulatory guidance to cross-functional teams and internal teams, as well as responses to health authorities.
Conduct regulatory assessments of new product opportunities and advise on necessary regulatory requirements for bringing them to market.
Manage regulatory projects and timelines, ensuring their timely completion.
Maintain current knowledge of regulatory requirements and changes to regulations.
Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements, including the preparation and submission of regulatory filings.
Represent the company in regulatory affairs matters and communicate with regulatory agencies on behalf of the company.
QUALIFICATION
At least 5 - 8 years' experience in the pharmaceutical industry with experience working with innovative pharmaceutical pipelines in either chemical or biological entities
Relevant Bachelor's Degree (BSc. Pharmacy is an added advantage)
Strong understanding of global regulatory frameworks and processes
INTERESTED APPLICANTS
If you area passionate about contributing to cutting-edge pharmaceutical innovations, please apply with your updated CV. Suitable candidates will be contacted for a confidential discussion regarding this exciting opportunity.
Not the right opportunity?
We're always looking out for the best talents in the life science industry. If you are currently seeking exciting opportunities within the pharmaceuticals, medical devices, in-vitro diagnostics (IVD), or consumer health industry, do reach out for a confidential chat.

title: Marketing Manager
company_info: Company Overview We are a fast growing chain-stores retailer of ladies fashion footwear. Established in 2001, PAZZION caters to the modern, sophisticated trend-setter with an uncompromising standard for taste and quality. High-caliber craftsmanship and an unwavering attention to detail mean each pair of shoes is painstakingly designed to bring you the best in style and comfort. PAZZION is available in major retail malls across SINGAPORE with its flagship outlet at Wisma Atria Orchard Road. Internationally, PAZZION’s presence can be found in Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia, Japan, Mauritius, South Korea, Thailand and Vietnam. Our Mission and Vision PAZZION’s Vision is to establish itself as a recognizable international brand, known for its high-quality products that push the envelope of fashion trends. We aim to offer trendy, fashion-forward footwear and accessories with an emphasis on quality, style and value.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Marketing Manager, you will play a crucial role in driving our brand's visibility, customer engagement, and revenue growth. You will be responsible for developing and executing comprehensive marketing strategies that integrate both online and offline channels. This position requires a strong understanding of the fashion retail industry, marketing techniques, and proven experience in creating successful marketing campaigns. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure brand consistency and maximize the effectiveness of our marketing efforts.

Responsibilities:
· Develop and implement innovative marketing strategies to drive brand awareness, customer acquisition, and sales growth.
· Plan, execute, and optimize multi-channel marketing campaigns
· Manage and analyze marketing performance metrics to evaluate campaign effectiveness and make data-driven decisions for continuous improvement.
· Collaborate with the creative team to develop compelling visual and written content that aligns with our brand voice and resonates with our target audience.
· Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and customer insights to identify new opportunities and stay ahead of market changes.
· Build and maintain relationships with key industry influencers, partners, and media outlets to maximize brand exposure and secure relevant collaborations.
· Oversee the budget allocation and resource planning for marketing initiatives, ensuring efficient use of resources while meeting business objectives.
· Stay up to date with the latest marketing trends and emerging technologies, and leverage them to enhance our marketing strategies.

Requirements:
· Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
· Proven experience as a Marketing Manager or similar role in the fashion retail industry, with strong leadership qualities and effective interpersonal skills.
· Demonstrated success in planning and executing integrated marketing campaigns that deliver measurable results.
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling marketing messages and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
· Strong analytical skills and a data-driven mindset, with the ability to interpret marketing metrics and make data-backed decisions.
· Able to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
· Passion for fashion and a keen understanding of current industry trends and consumer behavior.

Why Join Us?
· Attractive salary packages with AWS and performance bonus
· Monthly performance incentives
· Training opportunities with good career progression
· Casual dress code with positive workplace culture
· Up to 20 days Annual Leave & Birthday Leave
· Flexible Working Hours
· Complimentary company products & staff discounts
· Insurance, medical and dental benefits
· Employee referral scheme
· Annual company dinners and long service recognition

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Expanding fast fashion retailer with global investment interest seeks professional individual for the position of Retail Marketing Manager!

Budget for this role: S$7000

Job Scope
Develop marketing plans and set goals for increasing revenue, market share and brand awareness.
Lead in creating innovative and effective 360-degree marketing strategies to drive our brand presence, foot traffic and conversion in local country.
Develop and implements marketing activities and communications to promote products or services in the retail stores.
Plan the yearly retail marketing and social media calendars and budgets.
Conduct marketing research and consumer survey, analyzes the local market environment and identify opportunities for growth.
Connect and stay in touch with landlords, media & press, KOLs & celebrities for product loans, shoots and other PR opportunities.
Develop social media marketing plans and programs for each product collection and directs promotional support.
Contribute to the marketing strategy by leveraging social media to identify and acquire customers.
Collaborate with social media influencers
Create social media marketing goals and tracking related key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work with HQ Brand Centre and Retail to develop social media messaging and timelines coinciding with new product releases, ad campaigns, or other brand messages
Audit and analyse brand’s social media presence, including digital advertising budgets and ROIs
Develop & execute customer relationship management campaigns to increase customer loyalty.
Run effective campaigns and promotional activities to optimize sales growth and customer retention.
Keep our SEA retail marketing closely connected with brand strategy and guidelines, to ensure consistency of retail experience
Ensure our Direct Retail stores and Franchisee stores are aligned with Brand guidance and approved assets / experiences, working with Creative teams to deliver localisations where required.

Requirements
5 years retail marketing and / or general retail experience across online and offline
Knowledge on current marketing & fashion trends, entertainment & pop culture, retail innovation, In-depth understanding of shopper journey mapping.
Creative eye with a meticulous attention to detail.
Understanding of performance metrics and the setting / monitoring activation / initiative KPI’s
Ability to organize, prioritize, and deliver under time constraints in a fast-paced environment
Articulate with strong communication, presentation and people skills; stakeholder management is essential
Commercially astute.

Roles & Responsibilities
If you have a passion for beauty and yearns to thrive in a growing organization, come join us and help us make a change within!
This role will help to grow company revenue and profits through effective marketing strategies and tools, improving brand loyalty and expanding outreach, visibility and value. The focus is to provide support in marketing efforts through CRM, Digital / social media, special events and other avenues.
We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Digital Marketing Manager to lead our digital marketing efforts. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in developing and executing comprehensive digital marketing strategies to drive brand awareness, customer acquisition, and revenue growth.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and Execute Digital Marketing Strategy
Create and implement a multi-channel digital marketing strategy aligned with overall business goals and objectives.
Oversee and manage digital marketing campaigns, including SEO/SEM, email marketing, social media, content marketing, and paid advertising.
Propose realistic benchmarks, and develop strategies to gain a competitive edge
Develop performance goals that identify industry trends, revenue drivers, and opportunities, and discuss findings with the leadership team
Keeping abreast of the latest digital trends and continued advancements in digital technologies and marketing best practices
Content Marketing and Social Media
Plan, develop, and optimize engaging and relevant content for various digital channels, including website, blog, social media, and email marketing.
Monitor and manage social media platforms to build brand presence, engage with the audience, and drive traffic.
Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and Search Engine Marketing (SEM)
Conduct keyword research, on-page optimization, and link-building activities to improve organic search rankings.
Manage and optimize paid advertising campaigns (Google Ads, Bing Ads, etc.) to increase online visibility and drive qualified traffic.
Email Marketing
Design, implement, and optimize email marketing campaigns to nurture leads, retain customers, and drive conversions.
Monitor email performance metrics and implement A/B testing to improve campaign effectiveness.
Analytics and Reporting
Utilize web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics) to track, measure, and report on KPIs, including website traffic, conversion rates, ROI, and customer acquisition cost.
Provide regular reports and insights to management, and make data-driven recommendations for optimization.
Track and measure the performance of all marketing channels and propose optimization initiatives to maximize marketing ROI
Provide regular management updates on business performance and marketing programs efficiency, best practice sharing and improvement plans to continuously achieve the best utilization of resources and maximization of sales and revenue growth
Budget Management
Manage and allocate digital marketing budgets effectively to maximize ROI and achieve set performance targets.
Plan and manage budget across all marketing channels and platforms
Team Collaboration
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including design, content, and sales, to ensure seamless execution of digital marketing initiatives.
Collaborate with the Operation team with marketing campaigns, promotion programs/events to drive sales
Manage and guide the marketing team on the execution of marketing activities, coach them to raise their competencies and motivate them to achieve good outcomes
CRM
Track customer experiences across online and offline channels, devices, and touchpoints of a customer journey
Develop a protocol that ensures response to customer queries in a timely and effective manner, via phone, email, social media, or chat applications
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Digital Marketing, Business, or related field.
3-5 years of experience in digital marketing, with a focus on strategy development and execution.
Proficiency in digital marketing tools and platforms, including Google Analytics, SEO tools, email marketing software, and social media management tools.
Strong understanding of SEO/SEM best practices and experience with paid advertising platforms (Google Ads, Facebook Ads, etc.).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Mandarin
Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret and act on marketing data.
Creative thinker with the ability to generate innovative marketing ideas.
Why Caring Skin

At Caring Skin, we are committed to being a good company that creates great value, impacts lives with our high-quality skin care solution, and being the place of choice for customers and employees.
We believe great service starts from supporting our colleagues well. We care for one another like a family. We take pride in our work and want to continue doing good.
By joining Caring Skin, you can make a difference in the lives of others with the potential you can bring to the team, and through our holistic skincare solution.

Join us for a rewarding career path that includes:
Referral Incentives
AWS and Annual Performance Bonus
Medical benefits
Dental benefits
External training and development opportunities
Products and Services Benefits
Convenient work locations (near MRT)
Interested applicants are invited to send an updated resume along with a portfolio link to HR or click Apply Now.
You may also Text to 8779 0917.

title: MARKETING ASSISTANT MANAGER
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Marketing Assistant Manager Job Description
Our company is looking to hire a marketing assistant who will be working closely with our marketing team to develop and implement marketing plans and strategies for our brands. As a successful hire, you will be tasked with helping identify marketing trends and opportunities for growth, as well as creating marketing materials such as white papers and case studies. You will be giving presentations about our ongoing campaigns and provide administrative support to our marketing and sales teams.
To be chosen for this role, you must have a bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field. Prior work experience in administration, sales, or marketing is a plus. Effective written and verbal communication skills and a high level of attention to detail are both important keys to success in this role.
Marketing Assistant Manager Responsibilities:
Collaborating with the marketing manager, internal teams, clients and partners on marketing strategy.
Helping identify marketing trends and key opportunities for innovation.
Learning and working with various types of software for digital marketing.
Working closely with sales and marketing department.
Creating marketing materials such as white papers, case studies, and presentations.
Giving presentations.
Maintaining a marketing database.
Providing administrative support to the marketing and sales team.
Preparing, formatting and editing a range of documents.
Understanding company product and brand.
General office duties.
Creating and interpreting a variety of reports.
Organizing market research.
Analyzing questionnaires and other forms of feedback.
Updating social media accounts.
Perform any other duties assigned by the director.
Marketing Assistant Manager Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business or related field.
Administration or sales and marketing assistant experience.
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
A high level of attention to detail.
Ability to work effectively within a team and independently.
Experience using computers for a variety of tasks.
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
Good organization skills.
Related job and internship experience.
Digital marketing experience.
The ability to work under pressure.
Availability to work within opening hours (e.g. evenings, holidays, weekends).

Night Shift allowance Split Shift Allowance Over-time Paid Leave Entitlement 7-14 days (as applicable dependent on position)
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
An exciting opportunity has arrived at The Garcha Group, Singapore’s boutique hotel group currently with the following hotels:
- Maxwell Reserve, Autograph Collection Hotel (Marriott);
- Duxton Reserve, Autograph Collection Hotel (Marriott);
- The Vagabond Club, a Tribute Portfolio Hotel (Marriott);
- The Serangoon Club, a Tribute Portfolio Hotel (Marriott).

Garcha Group Benefits:
- As an associate of a Marriott hotel, you, your parents or parents-in-laws, children, spouse/domestic partner and siblings are eligible for discounts on F&B and room rates in 7,000+ hotels world-wide.
- As an associate of a Marriott hotel, you have access to the “Global Learning + Development” tool which creates for you personalized learning experiences designed to help you thrive in their Marriott career journey.
- Comprehensive Health Insurance Plan with Raffles Insurance with the option to upgrade at subsidized corporate rates.
- 2 nights yearly staycation including all meals and beverage (incl. alcoholic) in any of the 4 Garcha Group hotels in Singapore.
- 20% off Food & Beverage at all Marriott & Garcha Group restaurants and bars.
- Telephone Allowance (as applicable dependent on position)
- Transportation Allowance (as applicable dependent on position)

We are looking for candidates who can build The Garcha Group brand digitally on all platforms leading to direct measurable revenue for all hotel rooms and F&B outlets.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
- Be a brand guardian for The Garcha Group, setting the tone as well as the look & feel ofall communication.
- Create and execute social media calendar for daily content on social channels such as
Facebook and Instagram.
- Create and execute EDM schedule.
- Review and respond to all reviews on social media, Marriott and OTA channels within 24
hours.
- Initiate and maintain a yearly schedule of events for marketing campaigns.
- Plan, coordinate and execute marketing campaigns both room-side as well as F&B at
property level, enabling more customized and need based marketing.
- Create and organise photography, videography and associated editing for all marketing
needs.
- Maintain and update Marriott and "vanity" hotel and F&B websites' content to ensure all
communication is up-to-date and on brand
- Create and ensure version control of all graphic collateral assets in all departments of all
hotels and F&B.
- Coordinate PR events with and independently from PR company, and continue
relationships/partnerships.
- Assess, recommend, and develop and maintain relationships with influencers, through a
planned schedule of invitations to hotel inspections and hosted events.
- Respond to all emails within 24 hours regarding any marketing and influencer
opportunities.
- Be up to date with online, above the line, below the line market trends and new
developments.
- Actively monitor competitors' online, above the line, below the line marketing programs
- Identify other online marketing opportunities to increase brand and hotel awareness from
time to time.

Position Requirements:
- Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in the digital marketing field, of which, minimum 2 years of experience in a hotel
- Education in digital and social marketing strategies, marketing communications, advertising, and selling with a combination of proven activities.
- Recognizing current trends, marketplace attitudes and company intelligence.
- Photography, graphic design, videography and editing skills.
- Basicdesktop publishing skills including inDesign, photoshop or equivalent.
- Excellent command over written and spoken English.
- Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's Degree/Post Graduate Diploma/Professional
- Degree in Marketing, Hospitality/Tourism/Hotel Management or equivalent.
Required Skills: digital media, social media, tripadvisor, instagram, facebook, mailchimp,
photography, graphic design, luxury, travel, curiosity, Initiative, can-do attitude, intelligent,
perfect grammar, energy, well-groomed, pride

title: Marketing Designer
company_info: NATURE'S FARM PTE LTD Established in 1982, Nature’s Farm® not only dons the title of being the first, but now also one of the biggest specialty health brands in Singapore. Pioneering the introduction of Western supplements into the local market, our retail chain offers a comprehensive range of high quality nutritional foods and health supplements at great convenience and affordable prices, with products that include vitamins and minerals, organic products, sports nutrition and beauty supplements. Today, our retail stores can be found conveniently located across Singapore, Malaysia and Brunei.
job_category: Advertising / Media, Design, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
5-day work week
Paya Lebar (Onsite)

We are looking for a Marketing Designer with a strong design aesthetic and keen sense of detail to join our expanding team. Reporting to our Marketing Manager, the candidate should have a genuine drive and ambition to create compelling content that is also in line with brand guidelines.

Responsibilities
Develop creative concepts, layouts, and designs for product packaging, brochures, banners, social media posts, eDMs website visuals, and other promotional materials.
Create engaging visual content for social media platforms such as Instagram, Facebook, and Tiktok. This includes creating visually captivating posts, stories, and videos that will appeal to our target audience. Candidate should display an aptitude for filming/creating social media videos.
Create listing content such as banners, thumbnails and main body visuals for online marketplaces such as Shopee, Lazada, iShopChangi
Create visual content for the brand’s flagship online store such as hero banners, listing content and product thumbnails. Experience is using creating eDMs and executing on eDM platforms will be advantageous.
Create visual content for offline collaterals such as A1 posters, brochures, stickers, POSM including management and liaison with vendors.
Maintain and organize a directory of design assets, including templates, logos, images, and fonts and raw files to ensure consistency and easy access for future design needs.
Marketing Support tasks
Ad hoc duties assigned by manager
Requirements
Diploma/Degree in Art/design
Minimum 2 years relevant experience
Candidates who have 2D/3D animation skills will be highly advantageous
Prior experience in FMCG industry preferred but not compulsory
Prior experience in handling online marketplaces preferred but not compulsory
Proficient in Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and video editing software
Proficient in photography and video editing
Good in both Chinese and English language

title: MARKETING ASSISTANT
company: SUSTAINABLE ASSET MANAGEMENT SOLUTIONS PTE. LTD.
company_info: SUSTAINABLE ASSET MANAGEMENT SOLUTIONS PTE LTD is a privately-owned electronics waste management company headquartered in Singapore. We specialize in providing IT Asset Disposition (ITAD) and End of Life Management of ICT Products – commonly referred to or under collective heading as “Electronic Waste”. We employ a team of highly experienced and motivated personnel who possesses the expertise and business acumen of the electronics reuse and recycling enterprise. Guided by visionary leadership, we are ready to confront and overcome the ever-growing challenges and demands of this industry.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As an e-waste marketing assistant, your primary responsibility is to support the marketing team in promoting and raising awareness about the company's e-waste recycling services. You will work closely with the marketing manager and other team members to develop and implement effective marketing strategies that will drive customer acquisition and retention.

Your duties and responsibilities:
Conducting market research: You will gather and analyze data on the e-waste recycling industry, including customer preferences, market trends, and competitor analysis. This information will be used to inform marketing strategies and identify opportunities for growth.
Developing marketing campaigns: You will assist in creating and executing marketing campaigns across various channels, such as social media, email marketing, and content marketing. This may involve creating engaging content, designing promotional materials, and coordinating with external agencies or vendors.
Managing social media presence: You will help maintain and grow the company's social media accounts, including creating and scheduling posts, engaging with followers, and monitoring social media metrics. This will help increase brand visibility and engagement with potential customers.
Supporting website management: You will assist in updating and maintaining the company website, ensuring that it is user-friendly, informative, and optimized for search engines. This may involve creating and editing website content, monitoring website analytics, and implementing SEO strategies.
Assisting with event planning: You may be involved in organizing and promoting events related to e-waste recycling, such as workshops, webinars, or conferences. This includes coordinating logistics, managing event registrations, and promoting the events through various marketing channels.
Tracking and analyzing marketing performance: You will help monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and initiatives. This may involve tracking key performance indicators (KPIs), analyzing data, and preparing reports to identify areas for improvement and make data-driven marketing decisions.
Providing general administrative support: You may be required to assist with general administrative tasks, such as scheduling meetings, managing calendars, and maintaining marketing databases.

Skills and qualifications:
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
Proficiency in social media platforms and digital marketing tools
Basic understanding of SEO principles and website analytics
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
Familiarity with the e-waste recycling industry is a plus
Knowledge of graphic design software and content management systems is a plus
Overall, as an e-waste marketing assistant, you will play a crucial role in helping the company effectively communicate its e-waste recycling services to potential customers and contribute to its overall marketing objectives.

title: Senior Marketing Executive
company_info: JAL Yoga is a new yoga/pilates/barre concept studio started by people passionate about yoga practices. It has been very encouraging to see the increase in popularity of Yoga and we believe the market potential is still largely untapped in many parts of Singapore. At JAL, we believe yoga should be an integral part of one's health regimen regardless what kind of sports one engages in. Our mission is to inspire people to do what they think they cannot do with their minds and bodies so that they maintain good health to pursue their passion. As such, JAL will be introducing several new classes including 3 of those that we have patented for, to engage both beginners and regular practitioners. We are also the first in Singapore to introduce Infrared Heat Yoga what makes practising hot yoga a lot more beneficial to health and complexion! We aim to create a lifestyle brand to engage a wider community to adopt healthy living in everything they do. Our vision is to build a sustainable organisation to help under-privilege in the society eventually.
address: ST. PATRICK'S RESIDENCES, 58 ST. PATRICK'S ROAD 424218
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company Overview
Our name “Jal” means water in Hindi. Water is formless and seamless, with the ability to adapt to any form. Even in the face of obstacles, water is adaptable and rises to immense heights. This forms our core belief, which is that everyone has what it takes to be like water and adapt.
Regardless of one’s age, body shape and fitness background, one (anyone, really!) can practise Yoga, Pilates and Barre - and get more out of life.
Since 2017, we have grown to 5 studios in Singapore and 2 in Malaysia as well as built a diverse community of over 2,000 practitioners. We continue to grow and set on empowering more people to live more in life – physically, emotionally, energetically, spiritually and mentally.
We’re a passionate, dynamic and fun-loving family and are looking for like-minded individuals to join us in our calling. If you have an interest in the wellness industry and are looking for an environment to learn, grow and make an impact, this could be a perfect place for you!

Main Responsibilities
Assist the Marketing Manager in planning the branding & marketing strategy
Implement day-to-day branding and marketing activities across physical (studios & activations) and digital touchpoints (email, Google, Facebook, Instagram, website and other relevant channels) to drive acquisition, engagement and revenue growth
Collaborate with creatives to develop compelling marketing collaterals, ad copy, visuals, landing pages and other marketing communications
Analyse marketing analytics reports and optimise marketing efforts to increase marketing effectiveness and efficiency
You Should Have/Be
2-3 years of relevant work experience (marketing/advertising/PR)
Hands on experience across performance marketing channels (SEM, Paid Social) and SEO
Proficient with using marketing tools like Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google Tag Manager
Proficient in relevant tools like Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Creative Suite, WordPress
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to think and work strategically and creatively
Strong communication skills
Have a curious mindset and passion for learning
Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Team player, confident, independent, proactive, resourceful

title: Assistant Manager / Manager, Marketing

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This role is designed for mid-level working professionals (at least 6-10 years experience) with robust track record in team management, digital and performance marketing strategies, deep experience in marketing analytics, excellent interpersonal and communication abilities, strong campaign and agency management track record, focused commitment to excellence, and deep motivation to learn and grow.

If you have strong digital marketing skills (digital strategy, social, SEO, SEM, analytics, content marketing, campaigns), manage a team at work, and work closely with agencies to execute digital campaigns, you are a right fit for the position! It is an added advantage, but not a requisite, if you have worked in an agency before, in the hospitality industry, or have worked with Generation Z as your target audience.

Key responsibilities:
Oversee overall digital strategy and roadmap
Define clear marketing objectives and measurables with external agencies
Recommend marketing budget for approval and manage budget spend vis-à-vis digital campaigns with external agencies
Curate target personas, competitor social and digital landscape and customer journey to develop actionable insights
Audit content calendar and provide actionable, research-based input to curate content
Curate with vendor on onsite and offsite content for SEO purposes and strategically build backlinks and relationships with other website providers to promote SEO score
Oversee the design and production of marketing collaterals and assets
Work with external marketing agencies for on-site marketing and partnerships/sponsorships with key stakeholders such as universities
Ensure content calendar is aligned with campaign promotions, special events and festivities, and brand guidelines.
Build relationships with our external partners in Southeast Asia and Australia, manage communication lines, and oversee booking data from each partner
Strategic identification of the right marketing channel (OSEP) and the right content type based on user journey and target persona.
Develop an overall content marketing plan and digital marketing plan
Manage, report and optimise the performance of organic channels and campaigns
Manage, report and optimise the performance of paid channels and campaigns
Ownership of marketing KPIs for each content asset class and for each marketing channel (OSEP)
Promote our marketing assets and content on various marketing platforms/Channels outside of Facebook/Google
Work with agency for Search Engine Optimisation, website analytics (performance and visitor background/behaviour) and website content/branding/functionality
Work closely with agency in A/B testing to optimise ad performance
Monitor and manage cost per clicks to ensure optimised investment returns
Provide reporting fortnightly to management
Write clear briefs with specific, measurable targets for short-term promotion or engagement campaigns and facilitate implementation
Provide clear reporting on performance of short-term campaigns
Required skills and attributes:
Bachelor's degree preferably in business, data analytics or marketing with good honours OR general degree with honours with training and certification in digital marketing
Candidates with 5-8 years of experience and proven track record as a digital and performance marketing specialist
Extensive hands-on experience in campaign management tools and A/B experimentation
Experience in articulating coherent and well-defined marketing strategy paper and agency briefs
Strong in campaign and project management, with ability to work with multiple stakeholders, manage competing priorities, and meet tight deadlines
Well versed in campaign performance management, optimisation and reporting across all OSEP channels
Strong experience in working with copywriters, graphic designers and other content creators to curate brand-specific, original and impactful content that drives marketing outcomes and meet campaign goals
Technically competent in the functionalities of google analytics and search engine optimisations
Experience managing a marketing budget or a team is an advantage
Deep understanding on how to use data to optimise performance of website, Adwords, and Facebook Ad
Robust track record in building brand awareness through managing organic (shared/owned/earned) social media post and brand campaigns.
Strong Microsoft Power Point and Excel Skills desirable
Must be energetic, goal-oriented and outcome-driven with a strong bias for action
Strong content curation background and ability to chart and execute a strategic SEO roadmap
Have a customer-oriented mindset and an acumen for understanding and addressing customer needs and wants
Excellent time management and organisational skills
Dependable and proactive in follow up
Robust execution and implementation abilities
Highly independent and able to work under stressful situations

title: Manager, Product Marketing
company_info: SPH Media’s mission is to be the trusted source of news on Singapore and Asia, to represent the communities that make up Singapore, and to connect them to the world. It has several business segments in the media industry, including the publishing of newspapers, magazines, and books in both print and digital editions. It also owns and operates other businesses including radio stations and outdoor media.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a key member of the Enterprise Marketing team, this role will be responsible to effectively position and promote products to the B2B target audience, driving market adoption, and supporting the sales team with relevant marketing collateral and strategies. The ideal candidate will need to have a product marketing background and a proven ability to work independently.


Roles & Responsibilities
Product positioning and messaging: Identify the buyer personas and target audience for products. Leverage market research to understand and determine the products’ value proposition, customer needs, pain points for key segments.
Marketing collateral and content creation: Strategize and create various assets including website content, brochures, infographics, case studies, white papers to showcase product value targeting at various key segments. Develop compelling content for B2B audiences, such as blog posts, videos, thought leadership articles, events and reports.
Sales enablement: Create sales enablement assets such as sales presentations, product guides, FAQs to support the sales team in effectively communicating product value to B2B customers.
Engagement initiatives for large accounts (Education Sector): Collaborate with the sales and editorial teams to develop and implement engagement strategy to engage end users effectively to drive product usage.
Market intelligence: Conduct market research and analysis to identify new market opportunities and potential threats. Provide market intelligence to internal teams to inform decision making.
Collaboration and cross-functional support: Collaborate closely with internal teams (sales, editorial, product, customer experience, design) for alignment.
Budget Management: Monitor and track marketing spend to ensure that it remains within budget.
Requirements
At least 5 years of working experience preferably in conceptualising, proposing, planning and executing marketing campaigns.
Degree qualification in Business / Marketing or related discipline.
Strong project management, organisational and communication skills.
Written and spoken Chinese will be an advantage as part of marketing Chinese products.
Ability to work independently while meeting expectations and collaborating within teams.
Experience in event management and knowledge of digital marketing will be an advantage.

title: Senior Manager, Marketing Technology, Asia Pacific excluding China
company: STARWOOD ASIA PACIFIC HOTELS & RESORTS PTE. LTD.
company_info: Marriott International Inc. Marriott International, Inc. is a leading global lodging company with more than 6,000 properties in 122 countries and territories, reporting revenues of more than $17 billion in fiscal year 2016. Founded by J. Willard and Alice Marriott and guided by family leadership for nearly 90 years, the company is headquartered outside of Washington, D.C. in Bethesda, Maryland.
address: BANK OF AMERICA HARBOURFRONT, 2 HARBOURFRONT PLACE 098499
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Marriott International is the world’s largest hotel company, with more brands, more hotels and more opportunities for associates to grow and succeed. We believe a great career is a journey of discovery and exploration. So, we ask, where will your journey take you?

JOB SUMMARY

This role will support the Asia Pacific Marketing Technology team in planning and managing the strategic development, execution and optimization of Marriott’s members marketing and communication efforts in Asia Pacific excluding China. This person will help to analyze business data, provide insights on member behaviors, and manage implementation of projects to improve direct channel bookings and member activation across markets. This role will report to Director, Marketing Technology, Asia Pacific.

CANDIDATE PROFILE
Education and Experience
7+ years of digital marketing, digital analytics, marketing orchestration or e-commerce experience
An accredited college or university degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Marketing, Business, or related field
Experience with travel industry, hospitality and/or Internet Technology is a plus
Must be fluent in written and verbal English
Experiences applicable to the Job
Demonstrated experience with digital marketing/analytics, email orchestration, website personalization and data visualization tools
Solid understanding of database technology and data transformation
Experience in Customer Experience tools such as Adobe Campaign, Adobe Experience Platform, Adobe Journey Optimizer, or similar products
Highly advanced abilities with Excel software or similar data manipulation tools
Strong knowledge in using SQL/HTML/CSS
Ability to analyze and use data to inform decisions
Led multiple successful product and feature launch, with experience from requirements gathering to design and delivery
Demonstrated experience and success in a highly matrixed cross functional organization
Attributes
Demonstrates self-confidence, energy, and enthusiasm.
Ability to solve problems quickly, think creatively, and satisfy Internet speed-to-market requirements.
Team player that works well with counterparts from various functions/departments and ability to influence the work of counterparts without direct reporting accountability
Skilled at establishing effective relationships with internal and external parties
Sets high standards of performance for self and/or others; assumes responsibility for work objectives; initiates, focuses, and monitors the efforts of self and/or others toward the accomplishment goals; proactively takes action and goes beyond what is required.
CORE WORK ACTIVITIES
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets to come up with insights and recommendations that drive business decisions.
Manage stakeholder audience, campaign requirements and campaign deployments for Loyalty, Partnerships, and other marketing teams
Project manage and participate in testing of Martech features and functionalities either developed in Asia Pacific excluding China or rolled out to Asia Pacific excluding China
Partner with internal stakeholders and vendors to identify and enhance data feeds, tagging requirements, system integrations pertaining to Asia Pacific excluding China’s needs
Support Director of Marketing Technology in gap analysis, and roadmap for Martech in Asia Pacific excluding China
Manage reporting for stakeholder reviews
MANAGEMENT COMPETENCIES
Leadership
· Adaptability - Maintains performance level under pressure or when experiencing changes or challenges in the workplace.
· Communication - Conveys information and ideas to others in a convincing and engaging manner through a variety of methods.
· Problem Solving and Decision Making - Identifies and understands issues, problems, and opportunities; obtains and compares information from different sources to draw conclusions, develops and evaluates alternatives and solutions, solves problems, and chooses a course of action.
· Professional Demeanor - Exhibits behavioral styles that convey confidence and command respect from others; makes a good first impression and represents the company in alignment with its values.
Managing Execution
· Building and Contributing to Teams - Participates as a member of a team to move toward the completion of common goals while fostering cohesion and collaboration among team members.
· Driving for Results - Sets high standards of performance for self and/or others; assumes responsibility for work objectives; initiates, focuses, and monitors the efforts of self and/or others toward the accomplishment goals; proactively takes action and goes beyond what is required.
· Planning and Organizing - Gathers information and resources required to set a plan of action for self and/or others; prioritizes and arranges work requirements to accomplish goals and ensure work is completed.
Building Relationships
· Coworker Relationships - Interacts with others in a way that builds openness, trust, and confidence in the pursuit of organizational goals and lasting relationships.
· Customer Relationships - Develops and sustains relationships based on an understanding of customer/stakeholder needs and actions consistent with the company’s service standards.
· Global Mindset - Supports employees and business partners with diverse styles, abilities, motivations, and/or cultural perspectives; utilizes differences to drive innovation, engagement and enhance business results; and ensures employees are given the opportunity to contribute to their full potential.
Generating Talent and Organizational Capability
· Talent Management - Provides support and feedback to help individuals develop and strengthen skills and abilities needed to accomplish work objectives.
Learning and Applying Professional Expertise
· Applied Learning - Seeks and makes the most of learning opportunities to improve performance of self and/or others.
· Business Acumen - Understands and utilizes business information to manage everyday operations and generate innovative solutions to approach business and administrative challenges.
· Technical Acumen - Understands and utilizes professional skills and knowledge in a specific functional area to conduct and manage everyday business operations and generate innovative solutions to approach function-specific work challenges.
o Marketing-The ability to generate the strategy used in sales techniques, communications, and business development to positively impact customer relationships and business profitability
o Brand Management-The ability to generate marketing strategies that create brand recognition and differentiation and ultimately have a positive impact on customer relationships and business profitability.
o Communications and Media-Knowledge of media production, communication, and dissemination techniques and methods. This includes alternative ways to inform and entertain via written, oral, and visual media.
· Basic Competencies - Fundamental competencies required for accomplishing basic work activities.
o Basic Computer Skills - Uses basic computer hardware and software (e.g., personal computers, word processing software, Internet browsers, etc.).
o Mathematical Reasoning - Adds, subtracts, multiplies, or divides quickly, correctly, and in a way that allows one to solve work-related issues.
o Oral Comprehension - Listens to and understands information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.
o Reading Comprehension – Understands written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.
o Writing - Communicates effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.

title: Assistant Manager, Consumer Marketing (News Tablet)
company_info: SPH Media’s mission is to be the trusted source of news on Singapore and Asia, to represent the communities that make up Singapore, and to connect them to the world. It has several business segments in the media industry, including the publishing of newspapers, magazines, and books in both print and digital editions. It also owns and operates other businesses including radio stations and outdoor media.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This position is suited for a highly motivated individual to develop and implement marketing strategies to grow SPH News Tablet digital subscriptions in the consumer (B2C) segment.This role is supported 360° by multiple teams across the company, such as Product, Data Science, Digital Strategy & Creatives
Identify and engage key target segments to grow the digital subscriptions. This will entail developing marketing programs and planning digital campaigns to reach out to these segments, grow brand awareness and create demand, the objective of which is to drive home subscriptions and leads
Formulate effective above and below the line advertising, as well as data strategies that will drive results to meet the set targets
Oversee the implementation of B2C acquisition campaigns
Working closely with the Digital Strategy team, the Customer Experience team and the Corporate Sales team, you will develop ongoing forecasts, analytics, reporting & optimisation on digital product performance to acquire consumer subscriptions
Management of internal stakeholders across divisions for News Tablet projects involving Product teams, Editorial teams, and Partnership teams
Identify appropriate business partnership opportunities for sponsorship tie-ups to drive product sampling to target segments
Liaise with the creative agencies (internal and external) to develop effective communications and marketing concepts to drive subscriptions and leads
Provide support in both physical and digital event management such as launches, promotions, webinars and roadshows through event planning and implementation, to drive subscriptions
Management of business operations for the News Tablet business - tablet inventory management, management of external partnerships, and monthly internal business reporting.
Manage 3 teams that will be supporting acquisition efforts - Creative Design, Marketing Execs. & Performance Marketeers
Required Qualifications
A recognized degree or diploma, preferably in Business Administration/Marketing with at least 3 years of relevant experience
A team player with a proven track record of conducting B2C promotions and campaigns (B2B marketing is a bonus)
Strong written, communication and copywriting skills in English
An independent worker who works well in a cross-functional team environment
Confident, resourceful and works well under pressure
Ability to resolve conflicts and stay focused on achieving the targets
Experience in the use of enterprise email marketing platforms and analytics tools such as Google Analytics (GA) is a plus
Experience in the use of marketing platforms such as Meta, Google and LinkedIn (TikTok is an advantage)
Strong attention to detail and meticulous with numbers
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Some levels of experience and proven success in negotiating for sponsorship deals would be an advantage
Having a good sense of design aesthetics and creativity plus some experience with design would also give the candidate an edge
Required Competencies / Skills / Knowledge
Digital marketing
Stakeholder management
Media planning
Leadership
Project management
Creative ideation
Campaign planning

title: Snr Executive / Asst Manager, Growth Marketing
company_info: SPH Media’s mission is to be the trusted source of news on Singapore and Asia, to represent the communities that make up Singapore, and to connect them to the world. It has several business segments in the media industry, including the publishing of newspapers, magazines, and books in both print and digital editions. It also owns and operates other businesses including radio stations and outdoor media.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a member of the Enterprise Marketing team, this role will be responsible for planning and launching lead generation campaigns targeting businesses and schools across owned and paid media. This will help to generate leads for subscriptions and revenue growth. The ideal candidate will need to have a growth marketing background and a proven ability to work independently.

Roles & Responsibilities
Lead generation campaigns: To develop and execute lead generation campaigns across various online and offline marketing channels (email marketing, content marketing, social media, events, and partnerships) to drive customer acquisition and revenue growth.
Customer and lead database strategy: Develop and implement customer and lead database strategy to ensure accurate and up-to-date information to gather insights for targeted marketing campaigns. Analyze customer data to identify opportunities for upselling, cross-selling and renewal initiatives.
Marketing analytics: Monitor, analyse and report the performance of lead generation campaigns (key performance metrics: conversion rates, cost per lead) to identify areas for improvement and optimization. Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to optimise marketing tactics.
Collaboration and cross-functional support: Collaborate closely with internal teams (sales, editorial, product, customer experience, design) for alignment.
Budget management: Monitor and track marketing spend to ensure that it remains within budget.
Requirements
At least 2 years of experience in Growth Marketing or related roles.
Degree qualification in Business / Marketing or related discipline.
Previous hands-on experience in running digital campaigns.
Data-oriented in measuring campaign performance.
Strong project management skills.
Strong organisational and communication skills.
Ability to work independently while meeting expectations and collaborating within teams.

title: Assistant Manager, Group Marketing, Communications and Branding
company_info: Meinhardt Group is one of the world’s largest integrated engineering company which provides engineering capabilities in Infrastructure and Environment; Structures; Mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing (MEP); Project Management; and Planning and Urban Development. Our specialist capabilities cover Façade Engineering; Environmentally Sustainable Design (ESD); Specialist and Architectural Lighting; Fire Performance Engineering; Integrated Design Management; and Mission Critical Facility Design. Headquartered in Singapore, we currently employ over 3500 staff located in 38 permanent offices across Australia, Asia, Middle East, North Africa, UK and Europe.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a dynamic individual to join our team managing Meinhardt Group’s brand and reputation. The team is responsible for conceiving, developing and implementing strategies to position Meinhardt Group as a global consultancy powerhouse delivering global design, engineering, project and construction management services and solutions.

Meinhardt is one of the world’s few multi-disciplinary and truly integrated engineering, infrastructure and project management consulting firms. Since 1955, the firm has led the way in delivering innovative and highly cost-effective designs that always consider our clients’ commercial objectives and global environmental concerns. Owned and headquartered in Singapore, Meinhardt employs over 5,000 staff in more than 55 offices worldwide and have worked on some of the largest and most complex building and infrastructure projects globally. Annually, the Group undertakes projects worth an estimated US$25 billion and ranks among the largest independent engineering firms globally by revenue. We aspire to be the world’s preferred infrastructure and urban solutions partner.

Role and Responsibilities:
Support the Group Marketing, Communications and Branding Team in driving strategic marketing and communications planning and execution, coordinating marketing and communications approaches for consistency and impact, and ensuring quality outcomes.
Develop themed narratives for coherent branding and messaging across the Group.
Ensure that all internal and external communications, multi-media assets, presentations and corporate collaterals align with the core narratives and business objectives.
Drive creative content strategy, stakeholder engagement and community outreach through a range of platforms including but not limited to marketing and brand sponsorships and partnerships; awards; speaking engagements, industry associations and events.
Provide marketing, communications and branding counsel and support to business leaders for their stakeholder engagements, both internal and external.
Collaborate actively with all entities and subsidiaries across geographies for greater impact.
Keep pace with the media landscape and trends to anticipate and maximise media engagement opportunities.
Leverage data and extract insights to build and manage our social media community, increase digital engagement through compelling content and drive interest in the Group as a global consulting powerhouse; Keep our tone of voice, personality and visual identity fresh and engaging.
Develop and drive the overall digital marketing and communications strategy.
Implement marketing, communications and branding activities across a range of digital channels (including website, social media, EDM).
Plan, implement and track digital marketing campaigns.
Community management for the group’s social media properties, currently Linkedin, Facebook and YouTube.
Track our digital outcomes via a monthly digital scorecard and conduct regular reporting of ongoing campaigns; Monitor, analyse and report online traffic and social media engagement.
Manage video and podcast production, as part of the group’s efforts to increase the use of visual and digital storytelling.
Work with a digital marketing solutions provider to:
- Create, adapt, improve and optimise the group’s website via SEO.
- Conduct research and analysis on industry trends, client needs and competitors.
Support the planning and execution and manage the audio-visual requirements of corporate and CSR events and activities.
Produce and manage the Meinhardt e-newsletter for clients, partners and prospects.
Review and assess the effectiveness of the Group’s marketing, communications and branding tactics and regularly find ways to improve our efforts.
Explore unconventional vehicles for brand-building outside more familiar tactics.
Assume all assigned duties.
Requirements:
Eight or more years of marketing, corporate communications, public affairs or journalism experience in high profile industries.
Prior three to five years’ experience managing digital channels.
Bachelor’s degree.
Experience in leading teams and collaborating with colleagues across diverse business units and borders.
Aptitude for building strong partnerships and influencing stakeholders in order to meet the Group’s objectives.
Solid understanding of the media landscape and a proven track record in media management and public affairs.
Strong thinking skills, with the ability to distil pertinent issues, identify challenges and develop appropriate responses.
Good grasp of the full range of marketing and communications tactics available in the digital world.
Understanding of web analytics and tracking and search engine optimisation.
Familiarity with web content management systems such as WordPress.
Knowledge of tools for website management.
Experience in online listening and social media community management.
Excellent written communication and strong verbal and presentation skills in English.
Ability to work independently and at the same time, effectively across teams.
* We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

title: Marketing Manager / Assistant Marketing Manager
company_info: voco Orchard Singapore is the newest IHG hotel to open in Singapore, and the first voco hotel to open in Southeast Asia. The name 'voco' derives from the Latin word for ‘to invite’ or ‘to come together’, and the very first thing you’ll notice at voco Orchard Singapore is the warmth of the welcome. Both informal and indulgent at the same time, our hotels each have their own character inspired by their location, and all feature playful, personal touches that guests remember long after check-out. Our guests are the kind of people who know exactly what they want whether they’re travelling for work or pleasure and appreciate the time and space to really indulge and enjoy. Located at the start of Orchard Road in Singapore, the hotel provides a stay in the heart of the city with exciting dining, shopping and entertainment options right on its doorstep. Comfortable guest rooms and suites offer city views and ample space to work or relax, and award-winning restaurants and MICE facilities enhance the experience. Our warm intuitive voco hosts are ready to tailor-make incredible and memorable cosmopolitan experiences in the heart of Singapore, bringing to guests the best of dining and entertainment experiences.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What is the job?

voco Orchard Singapore is seeking a dynamic and passionate Marketing Manager / Assistant Marketing Manager to be part of this exciting rebranding project. As Marketing Manager / Assistant Marketing Manager, you will assist the Marketing department to deliver the marketing objectives and activities of the hotel. To assist in the implementation and monitoring of brand standards. Support and assist the Marketing department in managing client base of PR and media relevant to the hotel and also supporting the hotel in achieving optimal business results, attracting and retaining customers, and increasing awareness of the hotel within the various markets.

Your day to day

FINANCIAL RETURNS
Align the Marketing Plan to the Revenue Plan ensuring promotion of the hotel leads to achieving revenue targets.
Assist the Director of Marketing to manage the marketing budget of the hotel.
Assist the hotel’s marketing and promotional activity to ensure the successful capture of business opportunities.
PEOPLE
Maintain a good working relationship with other departments, employees, and guests.
Encourage teamwork and spirit in all areas of the department
Promote teamwork and quality service through daily communication and coordination with other departments.
Provide guidance and advice to (any) line staff to improve performance where necessary.
Assess line staff performance reviews with Restaurant Managers.
Interact with outside contacts:
Guests – to ensure their total satisfaction
Vendors – to ensure adequate inventory of supplies and equipment, to discuss pricing or service issues, to resolve any vendor performance issues, etc.
Regulatory agencies – regarding safety and compliance matters
Other contacts as needed (professional organizations, community groups, local media)

GUEST EXPERIENCE
Regularly review and update Offer categories for maximum ease of use and customer journey.
Regularly review and analyse guest and social media reviews and provide timely responses in accordance to IHG guidelines
Maintain and update hotel website and social media pages to ensure updated information
RESPONSIBLE BUSINESS
Support in building relationships with the local community and media to ensure a strong local brand for the hotel.
Assist in coordination of media familiarization stays and media reviews.
Assist in press nights / launch parties or other entertainment as dictated by direct reports.
Assist in the coordination of events such as launches, signing ceremonies and press conferences.
Maintain up-to-date photo files of hotel facilities and key personnel.
Coordinate all arrangements for photographers on assignment at the hotel.
Handle incoming calls and answer press inquiries on hotel events and information.
Ensure press releases are sent to all local and overseas newspapers and magazines on all happenings/events in the hotel.
Be the main point of contact for all activities concerning publicity in film shooting, photo shooting, interviews by local & oversea media as well as any contracted advertising agency.
Champion, produce and roll out corporate and regional products and services at hotel level.
Ensure stock inventory of an updated photo library and press kit is up to date.
Coordinate with the printing, design as well as adherence to the corporate guidelines for all printed materials of the hotel.
Perform other duties as assigned.

What we need from you
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or Hospitality Management or any other related degree
5 years’ related experience in a similar position in an international hotel chain.
Must speak and write fluent English; other languages will be an advantage
Proficiency in MS Office and Canva. Knowledge of other software such as Photoshop would be an advantage
Strong presentation and communication skills.
Team Player and excellent interpersonal skills
High level of passion, enthusiasm and drive for result

What we offer

We’ll reward all your hard work with a great salary and benefits – great room discount and superb training.

Join us and you’ll become part of the global IHG family – and like all families, all our individual team members share some winning characteristics. As a team, we work better together – we trust and support each other, we do the right thing and we welcome different perspectives. You need to show us you care: that you notice the little things that make a difference to guests as well as always looking for ways to improve - visit www.http://careers.ihg.com to find out more about us.
IHG is an equal opportunity employer: Minorities / Females / Disabled / Veterans.

title: Digital Marketing Manager (Electronics MNC, East)
company_info: RecruitPedia is an innovative, efficacious recruitment solution provider headquartered in Singapore. We are constantly expanding and our trained headhunting consultants are distinguished by their extensive international industry knowledge and experience. It will be our greatest honour to be able to guide you along the ever-changing job market and assist you step-by-step with any challenges you face along the way. RecruitPedia believes that all our clients and candidates deserve excellent service and strives to be the best and trusted service provider.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
company_info: Our ethos is Making the Leap. We stand for something different in the media agency landscape. We reject the notion media is purely about size and scale – instead, our model is grounded in strategic planning. PHD was launched in London by David Pattison, Nick Horswell and Jonathan Durden (the P, H and D in PHD) as the first planning-led media agency in 1990. We quickly gained recognition for being the world’s most forward thinking strategically led media agency. We established PHD Singapore in 2003 and quickly grew to now approx. 100 staff. With an ever-growing list of high-profile clients, today PHD is one of the most acclaimed media and communication agency networks. We are the 2nd most awarded Media Agency Network in the world, according to the 2018 Gunn Media 100 report. Our offices around the world are recognised, too – from PHD US being named Media Agency of the Year 2017 by Ad Age, to our founding office in the UK making it on to the Sunday Times ‘Best Company to work for’ list for four consecutive years. Our culture is underpinned by our values of Collaboration, Curiosity and Courage. We substantially invest in our people and nurture a positive and supportive environment for all. Career progression is at the core of our People agenda, as such we offer a comprehensive development program as well as training for staff at all levels and a number of tailored learning opportunities. PHD supports a healthy, fun and balanced culture through our many initiatives – Make your personal leap and apply to find out how you can be part of this challenger agency network. The PHD network is part of the Omnicom Media Group (www.omnicommediagroup.com), a division of Omnicom Group Inc. (NYSE: OMC)
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PHD Media is part of the Omnicom Media Group, one of the world's largest media services conglomerates. The agency provides strategic media planning and buying services to clients across different industries, helping them reach their target audiences and achieve their marketing objectives. In Singapore, PHD Media offers a range of media services to local and international clients. Our services include media planning, media buying, audience research, digital media strategies, programmatic advertising, social media marketing, and measurement and analytics.

Working for PHD Singapore:
At PHD we value curiosity, courage, creativity, and openness - We live and breathe our values every day and look for people who will do the same. With people & talent being our most valuable asset, we value keeping them up to date with the latest developments in the landscape, both locally and globally. To achieve this, we emphasize training and development programs through workshops, training courses and more to enhance their skills and knowledge. Cultivating a culture of continuous learning and experimentation, our employees are encouraged to share their ideas and test new approaches to media and communications.
We are part of OMG which has been awarded as “Best Company to Work for in Asia” two years in a row and we were nominated and awarded for being the “Most Caring Company in Asia” in 2022.

Working at PHD Singapore you get:
Flexi Benefits (From prescriptive spectacles to hotel stays or even a baking class if you will). Quarterly & Monthly interactive sessions led both internally and externally (Usually accompanied with food & drinks).
Events organized by the social committee (our very own Chief Happiness Officers).
Trainings such as our LEAP / SPRINT programme so you can grow & advance your career.

Job Scope:
Lead the planning, setup, and execution of full funnel campaigns.
Oversee campaign budget spends, updating the strategy, and troubleshoot accordingly.
Understand the complexities of campaign performance and evaluate growth to identify opportunity gaps.
Provide recommendations and executional strategies for new opportunities, campaign structuring, targeting, display network, and other facets of digital marketing in accordance with client goals.
Identify & develop new opportunities, working closely with the internal teams and agency partners.
Manage and develop a team who are responsible for executing the campaigns and hitting KPIs.
Strong communicator and storyteller, possesses excellent verbal, written and presentation skills derived from data.
Work with Head of Performance Marketing and Business Director, to set and execute the affiliate marketing strategy and roadmap for a global set of clients.
Develop financial models and review competitive reference points to determine effective commission structures for both managed affiliate accounts and long tail affiliates.
Make recommendations on affiliate marketing platforms and tools to utilize.
Build affiliate channel lead generation, conversion, and revenue projections, and align yourself and the team you build around weekly and quarterly goals to meet those projections.

Requirements
4 - 5 years of experience in digital performance marketing, partner marketing, and related disciplines, with minimally 2 to 3 years of experience directly managing multi-million-dollar revenue online affiliate marketing programs.
Advanced proficiency with SEM reporting and analytical tools, especially Google AdWords, AdWords Editor and Google Analytics.
Strong knowledge of platform algorithms.
You must have a strong, analytical, and data-driven background, including direct experience with marketing analytics OR digital performance marketing.
Dependable and independent lead who is data-driven, process and KPI-oriented
You must have a strong bias for action and a competitive, results-driven mentality. You must be extremely persistent by nature and unwilling to lose or leave problems unsolved.
You must have experience with affiliate tracking and reporting platforms.
Experience in travel and airline category is a PLUS.
You must have excellent verbal and written communication skills. Full professional proficiency of a 2nd language is a PLUS, especially for these languages Indonesia Bahasa or Japanese or Korean.
Demonstrated ability to build relationships and drive results through affiliate partnerships.

Roles & Responsibilities
Role Summary
Reporting directly to the Country Manager, Singapore, the incumbent is responsible for overseeing the Systems & Channel Marketing Team, responsible for all related product lines and marketing activities, including but not limited to:
• Conceptualizing Marketing Plans and Strategies (Marketing Road-Map)
• Market Research and Competitor Analysis
• New Product Development / New Product Launches
• Preparing Sales and Marketing Reports
• Preparing Content and Input for Communication Tools
• Brand Management
• Improve Customer Relationships
• Provide Key Insight for Customers/Sales Growth
• Budgeting

Role Responsibilities

Marketing
· Acquire deep product knowledge on the specific product lines (Legrand Product) and support training, events, product launches, presentations, and communication tools.
· Generate reports on market, competition and sales analysis.
· Pro-actively monitor competition and undertake price comparisons of the product ranges
· Monitor the product portfolio life cycle
· Support sales team with all related activities with partners (distributors, retailers, consultants, etc)
· Execute marketing activities for product launches, exhibitions, showrooms
· Support creation of marketing tools by providing product information and recommending technical features
· Prepare in collaboration with SBU, USP (Unique Selling Points) and specification documents to support sales team in their specification work
· Support events management in collaboration with Country Manager, Singapore when needed.
· Organize internal and external training on Legrand Product.
· Create content and tools for online and offline platforms (including mailing list, EDMS, etc)
· Liaise regularly with Country Manager, Singapore or Marketing Team.
· Prepare and submit yearly budget related files and quarterly marketing reporting

Customers

· Visit customers regularly to assist sales team in specifying Legrand solutions and maintain sharp and effective market perception
· Define promotions on selected customers defined by Sales and Marketing
· Any other ad-hoc duties as and when required

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
(I) Marketing and Sales Functions

a) Budget plan
o Gather accurate data for developing half-yearly budget plan.
o Follow up with customers to achieve sales as per budget plan.
o Study & Understand the Budget plan allocated to the team, work toward achieving the budget plan and target that set forth.
o Organise discussion & recovery plan on the budget plan gap with immediate supervisor.

b) Sales & Marketing Activities
o Obtain latest product / line-up information & demos from HQ.
o Obtain customer / market information in region of responsibility.
o Map customers to product roadmap of Company’s Strategy.
o Introduce company’s latest technologies to relevant customers.
o Arrange demos to individual / group customer (marketing event).
o Identify best strategy / business model for each customer / product.
o Coordinate efforts with biz partners to realise business (based on business model).
o Track and facilitate customer project development.
o Obtain / negotiate pricing with HQ to win sales order.
o Negotiate pricing with Customers to maintain profitability as set forth.
o Gather latest updates information from customers and update to internal system.
o Plan buffer stock based on customer MP schedule and company’s components supply.
o Follow up and ensure payment as per customer credit ratings.

c) Sales and Marketing Report
o Project sheet update / Sales Analysis Report / Sales Trips Report or any adhoc report.
o Help and Coordinate with Market research activities based on supervisor instructions
o Provide marketing report on market / product / country specific whenever deemed necessary.

(II) Internal Communications

d) Interface with HQ
o Obtain new technologies and product roadmap from HQ
o Arrangement of samples (new product) and demo from HQ.
o Price negotiation with HQ if our buying price cannot meet customer request price or market pricing
o Delivery negotiation if customer facing delivery problems
o Market information sharing and update with HQ counterpart.

e) Interface with Inter-departments
o Regular meeting and planning with PSI group on delivery / demand input
o Close communication within Sales & Marketing Dept. to ensure sales objective is met and sharing of marketing / customer information.
o Keep communication with AR (Accounts) to ensure payment delivery is being met and review on customer financial status regularly
o Close interface with Customer Service team to ensure delivery commitment to customer and pull-in activities to increase sales.
o Interface with Technical Team to develop demo & jig/ support product information/ samples/ communication with Japan engineers.

REQUIREMENT
• Min Diploma qualification with relevant areas of studies
• At least 3 years working experiences in sales & marketing related activities
• Knowledge of Electronics Components; Display / LCD will be an added advantage.
