title: Senior Marketing Manager – Haircare, APAC & GCN
company_info: At Dyson we are focused on solving the problems that others have ignored; solving them first using our technology and ingenuity. In order to achieve this we need to pioneer technologies that are different and authentic. This is the core of what we do and who we are. We must strive to create the future, every single day by developing new things, different things, things that go against the grain with a diverse and global team of ingenious minds. Dyson employs over 13,000 people and is present in more than 80 countries. And while we are growing fast we want Dyson to remain a start-up in spirit with the freedom of experimentation and learning, constantly reinventing our products as well as reinventing how we work, how we sell and how we support our owners. At the same time we are working through the James Dyson Foundation, James Dyson Award and Dyson Institute to inspire future engineers and pioneering a new approach to engineering education. Underlining everything we do in this diverse environment is the need to always show respect, supporting each other as one team to overcome whatever challenges we encounter. We drive empowerment, development and equality in an inclusive environment for our people around the world. The future doesn’t just happen, we look to make it happen, to achieve leaps through pioneering new ideas. This is an exciting time to join a growing company. If think your experience matches any of these roles, we should talk.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About us
Working as an expert within the APAC & GCN region they will gather local market insights to initiate new projects or optimise existing projects for their region. They will be accountable for delivering strategic solutions to projects that are appropriate for their regions and enabling opportunities in market to be identified within the categories annual Statement of Work (SoW). This will involve developing the communications and marketing strategy for the category in region for the next 2-4 years, ensuring campaign messaging is innovative, financially sound and successful in market. This role will work closely with the other Category Leads to ensure local campaigns are aligned with product launches and other campaigns and that the local voice is heard in global launches.


About the role
Senior Commercial Manager – Haircare, APAC & GCN will always have the questions below in the forefront of their minds when making decisions:
How will our products and campaigns succeed in market?
Does this work support the strategic objectives for the region for the next 1-3 years?
re the insights and objectives for a project thoroughly thought out and considered in context with the wider strategy of the category?
How can I ensure the consumers view of the category is supported with individual projects and the supplementation of market specific insights?
Are we on the right path to deliver our commercial goals? What interventions need to be made for our plan in this market in the short, mid and long term?
Strategy:
The role takes ownership for the development of the category for the next 2-5 years for a given region. The role works closely with the Category Leads (CoE and NPD) to set to plan the direction for the category in region and the annual plan for the markets.
The SCM is responsible for supporting local regions in developing their plans to hit the category’s business objectives and for being their voice for driving projects forwards which hold significant strategic importance. Making sure that markets are clear on global category strategy and optimising it based on local insights. Works closely with markets to support the launch of new markets.
This role is responsible for identifying local insights, consumer behaviour and media insights that can ensure that projects will work for the local regions across Campaigns & NPD.
Campaigns & Activations:
Work closely with market teams in region to ensure that specific local insights and consumer information is being used to generate new projects and optimise briefs as appropriate. Work with markets and COEs to develop and lead on local and regional activations (incl. campaigns, media, claims, product iterations, tacticals) to support key local priorities and these insights to grow the regions. Interrogate local market thinking to ensure that what markets want is right for the region and category. Optimise these ideas where appropriate. Monitor performance of campaigns across markets.
Work closely with Brand Managers and Marketing Directors within region to ensure that local thinking is being fed into annual planning and the generation of new projects.
Work with the Group GTM team to ensure that local market insights and needs are satisfied by the project brief.
Track category performance via market data (e.g. NPD or GfK) to i. We understand market performance what is driving it (or not), translate these insights into actions in market and feed this back into the Group teams. ii. Monitor the competition and develop strategy and plans to continue growth in all subcategories in all markets. iii. Ensure that market specific insights are being fed into the GTM team within category to ensure that projects are being developed with local direction in mind. Specifically assist development during the Define Phase of projects.
NPD & Range:
Work closely with Category Managers within region to ensure that local insights is being fed into annual planning and the generation of new projects. Continuously feed these insights into NPD and NPI and ensure these are considered in new project development.
Ensure markets have the right plans to launch NPD and monitor launch performance. Work closely with the NPD team to define SKU strategy, launch sequencing, asset requirements, launch strategy.
Sit on the steering committee for the category to ensure that the correct projects are being prioritised with the available resource.
Work with the Senior Commercial Manager (NPD) to ensure that product development considers local market input and opportunities are identified for specific nuances within the campaign where possible.
Work with the Senior Commercial Manager (NPD) in region and Commercial Manager to ensure that local market insights and needs are satisfied by the project brief.
Coach Commercial Managers and Commercial Executives (Group Commercial – CoE) on the strategic development of the wider category. Demonstrate how their product/projects are (or are not) enabling the category to deliver the wider category strategy.
Work closely with Head of Markets on global, regional and local ranging to ensure markets needs are included in annual ranging and global launches, and that all finance, tactical and resource implications are considered.
Planning & Regional performance:
Ensure that markets are forecasting their plans into the 18 month horizon. Work closely with markets to adapt plans in order to hit the aligned commercial goals for market and category. Balance both long-term planning with the requirement to be nimble and adapt when we have to.
Work closely with Programme Managers to ensure that projects are achievable based on our internal resource.
Work closely with Finance and Supply Chain to monitor regional performance.
Analyse local market performance and forecasting.
Highlight discrepancies in forecasting and supply chain ii. Instigate gap fill plans where appropriate
Analyse market performance in relation to future capacity and CAPEX requirements to ensure business cases and long-term planning reflects the region’s requirements.
Track category performance via market data (e.g. NPD or GfK) to i.Identify trends in seasonality and pricing ii. Highlight sub-category performance and make recommendations on how it impacts capacity and future component purchasing.
Stakeholder engagement:
Builds strong trusted relationships with markets team, leads on collaboration and alignment to drive category growth in all markets.
Works closely with NPD, NPI, Campaigns, Finance, Supply, Ops, Markets.

About you
Proven track record of challenging the status quo, and deliver innovating solutions to the problems that we face
You will have extensive experience of driving product strategy on a global scale, and have experience working with international markets
You will have extensive campaign management experience.
You will have been at the forefront of driving customer engagement and thought leadership within your recent roles
You'll also have a proven experience working with cross functional teams that are based in different locations and the ability to build cross-functional relationships and deliver results through aligned business functions.

title: Marketing Executive / Manager
company_info: Epigram Books is an independent publisher based in Singapore, known for putting out well-designed books championing Singapore stories and authors. Our range of books is as broad as it is broad-minded. We publish all manner of fiction—from picture books for children, to chapter books for teenagers, comics for the visual readers, playscripts for theatre-goers, poetry, novels and short story collections for literature lovers. Our recipe books and food guides reflect Singapore’s obsession with food, and increasingly, we are also looking at creative non-fiction, art and photography books. Why we publish? To indulge in our love for literature To put Singapore in your hands To provide jobs To contribute to the arts To champion local stories and authors To discover the soul of Singapore What we’re proud of (just to name a few) Ministry of Moral Panic by Amanda Lee Koe, winner of the 2014 Singapore Literature Prize for Fiction and longlisted by the Frank O’Connor International Short Story Award Let the People Have Him by Loke Hoe Yeong, the first (of a two-part) biography of veteran opposition politician Chiam See Tong LKY: Political Cartoons by Morgan Chua, showcasing art and satire on the most famous man in Singapore The Diary of Amos Lee series by Adeline Foo, best-selling chapter book series about Singapore’s most famous toilet diarist Monsters, Miracles and Mayonnaise by drewscape, which includes the Eisner-nominated short, Moving Forward Ten Sticks and One Rice by Koh Hong Teng and Oh Yong Hwee, bronze winners of the International MANGA Award
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You are an avid reader, loves books and are determined to make a difference in the local publishing field. You are charismatic, speak and write well, and have an infectious enthusiasm for all things literary. You are happy to work towards a cause greater than yourself, gleaning rewards that tend toward the intangible and sometimes the inexpressible.
Come join Epigram Books : one of the most ambitious and exciting Singaporean publishers to emerge in recent years.
Marketing duties
· Create and execute campaigns and events for new and backlist titles
· Maintain excellent author relationships by attending to author enquiries and supporting authors at book-related events at literary events or at our Epigram Coffee Bookshop
· Arrange author appearances, book launches and promotional events
· Commission, execute and/or oversee the production of marketing collaterals including video book trailers, social media graphics, book information sheet,
· Budget and account for marketing expenses
· Manage distribution of review copies, catalogues and marketing collaterals
· Assist in sales conferences, book fairs, bazaars, pop-up sales, festivals, and other roving events
· Work with sales colleagues to organise and initiate promotions on the online bookshop
· Represent the publisher at meetings and oversee communications with booksellers, stockists, agents, festival managers, and other friends of the book industry
Publicity duties
· Write and distribute engaging press releases
· Secure print and online coverage and reviews
· Contribute to social media outreach
· Maintain and strengthen media contacts and mailing list
· Schedule and produce newsletter and emailers
Our ideal person
· Has a finger on the pulse in the literary world
· Possesses familiarity with Microsoft Suite and Adobe software such as Photoshop, InDesign and After Effects
· Able to start sooner than later
· Possesses a dash of wit and strong written and verbal communications skills
· Has at least a diploma or degree in marketing, advertising, communications or equivalent
· Is a consummate salesperson, persuaive and charming
· Ready to jump in and tackle challenges with gumption
· Gets a thrill from executing the perfect campaign or event
· Can bend time and space to get things done
· Thinks well beyond what’s asked of you
· Is tech and social media savvy and are best friends with Mailchimp, Shopify, Facebook, Youtube, Instagram, Twitter and co. You don’t have to be familiar with everything, but you will need to be able to upload new skills on the fly
· Passionate about getting more people to read and buy books (preferably ours)
· Able to commit to evening and weekend book events
· Doesn’t rest on your laurels
· Lives and breathes the minutiae of the work, but also has a life outside of it
What you get from working with us
· A fair wage for meaningful work
· An open-concept office in that is a home, a library and a gallery all rolled into one
· An education in literary community building, writing, design and, occasionally, cooking
· Flexible work arrangements and employee support schemes (modest but well-meaning entitlements)
· The joy of working with a bunch of wonderful people
· Fascinating lunchtime conversations
· The occasional champagne and tiramisu
Please submit
· A detailed resume
· Expected salary
· Availability
· Some examples of your writing or work, if possible
A list of five of your favourite books and why.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Finance Strategic Planning Manager (1 year contract, extendable)

Our client, a leading tech firm, is seeking a highly quantitative, detail-oriented, and strategic individual to drive forward fully integrated marketing planning, marketing strategy and marketing operations for the APAC International Marketing team.

This role requires a unique blend of deep analytical skills and a strategic mindset to drive forward the annual planning process for APAC International Marketing team, across the audiences of Product, Business, Consumer & Creator.

RESPONSIBILITIES
· Drive the APAC 2024 Strategic Planning process - working closely with Head of Marketing Strategy & Operations, IM APAC Director, IM APAC Leadership team, and global teams, to gain alignment for 2024 priorities
· Partner with Finance and Strategic Planning & Operations (SP&O) on the budgeting & budget management process
· Create and socialize monthly and quarterly updates - for APAC and global reporting - on marketing performance and required pivots
· Lead the agenda on marketing measurement operationalization - digging deep in to the analysis from Data Science to inform recommendations for actions required to exceed targets
· Support the optimisation of marketing spend through channel analytics leading to a rigorous and data-drive resource allocation methodology - leading to a cohesive and scalable learning agenda
· Act as an internal consultant to the marketing leaders in the department for ad-hoc strategic projects

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
· Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or related field
· 6-8 years of work experience in Marketing Planning, Business Planning, Sales Finance, Sales Analytics, Sales Operations, or Strategy Consulting
· Experience working in a highly matrixed organization - with proven ability to collaborate with, and influence, partners
· Proficient in Excel, and ideally SQL - experience extracting data from large/complex databases, as well as creating data visualizations
· Intellectual curiosity and rigorous analytical mindset with experience using data to solve problems
· Strategic thinker, with a understanding of marketing & sales mechanics - proven ability to develop compelling narratives and present technical content succinctly
· Self-motivated, high capacity individual who can function and flourish in a demanding, performance-driven environment
· Strong communicator - effective articulation of complex business issues across a diverse audience base
· Creative problem solver who can incorporate new learnings into existing plans and act decisively and independently.

description:

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Since our incorporation in 2003, Terra International has become the performance and value leader in IT systems integration, offering customized, efficient, and cost-effective solutions to SMEs and government agencies. Headquartered in Singapore, Terra International operates in over 10 countries in the Asia Pacific. We help clients to design, build, manage and optimize their IT infrastructures, resulting in improved productivity, operational efficiency, and customer satisfaction. As an end-to-end IT solutions provider, Terra International aims to provide complete, dynamic, reliable, and cost-effective solutions - which harness the power of best-in-class technologies and products. With a strong focus on our core capabilities of Data and Voice Networking, Contact Centre Solutions, Software Engineering, and Managed Services, we are committed towards excellence in service, efficiency and innovation. Our workforce is equipped with unique skills and capabilities to meet our clients’ most diverse and demanding needs. Our strategic partnerships with local and global IT leaders ensure that our clients employ the latest technologies to help them gain their competitive advantage - and realize their true business value. Visit us today at terra.systems

KEY DETAILS OF THE ROLE
We are looking for a talented and experienced DIGITAL MARKETING EXECUTIVE to join our team. As a DIGITAL MARKETING EXECUTIVE, you will be responsible for developing, implementing, and managing digital marketing campaigns that promote our company's brand, products, and services. You will work closely with the marketing team and other departments to ensure that all campaigns are aligned with the company's goals and objectives.

Hiring Entity: TERRABYTE PTE LTD
Job Title: DIGITAL MARKETING EXECUTIVE
Type of Role: FULL TIME, WORK FROM OFFICE
Location: SINGAPORE

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Develop and implement digital marketing campaigns across various channels including email, social media, search engines, and display advertising.
• Analyse and report on campaign performance using various analytics tools such as Google Analytics, and use data-driven insights to optimize campaigns for better results.
• Manage and execute email marketing campaigns including creating email templates, writing copy, and managing subscriber lists.
• Manage social media accounts and create engaging content that aligns with the company's brand and voice.
• Develop and manage paid advertising campaigns across various platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and LinkedIn Ads.
• Work with the content team to create and publish content that aligns with the company's goals and objectives.
• Conduct research on industry trends and best practices, and implement new strategies and techniques to improve campaign performance.
• Collaborate with other departments such as sales and product teams to ensure that all campaigns are aligned with the company's overall goals and objectives.
• Stay up-to-date with the latest digital marketing trends, technologies, and platforms.
• Any other duties as determined by the Marketing Manager

REQUIREMENTS
• At least 3 years of experience in digital marketing, including email marketing, social media, website management, and graphic design
• Able to showcase a portfolio of work in the areas of website design, collaterals, logo designs, e-commerce banners, and newsletters
• Strong analytical skills with experience using Google Analytics, social media analytics, and other analytics tools.
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to write engaging copy for various channels.
• Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Experience with marketing automation software such as HubSpot or Marketo is a plus.
• Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and other web development technologies is a plus.

If you are a results-oriented individual with a passion for digital marketing and a desire to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

title: Marketing & E-commerce Executive
company_info: Since 1908, Solis has successfully been introducing new equipment for the kitchen, beauty, and climate-control segments. With over 110 years of experience, Solis is successfully bringing new, safe, and innovative products to the market. As a Swiss company with a long and rich tradition, values like reliability, trust, and sustainability are particularly important to Solis. At Solis, we want to enrich and simplify life with solutions that help to experience the perfect end result while offering an optimal user experience at the same time. Focusing on understanding user needs and user-centric design, Solis develops products that continue to add value to the lives of users on their journey from enthusiastic beginners to experienced and demanding users. Swiss design conquers the world Since its foundation more than 100 years ago, the successful Swiss company Solis has always remained true to its philosophy and course of action, with the aim of enriching consumer's life by means of high-quality products for everyday use, that are also pleasantly, simply and efficiently designed at the same time. Moreover, Solis quality products are not only popular in its home market Switzerland. Solis can proudly say that it now enjoys a good market position in 40 countries around the world. Small is beautiful As a family company with short lines, we can listen, react and adapt immediately. The honest opinion of customers and business partners is vital to Solis, because that is the only way for Solis to develop and improve products that meet the market's needs. Over the decades, Solis continues to score with genuine innovations made by our Swiss designers based on trends and real needs from the market. We can make it happen. The Solis Quality Standard Swiss design by Solis stands for functionality, precision, durability, quality and innovation. Designing products that are built to last, Solis opposes the 'throw-away society'. Since its foundation more than a century ago in Swiss Zurich, products are manufactured according to the Solis Quality Standard. The brand's products are designed for high repairability with a prolonged product lifetime being the result. The dedication to producing household appliances of professional quality is always on our mind. This can be seen in the selection of premium-grade materials used in our product design, clever functionalities and optimal performance, so you can achieve best results, again and again.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Since 1908, Solis has successfully been introducing new household appliances for the kitchen, beauty, and climate-control segments. As a Swiss company with a long and rich tradition, values like reliability, trust, and sustainability are particularly important to Solis.

We’re looking for a key person to help expand the Solis footprint globally with a focus on Europe.
You will report directly to the Marketing & E-Commerce Manager based in Singapore.

Responsibilities
General Marketing:
· Support Marketing & E-Commerce Manager with initiatives that drive brand awareness, including day-to-day execution of marketing campaigns and promotions
· Coordinate public relations and outreach initiatives, including media releases, awards, company announcements, and influencer programmes

Content Creation and Management:
· Work closely with agencies to create videos, product and mood images, and other relevant content for branding, distribution and for Solis official online stores and marketplace stores
· Develop editorial calendar and manage projects with agencies and internal teams to ensure top quality and that deadlines are met
· Responsible for through-the-line activities such as print advertisements, social and digital media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn), blog updates and email marketing
· Manage content through Loadbee and Canto, and share content through various channels

Marketing Materials Development:
· Create B2B marketing materials such as GTM presentations and data sheets with team in Switzerland
· Create and update branding and B2B and D2C marketing guidelines for distribution to distributors and resellers with team in Switzerland
· Work closely with agencies to design and print POS displays, flyers, brochures, catalogues and other marketing materials

E-commerce Operations:
· Work closely with agency and team in team in Europe to implement e-commerce activities
· Manage day-to-day operations of the e-commerce channels to ensure pricing and content are up to date
· Assist Marketing & E-Commerce Manager in campaign and promotional planning

Requirements:
· Min. 3 years of relevant experience in marketing and/or e-commerce (a bonus if experience is in the SDA / FMCG industry)
· Thorough understanding of marketing elements (including traditional and digital marketing such as SEO, social media, etc.)
· Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint), marketing software (Adobe Creative Suite, DotDigital, or similar), content management systems (Canto, Loadbee, or similar) and marketing applications (web analytics, Google Adwords, etc.)
· Familiar with online and e-commerce platforms, such as Magento, Shopify, Amazon, Lazada and Shopee
· Working knowledge of the European market a bonus
· Good writing and communication skills
· Proven success in a fast-paced environment, working both individually and as a team member
· Strong attention to deadlines and budgetary guidelines
· Established media contacts in Europe a bonus

job_category: Advertising / Media, Consulting, Marketing / Public Relations, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Strategy Development: Develop and implement a comprehensive marketing communications strategy aligned with the organization's overall goals and objectives. This may involve collaborating with other departments and executives to ensure alignment.
Team Leadership: Manage and lead a team of marketing communication professionals, including marketing managers, copywriters, graphic designers, and digital marketing specialists. Provide guidance, set goals, and monitor performance.
Brand Management: Oversee the maintenance and promotion of the organization's brand identity, ensuring consistency across all marketing and communication channels.
Content Creation: Create and oversee the creation of marketing content, including advertisements, press releases, blog posts, social media content, email campaigns, and other promotional materials.
Media Relations: Build and maintain relationships with media outlets, journalists, and industry influencers to secure media coverage and positive publicity.
Public Relations: Develop and execute public relations strategies to manage the organization's public image and reputation. This may involve crisis communication and issue management.
Advertising and Promotion: Plan and manage advertising campaigns across various channels, such as online advertising, print media, television, radio, and social media.
Digital Marketing: Oversee digital marketing efforts, including website management, SEO (Search Engine Optimization), SEM (Search Engine Marketing), email marketing, and social media marketing.
Market Research: Conduct market research to understand customer preferences, market trends, and competitors. Use this information to inform marketing strategies.
Budget Management: Develop and manage the marketing communications budget, ensuring cost-effective strategies and responsible allocation of resources.
Measurement and Analytics: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing communication efforts. Analyze data and metrics to make data-driven decisions and optimize campaigns.
Collaboration: Work closely with other departments, such as sales, product development, and customer service, to ensure cohesive messaging and alignment of marketing efforts.
Event Management: Plan and execute marketing events, trade shows, product launches, and other promotional activities.
Compliance: Ensure that all marketing communications comply with relevant laws and regulations, including advertising standards and data privacy regulations.
Stakeholder Communication: Maintain effective communication with internal stakeholders, such as executives and board members, to provide updates on marketing communication strategies and results.
Innovation: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to identify new opportunities for marketing communications.

title: Senior Campaign Manager, Content Marketing
company_info: SPH Media’s mission is to be the trusted source of news on Singapore and Asia, to represent the communities that make up Singapore, and to connect them to the world. It has several business segments in the media industry, including the publishing of newspapers, magazines, and books in both print and digital editions. It also owns and operates other businesses including radio stations and outdoor media.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
SPH Content Lab is looking an exceptional talent to join our growing content marketing team as Senior Campaign Manager. The ideal candidate excels at strategic thinking, target-focused ideation, and project management. Must. Love. Content.

You must be able to see the big picture while zooming in on the details. This is a job for someone who doesn’t just enjoy managing the complete life cycle of complex, cross-functional content marketing projects across the SPH Media ecosystem, but also spends time on the content strategy – figuring out the best way to solutioning a client brief while thinking about what the audience wants.

Reporting to the Associate Director of Content Marketing, you’ll design, produce and manage multi-format content marketing campaigns that include video, social media, text stories, audio and print. You will be at the forefront of connecting clients to SPH Content Lab’s performance-focused, editorial-driven solutions. You must be passionate about bringing content to life, seeing it through from the initial concept to the final performance report. Experience managing projects and clients is essential.

The ideal candidate is organised, media-savvy, and knows how to problem-solve while managing their time effectively. Our client list is diverse, and so is our content. You must be an experienced idea generator who is passionate about developing stories that will resonate with audiences – always with an eye on the larger goals of the content campaign and how each component of the project impacts the intended KPIs.

Content Lab works with an army of freelancers to bring our concepts to life – you run the show, on time and on budget. Experience with project management and overseeing many moving parts, assignments, and deliverables at once is a necessity. You must be able to work well as part of a team, collaborating with a larger group of editors, creatives, and colleagues from our commercial unit.

A high-level knowledge of news and current affairs is necessary, as well as an understanding of how to present a unique take in a crowded content landscape. The ability to thrive under pressure, manage intense deadlines and collaborate well with others is key.

Experience in video production is preferred.

SCOPE & RESPONSIBILITIES
Design and create fully integrated content marketing strategies that incorporate online and off-line channels.
Manage the complete life cycle of custom-solutioned, multi-format, cross-platform content marketing projects across the considerable roster of SPH Media’s news and lifestyle brands. This includes client pitches, project management, client management, performance supervision, and reporting.
Contribute to ideation and solutioning of client briefs, and craft pitch decks of the highest standards.
Managing internal stakeholders as well as external production partners to make sure a million moving parts produce content that is to brief, on time, and under budget.
Turn data and analytics into strategy and action.
Mentor junior members of the team.
REQUIREMENTS
A minimum of 6 years relevant industry experience with at least 3 years in editorial, content marketing, social media marketing, advertising or video production.
Clear understanding of how content is created across formats and media platforms. Experience in managing content creation on more than two media platforms (digital, social, print, television, radio, etc) is mandatory.
Proven ability to devise strategic cross-platform content strategies and concepts.
Experience in turning data and analytics into strategy and action. Basic understanding of digital analytics is a must.
An extraordinary gift for multitasking. Please be extremely organised and detail-oriented.
Be able to work collaboratively and proactively.
Excellent English-language verbal and written skills. Proficiency in Chinese, Malay or Tamil is a bonus.
Strong understanding of Lifestyle industry and consumer trends.
Familiarity with SPH’s news products is essential.
Must play well with others.
Bachelor in Mass Communication, Marketing or related field.

title: 6 Months Marketing Intern (Moist Diane & Laundrin) Full time (Jan to Jun 24)
company_info: MANDOM CORPORATION (SINGAPORE) PRIVATE LIMITED The Mandom Group generates value by leveraging the creativity of employees in its products and services. We engage in our daily business activities under the basic commitment of contributing to a comfortable life of consumers around the world.
address: GREAT WORLD CITY, 1 KIM SENG PROMENADE 237994
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About us

Founded in 1927, Mandom Corporation is a Japanese manufacturer and distributor of consumer products. From hair wax, cosmetics to shampoo, there is something for everyone to meet their daily needs. Some of the brands under our belt are: GATSBY, LUCIDO-L, Moist Diane and Heroine Make. As a company which focuses on Oyakudachi (dedication to service), we strive to provide the best quality products at affordable prices to consumers.

What to expect

As our Marketing intern, you will get to work on brands under the haircare and homecare categories. The brands you will be assisting in are: Moist Diane and Laundrin.

Under the guidance of experienced marketers, you will get to understand the internal workings of the Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) industry, and be introduced to the world of digital and trade marketing. Aside from being involved in the conceptualization and execution of marketing campaigns, you will also play a key role in ensuring that the day to day operations within the marketing teams runs smoothly.

This is the perfect opportunity to understand how the textbook theories you are studying now can be applied to the real world.

Keen to embark on this rewarding and insightful journey? Send in your resumes now!


You will be assisting the Haircare and Homecare team in the following areas:

Digital Marketing

· Manage brands’ social media platforms and monthly content calendar (Instagram, Facebook, Tiktok, Lemon8)
· Assist in developing and designing digital marketing materials
· Create content to strengthen brands’ SEO performance and drive organic traffic to brands’ websites
· Analyse digital marketing trends to improve brands’ performance in digital communications

Trade Marketing

· Conceptualize and develop visually impactful designs for in store displays and events
· Provide support for trade marketing needs to enhance store visibility and exposure
· Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to roll out marketing projects

Campaign Management

· Assist in marketing campaigns in areas such as developing campaign communications, PR management etc

Data Analysis

· Conduct competitor analysis to understand the retail landscape
· Conduct market research to understand more about the haircare and homecare landscapes to identify consumer trends

Operational Support

· Support the marketing teams in daily administrative tasks
· Prepare presentations and monthly reports
· Assist in any other ad hoc tasks assigned

Who we are looking for

· Undergraduates majoring in Marketing / Communications and New Media
· Able to commit full-time from January to June 2024
· Possess a strong passion in the Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) industry, as well as the haircare and homecare industries
· Possess strong analytical skills, good interpersonal, communication and writing skills
· Has an eye for details and aesthetics
· Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills, with an ability to prioritize time-sensitive tasks
· A motivated team-player who is creative, meticulous, resourceful and is able to work independently
· Familiarity with social media management (Instagram, Facebook, Tiktok) is a plus
· Knowledge and experience in graphics creation softwares, such as Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator etc is a plus

title: Clinical Sales Training Manager (APAC)
company_info: Royal Philips (NYSE: PHG, AEX: PHIA) is a leading health technology company focused on improving people's health and enabling better outcomes across the health continuum from healthy living and prevention, to diagnosis, treatment and home care. Philips leverages advanced technology and deep clinical and consumer insights to deliver integrated solutions. Headquartered in the Netherlands, the company is a leader in diagnostic imaging, image-guided therapy, patient monitoring and health informatics, as well as in consumer health and home care. Philips' health technology portfolio generated 2016 sales of EUR 17.4 billion and employs approximately 70,000 employees with sales and services in more than 100 countries.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Philips is a global leader in health technology, committed to improving billions of lives worldwide and striving to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. Driven by the vision of a better tomorrow.
But it’s not just what we do, it’s who we are. We are 80,000, wonderfully unique individuals, with two things in common. An unwavering sense of purpose and a relentless determination to deliver on our customers’ needs. It’s what inspires us to create meaningful solutions – the kind that make a real difference – when it matters most.
The world and our customers’ needs are changing faster than ever before and while we are proud of what we do already, we know we can do more. That’s why we need you, to help us tackle increasingly complex challenges posed by ever evolving health and well-being needs.
In this role, you have the opportunity to make life better
Looking at the challenges the world is facing today Philips’ purpose has never been more relevant. So whatever your role, if you share our passion for helping others, you’ll be working towards creating a better and fairer future for all.
You are responsible for
The Clinical Sales Training Manager will be responsible for developing all Clinical Sales Training programs and delivering sales training material to the field sales force. This will include product knowledge, competitive product analysis and differentiation, sales force effectiveness for sales processes, continuing training and development of tenured sales personnel, and on-boarding of new personnel.
Develops new hire training program inclusive of strategy, process and collateral.
Leads In-House and Field Sales Training programs
Creates, implements and maintains sales training tools, processes and records.
Gathers information related to sales training best practices in the coronary, endovascular and imaging industry and incorporates into sales training strategies and programs.
Conducts appropriate evaluation of sales training programs and materials related to performance, budget, processes, overall effectiveness and impact on team; incorporates conclusions from analyses into design and implementation of programs as needed.
Lead efforts in launch and other company meeting execution, including agenda creation, workshop development and delivery as well as overall meeting facilitation
Partner and collaborate with Marketing to develop sales force strategies to ensure product success in the marketplace
Identify, evaluate and manage vendors to support training
Establish goals and learning objectives, in conjunction with sales and marketing management, to design appropriate and effective curricula, utilizing principles of adult learning
Leverage technology to promote cost effective remote training using company LMS system
Aid in cross functional training to other functional areas such as Marketing, Clinical and Corporate
Develop programs and gap assessment tools for use in meetings to aid in the continued development of the Sales Specialist skill and knowledge base
Incorporate all required legal and regulatory compliance programs into the appropriate training programs
To succeed in this role, you’ll need a customer-first attitude and the following
Minimum BS/BA degree; advanced degree preferred.
At least 5 years of experience in Interventional Cardiology or Medical/ Healthcare field
4-6 years of sales and/or sales training experience preferred with a proven track record of results in medical device.
3-5 years of people management experience is highly preferred, specifically in sales and/or sales training.
Strong background in Key Opinion Leader and faculty co-operation
Clinical training and/or clinical education preferred.
Intermediate to advanced level usage in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook. Proficiency of the iPad and iPad applications
Must have the ability to analyze that market needs for training and education
Strategic thinker
A team player with high interpersonal and communication skills
Communication and collaboration skills;
Must be able to build strong internal and external educational/clinical relationships with a focus on the sales teams, clinical teams, marketing personnel and customers.
Ability to travel (up to 50% within APAC region)
Program dialogue skills
How we work at Philips
There are three core ways that define our ways of working - embracing flexibility, being at our best, and impactful collaboration. We believe this enables us to deliver an outstanding experience to our customers and create the best place to work for people who share our passion.
We know just how important direct interactions are and work is more engaging when we are more frequently face-to-face, and that we experience better collaboration which drives innovation. While we have many different types of roles across Philips most require a combination of in-person collaboration with colleagues and partners, usually at a Philips location, and individual focus time, which can be done remotely.

Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on innovative, customer-first health technology solutions. Help us improve the health and well-being of billions of people, every year. Ultimately creating a career that no one could have planned for. Even you.
Visit our careers website to explore what it’s like working at Philips, read stories from our employee blog, find information about our recruitment process and answers to some frequently asked questions.

title: R0292110 - CB- Product Manager for Fund Services - VP
company_info: About Deutsche Bank A Passion to Perform. It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes the way we do business. We’re committed to being the best financial services provider in the world, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior solutions for our clients. This is made possible by our people: agile minds, able to see beyond the obvious and act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape. As you’ll discover, our culture supports this. Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose. At every level agile thinking is nurtured. And at every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and opportunities to excel.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Details of the Division and Team:
At the heart of Deutsche Bank is the Corporate Bank (CB), a market leader in cash management, trade finance, lending, trust and agency services and securities services, as well as risk management for foreign exchange and interest rates - Securities Services (SeS) provides custody, clearing and settlement and fund services to global custodians, broker/dealers, and prime brokers as well as buy-side firms and other institutional clients.
In SeS, we are recruiting a fund accountant professional with deep traditional experience in accounting, instrument valuations, fund administration operations; familiar with insurance/asset owner segments and who wants to further deepen and extend his/her career capabilities with digital data, cloud and artificial intelligence in fund services.
As such, we offer the position of APAC regional product design and delivery subject matter expert (Accounting & Valuations) who will directly report into the Fund Services Tribe Lead/global head of fund services product management. The successful candidate will work with him and the other forward looking stakeholders to drive a multi-year strategic transformation delivery roadmap and deliver positive impacts.
The successful candidate should have interests to leverage his/her existing experience and expertise with leading technology, and to work with operations to facilitate and deliver new, automated impactful value for asset managers and owners. In doing so, he/she will collaborate across sales, operations, technology and risks management teams to define, communicate, roadmap and deliver to agreed results and milestones, and function as an empowered subject matter leader in the ongoing fund services strategic transformation.
What we will offer you:
A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce is better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center.
You can expect:
Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services
Comprehensive leave benefits
Gender Neutral Parental Leave
Flexible working arrangements
25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement
Your key responsibilities:
Lead the design/redesign, definitions and descriptions of fund services accounting, financial instrument valuation and reporting services/microservices for asset owners, asset managers and operations. Incorporate approved new services into the fund services strategic transformation roadmap, facilitate execution dependencies and resourcing. Reporting services include client customisation requests, regulatory-required and year-end/periodic period financial statements.
Analyse and relate IFRS, local accounting standards and financial instrument valuations to data description and product/data sources required for necessary and insightful reports for regulators, asset manager/owner clients and internal stakeholders. Collaborate with different subject matter experts like data engineers and developers.
As a subject matter expert in multidisciplinary teams to implement transformation deliverables and services.
Support set-up of accounting and financial instrument valuation methodologies for clients as required. Support trouble shooting, risks reviews, and contribute to client’s RFPs and inquiries.
Work across sales, operations, technology and risks management to implement digital data-driven reporting services on timely basis to clients and markets; manage book of work; propose ideas, identify and escalate emerging risks, involve new facilitators and mitigate inhibitors of success.
Review, streamline range of customised reports and establish going forward basis to realise operations scalability and cost saving.
Review and facilitate standardisation of data description and entity relationships.
Be involved in relevant industry working groups related to fund administration.
Conduct internal trainings.
Your skills and experience:
8 to 10+ years of fund administration operations hands-on experience including client and regulatory reporting and financial year-end activities.
4 to 5+ years of experience in insurance fund administration or investment servicing operation requirements including look-through accounting, unit-linked funds, insurance assets accounting and segregated mandates.
Demonstrable knowledge of fund administration lifecycle processes including exceptions and main risks.
Evidenced expertise in IFRS and/or local equivalent accounting standards, financial instrument valuations and reporting in the asset management/owner industry.
Demonstrated track record in timely deliveries and performance under time pressured situations.
Proven analytical and skills to communicate (written/verbal/listening) clearly and in detail.
Evidenced knowledge of digital data, cloud and/or artificial intelligence. Beginner’s level is acceptable.
Familiar with a matrix reporting environment, comfortable with ambiguity, able to plan, empathetic and see from different point of views, driven and able to multi-task.
Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirements may apply.
How we’ll support you:
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
Training and development to help you excel in your career
Coaching and support from experts in your team
About us and our teams:
Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. click here to see what we do.
Deutsche Bank & Diversity
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.
Visit Inside Deutsche Bank to discover more about the culture of Deutsche Bank including Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Leadership, Learning, Future of Work and more besides.

Marketing Manager Job Description
We are seeking an innovative marketing manager to promote our company's brand and services. In this role, you will be optimizing our marketing strategies, managing the marketing department's budget and staff, as well as preparing forecasts. Excellent verbal and non-verbal communication skills

Availability to work within opening hours (e.g. evenings, holidays, weekends).

title: Lead, Product Marketing Manager
company_info: AIA Group Limited (“AIA”) and Discovery Group Limited (“Discovery”) have agreed to establish a digital health technology and integrated solutions business (“Amplify”) that aims to transform how payors, private hospitals, corporates and public healthcare systems deliver health and wellness for patients and communities across Asia. Amplify brings together the best of partners through a combination of Discovery’s globally proven healthcare technology, intellectual property and expertise and AIA’s brand, established market position, distribution assets and decades of well-established leadership and execution capabilities. Initially focused on serving AIA businesses to help increase new business value and deliver financial benefits, Amplify will over time also serve and partner with other key healthcare system participants including private hospitals, corporates, public healthcare system providers and pharmaceutical and MedTech companies. Amplify will create value and deliver better outcomes for stakeholders across the healthcare value chain: • Innovative private health insurance propositions • Medical cost optimisation and improved quality of care through expertise in case, disease, payment and network management • Claims and core operations process transformation and automation • Value-based provider network management through incentives aligned around cost-effective and efficient care • Digital engagement through wellness programmes and online portals • Data management and analytics for ongoing value generation
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Instructions for interested applicants
Please apply for this position via the following link
https://aia.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/amplifyhealthexternal/job/Singapore-SG-Amplify-Health/Lead--Product-Marketing-Manager_JR-42694

Job Description
Role and responsibilities:
As the product marketing manager, you play a pivotal role in communicating the value of your product to customers, partners, media and employees. You define and execute marketing strategies and are responsible for ensuring that your product is strategically positioned to meet the unique needs of customers. You are a key partner to the product manager, working closely to create and manage product marketing strategies and campaigns to drive product adoption and usage.
A day in your life as a product marketing manager at Amplify Health may include these activities:
Market research – you are familiar with A/B testing, UX research and other qualitative methods
Customer insights – you distill data and knowledge to insights that can be applied to create effective concepts and communications
Product positioning – you work with your product manager counterpart to develop relevant and compelling propositions
GTM strategy – you partner product and commercial teams to create effective go-to-market strategies to penetrate new segments and markets
Content creation and production – you are creative, resourceful and are passionate about producing engaging content that changes perceptions, attitudes and behaviours
Product training for commercial and partner teams to effectively sell products – you empower the commercial and partnership teams with the requisite knowledge to achieve high lead to sale conversion ratios
Product marketing asset utilisation tracking – you take a test and learn approach to all creative work, and you track performance of every piece of content to achieve the highest return on your investment of time and resources
Manage product marketing asset library – you maintain an up-to-date library of assets that are easy to access and use
Compliance – you ensure that all marketing materials and activities adhere to industry regulatory standards

You are a perfect match if:
You are well versed in topics that don’t necessarily fit neatly in a single discipline: ideation, agile development, launching releases, go-to-market and demand generation.
You are drawn to details. Product marketing involves a lot of minutiae and you apply your strong project management skills to everything you do.
You love data. You have an innate need to understand the market, get into the minds of your customers and to help your team understand how to best position your product. Qualitative studies, focus group discussions and in-depth studies or UX research are some of the tools you use to uncover insights on your customers.
You are collaborative. You work well across functions and squads to consistently produce superlative results where the whole is greater than the sum of the parts.
You can demonstrate familiarity with common tools used in product marketing.
You have marketing experience in healthcare, insurance and technology.
You are adept at using tools like Power BI, Microsoft Dynamics, Adobe Experience Cloud, LinkedIn and video and podcasting platforms.

In October 2009 we acquired three new businesses, Celtic Mead Pte Ltd (bq bar & Dharma’s Kebab’s), Inisfree Pte Ltd (Molly Malone’s Irish Pub and Brasserie) and merged HosconAsia Pte Ltd, a pub and bar based consultancy company into the group. company_info: We are the manufacturer of Beard Papa’s Cream Puff, a world-renowned dessert brand that was established in 1999 with its first store. In 2022, we acquired Rive Gauche Patisserie, a renowned cake brand brand established in Singapore since 1993. “Rive Gauche” refers to the left bank of the Seine river in Paris, France, an area synonymous with French culture, literature and the arts. With seven shops currently in operation and ever expanding, Rive Gauche Patisserie offers customers a variety of rich cake and pastry flavors. "Chewy Beret" is a subsidiary of Muginoho Global Pte Ltd, which is also the parent company of "Beard Papa's," a well-known Japanese cream puff brand.

title: Senior Executive - Parts Sales Market Management
company: DAIMLER COMMERCIAL VEHICLES SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE. LTD.
company_info: Daimler Trucks is a leading provider of Global Transportation Solutions. Our products are helping to power economic growth in over 170 countries around the world. At the foundation of our success, you will find a diverse workforce of over 15,000 employees across Japan, India, the USA, Australia, South Africa, and other strategic locations, working together with Mitsubishi Fuso Truck and Bus Corporation MFTBC (Japan) and Daimler India Commercial Vehicles DICV (India), under the umbrella of Daimler Trucks AG (DTAG). In Daimler Commercial Vehicles South East Asia Pte. Ltd., we are a Regional Center for the SEA region and in which we carry Mercedes-Benz, Fuso & BharatBenz brands Commercial Vehicle products, e.g. Fuso Bus & Trucks, Mercedes-Benz Vans, Bus & Trucks. We are excited about the direction we are leading the Commercial Vehicle Industry from pioneering innovations of electrification, connectivity and digitization of our products into the future.
job_category: Customer Service, General Management, Logistics / Supply Chain, Sales / Retail, Wholesale Trade
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Daimler Truck – the Commercial Vehicle Pioneers.

More than 125 years ago, we founded the modern transport industry with our trucks and buses. Today we are one of the world's largest commercial vehicle manufacturers. We employ about 100,000 people at more than 40 locations in North America, Europe, Asia and Latin America and numerous sales and service locations in most countries in the world.

In our global network, we develop and produce trucks and buses that are marketed under the Freightliner, Thomas Built Buses, Western Star, Mercedes-Benz, FUSO, BharatBenz, RIZON and Setra brands. We work for all who keep the world moving - this is our joint motivation at Daimler Truck.
Our customers move the world.

They ensure that goods and people reach their destinations, that our everyday lives can function, and that prosperity is created. Studies show that demand for mobility and transport will continue to grow. The products and services of our customers will be needed more in the future than they are today or in the past. We develop the right vehicles and services for our customers: efficient & electric; safe & automated; reliable & connected.
Working at Daimler Truck means working with the voice of the industry. We are here to make a change, to make real impact together.

At our location in Singapore - Daimler Commercial Vehicles South East Asia Pte. Ltd. (DCVSEA) is the Regional Center for Daimler’s commercial vehicle business in South East Asia and Southern Asia. Our team of over 60 colleagues is responsible to develop the truck & bus business for the brands Mercedes-Benz, FUSO and BharatBenz in more than 20 markets across South East Asia and beyond. Join us to work towards our vision: Leading Sustainable Transportation.

We are seeking for a highly motivated team player to the Customer Services and Parts (CSP) Sales Management Team to plan and manage the parts sales business for Trucks Asia (TA), Trucks Europe (TE) and Bus parts. He/She will be responsible fto ensure the achievement of sales targets for the responsible markets.

The roles and responsibilities are outlined as below:
1. Business Planning
• Develop yearly planning and target for parts business for individual markets.
• Formulate business strategies for individual markets in support of Operative Plan (OP).
• Review and determine yearly Target Agreement for parts and qualitative targets for individual markets.
• Carry out market assessment on fulfilment of agreed targets as part of bonus computation for General Distributors (GDs).

2. Business Development/Increase Parts Sales
• Develop parts and service marketing strategies to support business goals.
• Conduct parts sales activities to ensure the achievement of sales targets.
• Regular visits and carry out periodic review of dealer/GDs/stockist/fleet operators/Market Performance Centers (MPCs)
• Plan and strategize dealer/GDs and stockist network to ensure business coverage.
• Support other departments in vehicle tender submissions relating to parts issues

3. Parts Liaison and Coordination
• Liaise and coordinate with the Daimler Truck Parts Centre (DTPC) and other departments and suppliers to ensure that customer orders are expeditiously processed and delivered in accordance with customers’ requirements.
• Provide parts escalation support to dealer/GD’s/MPCs on exceptional basis.

4. Parts Pricing
• Plan and conduct regular market studies and price analysis and assist in parts pricing formulation.
• Develop parts policies and price structures to ensure competitiveness against parallel imports, OEMS and replacement parts.
• Provide support for Parts Warranty Factor computation and submission.

5. Parts Monitoring and Controlling
• Carry out operative planning with HQ for respective business units.
• Develop and plan target agreement with dealer/GDs, stockists and MPCs.
• Provide and analyse on a regular basis information pertaining to parts sales and provide such information to management in a timely manner.
• Monitor the status of dealer/GDs, stockists’ and MPC payments and ensure the prompt payment of any outstanding monies.
• Coordinate Due Diligence and Compliance matters pertaining to Business Partners.
• Maintain and update local contracts with Business Partners.
And any other reasonable assigned tasks and projects.

Job Requirements:

• Minimum Tertiary Education in Engineering, Business, or equivalent courses
• At least 3 years of working experience preferrably in the automotive aftersales operation management, e.g., Parts sales, workshop management
• Knowledge of Commercial Vehicle/ Bus aftersales business is preferred
• Knowledge of Parts Customer Service/ Operation & Logistic process / Service Contract is preferred
• Ability to work independently with minimum guidance and self-motivated
• Highly process-orientated, analytical, and entrepreneurial
• Possess excellent communication and consulting skills, in both written and spoken
• Possess strong interpersonal, collaboration and co-creation traits
• Creative and open-minded to new ideas
• Founded IT knowledge especially Microsoft Office Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Power BI to prepare analyses, reports and presentations.
• Additional linguistic abilities in foreign languages would be an added value

This position is based in location Singapore under the entity Daimler Commercial Vehicles South East Asia Pte. Ltd., and may be offered at a lower job level based on candidate’s experience. A valid and approved work visa is required for employment in Singapore in accordance to local labour law regulations.

company_info: We are the manufacturer of Beard Papa’s Cream Puff, a world-renowned dessert brand that was established in 1999 with its first store. Over time, we have expanded our menu to include more delectable desserts and baked goods, and now operate sweet shops and food restaurants worldwide, with over 400 stores worldwide as of January 2023 Our commitment to serving freshly baked and made products remains unwavering, ensuring that customers enjoy the best cream puffs, sweets, and desserts possible. We aspire to expand our business to 50 countries worldwide in order to share our delicious treats with people all over the world. In 2022, we acquired Rive Gauche Patisserie, a renowned cake brand brand established in Singapore since 1993. “Rive Gauche” refers to the left bank of the Seine river in Paris, France, an area synonymous with French culture, literature and the arts. Inspired by the creativity and emotions it evokes, we strive to create an authentic, classical french confectionary experience through the rich flavours of our cakes and pastries. With seven shops currently in operation and ever expanding, Rive Gauche Patisserie offers customers a variety of rich cake and pastry flavors. "Chewy Beret" is a recently launched cream puff brand that will be opening its first outlet in Singapore in mid-April 2023. This new brand offers delectable cream puffs that boast a unique chewy texture and a wide variety of flavors. The cream puffs themselves are shaped like cute beret hats. "Chewy Beret" is a subsidiary of Muginoho Global Pte Ltd, which is also the parent company of "Beard Papa's," a well-known Japanese cream puff brand.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Collateral Risk Management Team oversees the management of risks relating to collateral received in connection with BoS client’s borrowing and trading activities. The team’s objective is to manage risk efficiently and effectively so as to protect the bank’s financial returns and sustain business growth. The team has two functions: Methodology and Analytics function focuses on the development of quantitative model, approach and methods to apply for evaluation of collateral risk and the formulation of risk parameters and policy framework. Operationalisation and Monitoring function focuses on the implementation of the relevant policy and operating procedure, ongoing monitoring, timely action taking and day-to-day business support.
This job opening is with Methodology and Analytics function area of collateral risk management.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain the bank’s collateral lending and derivatives margining methodology. Perform regular review and analysis to ensure that the models are in line with the bank’s risk policy and are appropriate under the evolving market conditions.
Discover and diagnose methodology related issues including input data, assumption, concept, computation, system implementation process and thus design and propose model refinement and enhancement
Carry out periodical risk calibrations, back testing, benchmarking. Respond to queries and challenges from independent model validators, internal or external auditors to ensure the soundness and correct application of the models.
Support new products and businesses. Conduct research to develop risk management approaches, tools, and analytics to help widen business coverage and product scope.
Work with Risk Managers and developers on the design and development of risk management systems and infrastructure.
Requirements:
At least 8 years of relevant experience in risk analytics
Good university degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Financial Engineering etc.) with a strong ability of handling data and performing quantitative analysis.
Advanced knowledge of key products of capital markets. Understand the main risk drivers and factors. Familiar with valuation of the financial instruments and derivatives.
Analytical and independent thinker with good written and verbal communication skills especially in explaining complex technical subjects in a simple/pragmatic manner to business and senior management.
Strong curiosity of the field, proactively seeking opportunity of learning and progress.
Strong team player with good communication, interpersonal and organizational skills

title: Marketing Strategy Planning Manager
company_info: As a global professional services recruitment consultancy, Morgan McKinley connects specialist talent with leading employers across multiple industries and disciplines. Our promise to you You can get the best advice for your career at Morgan McKinley. Our team of consultants have either have an educational background in their sector or have industry experience. We take the time to listen to your long term goals and provide you with honest feedback to help you realise them. Over the years many people have progressed their careers with us both here in Singapore and internationally and our global presence gives us insight into the domestic and international markets. In Singapore we specialise in Banking & Financial Services, Legal, Compliance & Audit, Finance & Accounting, IT, Project Management, Sales & Marketing, HR and Supply Chain & Procurement.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Morgan McKinley is seeking a Marketing Strategy Planning Manager for a 12-month contract highly renewable.


As a Marketing Strategy Planning Manager, you'll be the driving force behind our marketing success. You'll leverage your deep experience in performance and brand marketing, as well as marketing planning and strategy consulting, to shape our marketing efforts. Your data-driven approach and creative thinking will set you apart.

Key Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership: Develop and refine cutting-edge marketing strategies that are harmonized with our corporate objectives, while maintaining a forward-looking perspective on industry trends.
Data Proficiency: Utilize your exceptional data analysis skills to unearth invaluable insights, translating them into marketing plans that yield quantifiable results.
Collaborative Expertise: Collaborate effectively with multifunctional teams to ensure the seamless execution of marketing initiatives.
Innovation Advocate: Stay abreast of emerging opportunities and technologies, championing their integration into our marketing efforts to drive innovation and efficiency.
Qualifications:
A distinguished track record with 6-8 years of marketing experience, specializing in performance and brand marketing.
Demonstrated expertise in marketing planning or strategy consulting.
Proficiency in data analysis and the ability to extract actionable insights.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving acumen.
A creative mindset and an unwavering commitment to innovation.
Outstanding communication and collaboration skills.
A Bachelor's degree in Marketing or a related field.
What We Offer:
Competitive remuneration
A dynamic and forward-thinking work environment that encourages growth and development.
Opportunities to shape and influence the future of marketing.
The chance to make a profound impact within the marketing landscape.
Interested candidates may apply through the application system or send it to sg-techcontracting@morganmckinley.com. Shortlisted candidates will be notified.

By sending us your personal data and curriculum vitae (CV), you are deemed to consent to Morgan Mckinley Pte Ltd and its affiliates to collect, use, and disclose your personal data for the purposes set out in the Privacy Policy available at https://www.morganmckinley.com/sg/privacy-policy. You acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree with the Privacy Policy.

Morgan McKinley Pte Ltd
Koh Boon Sien

EA Registration No. R1110345

title: Digital Marketing Intern
company_info: Company overview Founded by GJ Wee, Trapeze is a fitness / wellness / health company founded in Singapore. We are building a portfolio of brands that help people find and maintain wellbeing in a playful, innovative, and holistic way. The company’s first concept is Trapeze Rec. Club, a holistic wellness club located along Tanjong Pagar Road that features a cafe, fitness & yoga studios, thermal suite and consultation spaces.
job_category: Information Technology, Marketing / Public Relations, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Trapeze was born with the intention to help people find and maintain wellbeing in a playful, innovative, and holistic way. We aim to build a portfolio of brands under Trapeze, starting with a wellness members club concept called Trapeze Rec. Club (TRC) that launched in 2021 with fitness, martial arts, & yoga classes, recovery facilities such as a cold plunge & sauna, infrared sauna, compression therapy, consultation services like TCM, physiotherapy, mental wellbeing, and an in-house cafe, Canteen.
With that in mind, we are looking for an enthusiastic Digital Marketing Intern to join our team. You will play a crucial role in helping us reach and engage with our target audience through various digital channels, assist in creating compelling and impactful content, managing our social media platforms, conducting market research, and supporting other digital marketing initiatives. The Marketing Intern will report directly to the Marketing Lead and the Digital Marketing Manager.
The candidate should be able to provide creative ideas to help achieve our goals and will assist in developing and implementing marketing strategies.

Job Scope
Content Creation:
Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and produce high-quality visual and written content for our digital platforms.
Assist in filming or shooting content for social media, website, and other marketing materials.
Create engaging and informative content based on current trends and events related to the wellness industry.
Social Media Management:
Manage and maintain our social media platforms, including but not limited to Facebook, and Instagram.
Assist in developing a content calendar and schedule posts to ensure consistent and timely sharing of content.
Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and inquiries on social media platforms.
Analyze social media metrics and generate reports to track the effectiveness of social content.
Market Research:
Conduct market research to identify emerging trends, target audience preferences, and competitor strategies.
Stay updated on industry news, events, and developments to propose new ideas and strategies.
Digital Marketing Support:
Support various digital marketing initiatives and advertising promotional activities, including email marketing, search engine optimization (SEO), and online advertising campaigns, and websites.
Assist in tracking and analyzing website traffic and user behavior using tools such as Google Analytics.
Contribute to brainstorming sessions and provide creative input for marketing campaigns.
Generate meeting reports and presentation slides for management meetings.
Manage and update database and customer relationship management systems (CRM).
Assist in marketing events.
Requirements
A creator, observer, sharp-witted communicator with an eye for aesthetics.
Interest in health & wellness, F&B and lifestyle.
Solid understanding of different marketing techniques and familiarity with social media platforms, content creation tools (CapCut, Canva, etc), and digital marketing software (MailChimp).
Basic knowledge of photography, videography, and video editing software is preferred.
Familiarity with social media analytics and web analytics tools is a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and knowledge of MS Office and G Suite
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with an excellent command of English.
Ability to multitask, organized, proactive, and able to work both independently and as part of a team.
Highly motivated, open, with a flexible mindset and ability to work in a dynamic startup environment.
Benefits
Competitive package
Flexibility of working from home
Four day work week
