title: Marketing & Demand Generation Specialist, Air Compressors & Vacuum Pumps
company_info: Ingersoll Rand is a global market leader with a broad range of innovative and mission-critical air, fluid, energy, specialty vehicle and medical technologies, providing services and solutions to increase industrial productivity and efficiency. Since merging with Gardner Denver in early 2020, we have more than 300 years of combined experience and innovative expertise.
job_category: Advertising / Media, Engineering, Marketing / Public Relations, Wholesale Trade
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Marketing and Demand Gen Specialist, South Asia is responsible for implementing effective campaign plans, executing and evaluating in the right focused areas that helps Ingersoll Rand achieve leads generation & management objectives.
This role is to enhance IR brands awareness/reputation through effective campaigns on various channels, and to develop new channels/ approaches to accelerate growth. Our Industrial business provides a broad portfolio including small reciprocating, contact cooled rotary, oil free scroll and rotary compressors, air treatment products, blowers and vacuum pumps, systems, etc. under multiple brands.
He/she will be responsible for driving business initiatives, overseeing and executing marketing plans in South Asia. Dotted line report to Sr. Manager, Integrated Marketing & Communication, AP with responsibilities for overall marketing activities in AP.

Responsibilities:
Overall Demand Gen Plan, Process and KPI Management
Plan, execute and evaluate marketing campaigns to target audiences regarding tradeshows, email campaigns, social media, customer seminars, webinar/live-stream, telemarketing, offline events, etc.
Develop and manage marketing budget based on SA countries marketing plan.Optimize leads generation process/standard work in South Asia.
Work with AP for leads generation KPI and dashboard, CRM discipline optimization.
NPS+ RFQ improvement (SA IR/GD Compressor, B&V, Nash)
Branding & Communication
Develop and execute branding campaigns and communications, PR, social media, tradeshows, etc.
Develop and execute traditional and digital advertising in South Asia
SA Associations relations management
Product Marketing
Develop and enhance marketing collaterals (brochures, posters, case study, videos, etc.) based on Global/AP projects and SA needs.
New product launch (incl. launch events or soft launch activities).
Digital Marketing
Manage social media accounts and implement integration to other data management platforms/tools.
Work with AP and Global team for Google campaigns development and execution in SA.
Work with AP to develop SA email campaigns plan and develop contents.
Requirements / Qualifications:
Minimum 3 years of experience in marketing (demand generation) preferred.
Demonstrated strong capability in implementing marketing activities.
Regional Travelling up to 30%.
Customer oriented, problem solving and solution mindset.
Strong relationship building skills with the ability to influence and inspire.
Energetic, passionate, driven, and strong interpersonal skills who works well in a collaborative team environment.
Excellent oral and written communication skills, communicate compelling.

title: Regional Manager, Robotics Solutions
company_info: THEEXECUTIVECIRCLE ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD. Built on the foundation of 35 years of experience, TheExecutiveCircle is a partnership of accomplished Executive Search Professionals supporting the needs of clients in the Asia Pacific region. With a track record of more than 10 years each, our Consultants have successfully supported Global Multinationals, Asian Home Grown Enterprises, and Start-up Companies in their Expansion, Turnaround and Succession Planning Strategies over the years.
job_category: Information Technology, Marketing / Public Relations, Sales / Retail
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Regional Manager, Robotic Solutions (Product Marketing & Product Management)

Job Summary
As Product Manager manage Robotics BU in product marketing to effectively ensure achievement of business plan/set target objective in terms of sales, profitability, and sustainability.
Responsible for managing and implementing marketing activities through strategics plan, research, and action plan implementation.
Ensure adherence to set systems thereby ensuring a professional approach to entire robot business activity.
Key Accountabilities

1. Marketing:
Formulate efficient & intuitive Go-to-market strategy for sales with Robotics BU management.
Market research including competitors’ info and customer’s feedback on our products features/improvements etc. back to RHQ & HQ.
Marketing tools preparation (product presentations, success cases, videos, demo units, websites …)
Event management (Seminars, webinars, exhibitions, road shows etc.) with robot country teams and Brand & communication (B&C)
Marketing collateral based on industry strategy.
2. Digital Marketing:
Digital Campaigns, Integrated marking communications, Robotics website updates with B&C team etc. Write copy for diverse marketing distributions (brochures, press releases, linked-in articles, success stories, website material etc.)
3. Product Management:
New product launches, Product EOL communication, Demo Kits for market (Exhibition, partners, end customer)
4. Price management:
Setting prices at regional level and country level, Loading same into the systems, Special price requests to Japan, price approval with internal forms & systems.
5. Budget management:
Working with Managers for budget preparation & system entry, Sales gap analysis and forecast every quarter & monthly monitoring against plan. Confirm the budget plan data entry & report to managers periodically.
6. Conduct market research and analysis to evaluate trends, brand awareness and competition ventures. Preparation of monthly marketing, sales reports etc.

7. People management – 2-3 teams of admin and marketing members to be managed smoothly.

Key Job Requirements Job / Skills Competencies
Creative, Innovative & Challenge driven.
Industrial Robot knowledge and experience will be an added advantage.
Excellent communication, commercial skills, People skills & Team working culture.
Project Management; Able to relate & close working with various internal, external stakeholders.
Good understanding of market research techniques, data analysis and statistics methods
Knowledge of strategic planning and marketing best practices
Familiar with digital marketing, social media, and web analytics
Proficient in MS Office and marketing software (e.g., CRM, SAP)
Willing to travel 30-40% regionally.
Critical Work Experience
At least 3-5 years of product manager experience on the job preferably robotics/automation multinational company experience
Qualifications
Bachelor of Engineering in Mechanical/ Robotics & Automation/Electronics/Mechatronics. MBA (Marketing Management/Digital Marketing/Business Administration) will be an added advantage.

title: Account Manager, Healthcare
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Advertising / Media, Consulting, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
If you have received tertiary training in the domain of biological sciences, biomedical sciences, life sciences or pharmacy, our current team of healthcare account managers are looking forward to you joining the flock in coupling your bioscience knowledge with digital marketing know-how. Read on to find out more!
Account Manager - Healthcare
The Account Manager will be responsible for managing and implementing digital transformation strategies aligned with our clients' business goals. This person will be the primary point of contact with clients and will be responsible for their projects. He/She will need to foster a strong working relationship internally with the creative/production team as well as externally with clients on the approval of campaigns and contents. The ideal candidate has to be agile, disciplined, highly motivated and has a native understanding of digital resources to deliver the best for the clients. To be successful in this role, the candidate must build strong and strategic partnerships with healthcare providers whose accounts are under his/her management – from clinicians and pharmacists to business unit managers and marketing managers alike.
Training will be provided for specific skillsets on digital advertising strategies as well as the understanding of key performance metrics.
Responsibilities and Duties
Manage pharmaceutical, medical and healthcare clients and liaise with internal and external stakeholders, including key opinion leaders on specific therapeutic areas
Forge strong relationships with clients and be the primary point of contact for key activities
Collaborate with internal content production teams to generate digital assets including video, graphics, ad copy, and landing page URLs in order to create and deliver best-in-class social media and content-driven campaigns for our clients
Point of liaison with clients on approval of campaigns and content; understanding their changing needs and adapting our approach to social media management for them accordingly
Manage timelines, content calendars and project-manage marketing campaigns
Deep-dive into social media analytics in order to gather actionable insights and generate monthly reports
Stay up-to-date on industry changes to ensure our clients are always ahead of the curve on digital and social
Qualifications and Skills
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Pharmacy, Science or related scientific discipline
At least 2-3 years of prior experience in pharmaceutical or healthcare industry
Ability to conceptualise medical content and the analysis of data from clinical papers, assimilating them into slide presentations or reports
Basic to Intermediate understanding of digital and social media platforms, their features and audiences
Knowledge of Facebook Ad Manager and experience in running ad campaigns is a bonus
Superior collaboration and teamwork skills; experience working with cross-functional teams
Project management experience and adaptability: Ability to re-prioritise while operating within a fast paced environment, while continuously maintaining attention to detail, establishing priorities and meeting deadlines
Intermediate level in MS Office software (Excel, Powerpoint) and/or Google for Work products (Google Analytics, Sheets, Slides)
Medical Channel Asia
MCA is the fastest growing health platform focused on credible Asian-centric healthcare information. Present on multiple social media and digital platforms with its content catered to the Asian population covering wellness, health and fitness topics, its rapidly growing readership and following stands at over 1 million video views on Youtube, over 5 million views on Tiktok and over 20 million reach on Facebook and Instagram.

title: Senior Regional Product Manager, Robotics
company_info: EPSON SINGAPORE PTE LTD Epson Singapore Pte Ltd was established in October 1982 as Epson Electronics (Singapore) Pte Ltd, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Seiko Epson Corporation, Japan, with the objective of promoting the sales and marketing of Epson printers in the region. In 1987, our business scope was expanded to include the sale of electronic components and system devices. The company was subsequently renamed Epson Singapore Pte Ltd in 1988. Our product portfolio saw rapid expansion in the following years to include more IT based products such as colour inkjet printers, scanners, digital cameras, large format printers, laser printers and serial impact dot matrix printers that cater to both business and personal user environments. In recent years, we have also successfully entered the competitive market of visual instruments with highly-sophisticated LCD projectors and peripherals as well as system devices such as crystal oscillators, camera modules, D-TED colour LCD modules, ultra-compact TFT LCD modules, LCD modules, LCD drivers and ASIC/System LSI microcomputers. Then there are also the highly regarded Epson Point-Of-Sales receipt printers that have been holding a worldwide leadership position. The attainment of ISO 9001 and ISO 14001 certifications in November 1997 and March 2000 respectively is a reflection as well as an affirmation of our commitment to excellent product quality and good corporate citizenship. Epson Singapore is committed to complying with the Environmental Policy established. January 2001 marked an exciting milestone in the new millennium for Epson Singapore when we were accorded the status of regional headquarters. With that move, our regional sales network was substantially enlarged to include countries in Southeast Asia with the highest economic growth potential. Most recently in April 2012, Epson Singapore was made the regional sales and service headquarters for our world-rernowned factory automation robots. Our regional product sales now cover Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Indochina and the South Asian nation of Pakistan. Epson Singapore is proud to be part of the rapid economic growth of the region that could only come about because of sound economic policies, dedicated workforces and the pervasive use of IT in government, industry, business and in homes. Epson first started life in Suwa, Japan in 1942 as "Daiwa Kogyo" - a company making wristwatch parts for its parent company, Seiko. The Epson name was subsequently derived in 1975 from the idea of the company being the offspring ("son") of the innovative and successful EP-101, the world's smallest electronic printer (EP) which was created by the company in 1968. This revolutionary commercial printer was developed from the world's first digital printing timer that was specially designed for the Tokyo Olympics in 1964.

title: Account Manager, GTR SEA
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview:

As Account Manager, the role holds responsibility for developing, implementing and delivering B-F’s Global Travel Retail (GTR) strategy, process and plans through effective key account management for the Southeast Asia region.
Key tasks will include managing customer negotiations, securing profitable listings, building broad and deep customer relationships, optimizing merchandising placement and coordinating promotional activities. The role will collaborate with Global Travel Retail and local management teams to support the expansion and growth of the Southeast Asia GTR channel, evaluate market conditions, develop and implement marketing strategies and sales plans. Recommend changes to provide optimal long-term financial return and long-term consumer franchise building for B-F brands while exploring new business opportunities across the channel.
Important to success in this role is linking Brown-Forman strategies and plans to the customers strategy in a joint business plan, influencing and engaging at multiple levels and implementing innovative and commercially sound initiatives that grow sales and brand outcomes across the business partnership.

Responsibilities:
Create, execute and deliver agreed P&L objectives
Manage Travel Retailer customers to successfully implement & execute brand plans in the Travel Retail sales channel includes airport, border, airline, cruise, downtown and port retail.
Successfully manage and collaborate with key accounts including Lotte, King Power, Heinemann, DFS, Eraman, DFZ and airlines to achieve excellent execution of business plan
Continue an increasingly global approach to key account management with key customers, through close collaboration with the Account Managers in other countries where the customers operate
Build, develop and grow dynamic and meaningful relationships with travel retail operators in order to interpret customer strategy, gain alignment, and achieve best in class partnership
Manage and coordinate annual pricing and listing negotiations, in partnership with GTR stakeholders and finance to ensure optimal profitability
Manage airline customers through the RFP process to achieve listings, visibility and promotional excellence on board and in lounges through collaboration with GTR and local teams
Set up brand and portfolio strategies
Develop and manage Field Sales Specialist in terms of applying all strategic decisions and actions in the market
Work with GTR and brand teams to execute agreed brand plans and budgets to achieve regional goals in the assigned territory
Secure optimal retail brand exposure and dominate at the point of purchase, proactively identify profitable growth opportunities for the B-F spirits portfolio through merchandising and promotional activities, additional store activities, training, incentivizing, rewarding and influencing
Collaborate with GTR Customer Marketing Manager, to identify and seize brand building opportunities
Actively take the lead in fiscal and long term planning
Track and analyze available data and consumer insights to showcase new commercial and marketing opportunities with the customer
Continually assess RTM options and recommend the best options for the Travel Retail area.
Remain vigilant toward iTNT and work with key stakeholders to identify and address issues in a timely manner.
Participate, populate and conduct monthly, quarterly and yearly business reviews
Collaborate and align with the local team to create synergy and maximize collaboration between B-F GTR and Local Economy

title: Assistant Manager, Marketing and Communications (2-yr contract), OAR
company_info: RecruiterPal is a cloud-based recruitment platform that helps you to recruit staff faster and easier, giving you full control and overview of your entire recruitment process.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together – building a strong collegiality and morale within the university.

Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities – all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.

RESPONSIBILITIES
This position is for Office of Alumni Relations (OAR)
Integrated Marketing and Communications
Contribute to the development and implementation of an integrated communications strategy to engage SMU alumni, students, and other SMU stakeholders related to SMU alumni engagement.
Develop and build content for the various communication touchpoints for the targeted alumni communities including but not limited to digital and non-digital platforms.
Develop the creatives of various publications and collaterals and oversee the quality of these creatives in production and utilisation.
Plan, organise and deliver the marketing and communications support for day-to-day activities, events, and initiatives.
Monitor, adapt and adopt digital engagement trends and best practices in communications.
Work with the Office of Corporate Communications and Marketing to ensure alignment with the University’s brand, marketing and communication strategies and policies.

Develop key metrics and measurement reports to evaluate the success of digital alumni engagement efforts.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree preferably in one of the following areas: Business Management, Communications, with 2 years of experience.
Digitally savvy, a high level of proficiency in copywriting and editorial skills is a must.
Creative in driving online communities, digital content and communication strategies for targeted audience segments.
Strong understanding of the digital and social media landscape and trends, with experience in managing social media channels, digital engagement, marketing, and communication initiatives.
Proficiency in utilising a range of digital, content management, video editing, design, and social media tools such as Drupal, WordPress, social media management, and project management platforms will be advantageous.
Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively with alumni, volunteers, staff at all levels, and external parties.
OTHER INFORMATION

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Assistant Manager / Manager (Strategic Marketing and Communications)

About the Role:
As a Marketing and Communications Specialist, you will take charge of marketing and publicity, including the management of digital marketing assets. Your role will involve crafting and executing integrated
marketing communication plans to promote the three institutions and their offerings effectively. You will collaborate with public/media
relations agencies, manage media buying, and engage creative agencies to create tailored publicity campaigns across various market segments, especially on the digital realm. Additionally, you will oversee digital content updates, digital asset maintenance, and partnerships to drive visitorship. Your contribution will be pivotal in documenting, analysing, and enhancing our visitor outreach strategies.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop and execute integrated marketing communication plans for maximum exposure of the National Museum of Singapore, CCM and RBC.
Manage digital content updates for both institutions.
Maintain digital marketing assets (including but not limited to websites, social media pages, electronic direct mailers) for the three institutions with an emphasis on CCM and RBC, including content development and copywriting.
Initiate and manage joint promotions and partnerships to boost visitor numbers.
Facilitate photography, filming requests, and media visits to both institutions.
Establish and manage an image/video bank for documentation and marketing purposes.
Provide regular reporting and analysis of visitor numbers, visit patterns, and promotion effectiveness.
Coordinate administrative and financial management tasks as required.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Communications, Business Administration, Marketing, or equivalent.
Proficiency in digital content development, web design / multimedia, Photoshop, and video editing skills are advantageous.
A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in marketing communications, preferably in the arts and heritage sector.
Exceptional interpersonal, communication, and analytical skills.
Self-motivated, results-oriented, and driven.
Strong multitasking ability, with experience in project management and government procurement considered a plus.
Willingness to work flexible hours when necessary to meet the demands of the role.
Residing in Singapore at the time of application.
If you are excited about promoting heritage and culture through strategic marketing and communications, we encourage you to apply and be part of our vibrant team at the National Museum of Singapore.

Based in Singapore, we have over 10 years of industry knowledge in maritime, offshore oil and gas. We provide professional advice based on the specialize markets we are focus on. With highly effective recruitment skills, this enables us to serve our clients better and foster a good working relationship that gains trust and confidence. At Talent-Merge, we aim to deliver tailor made recruitment solutions for our clients. Talent search is done thru a few selective channels using our proprietary database to research potentially qualified candidates, targeting appropriate companies, sourcing key industry executives and arranging first contacts with candidates. For a company to be successful, they need to have their employees to have the right attitude, which means approaching any tasks or job with determination, tenacity and most important enthusiasm. Talent-Merge will assist to find the right talent to be placed in each company.

title: Associate - Market Risk Manager - Risk Management
company_info: Nomura is a leading financial services group and the preeminent Asian-based investment bank with worldwide reach. Nomura provides a broad range of innovative solutions tailored to the specific requirements of individual, institutional, corporate and government clients through an international network in over 30 countries. Based in Tokyo and with regional headquarters in Hong Kong, London, and New York, Nomura employs over 27,000 staff worldwide. Nomura’s unique understanding of Asia enables the company to make a difference for clients through three business divisions: retail, asset management, and wholesale (global markets and investment banking).
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 10 MARINA BOULEVARD 018983
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company overview
Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning over 30 countries and regions. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its three business divisions: Retail, Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking), and Investment Management. Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com.
Aon’s Benefit Index®, Nomura’s benefits rank #1 amongst our competitors
Job Overview:
The management of Market risk is a key business priority for Nomura and is vital to the successful delivery of the firm's strategy. The AeJ Market risk team has responsibility for the development of Market risk management for the region, including:
Developing the Market risk strategy and governance framework in line with the Global Market risk management and regulatory framework
Establishing a set of Market risk services to support the business areas' management of Market risk
Developing the tools and templates to allow the effective collection, review and use of Market risk information
Through a team of Market Risk Managers, effectively working with different stakeholders across the business to embed a Market risk culture throughout the organisation
Supporting the Senior Market Risk Managers in the performance of their responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Market Risk Management is looking to hire a Market Risk Manager to participate in covering Singapore based business in AEJ Macro, CVA and Treasury. The risk analyst will also be responsible for overseeing day to day market risk management governance processes and covering Singapore regulatory reporting as well as maintaining market risk oversight on Singapore legal entities. The successful candidate will gain experience across AEJ Rates, FX and Credit as well as core G10 currencies products and markets.
Support the senior regional risk managers in terms of their daily risk monitoring
Daily review of key market news and positions taken and key changes
Liaise regularly with Front Office trading and structuring in the implementation of risk controls and ensure that issues identified (limit breach, incomplete or inadequate risk monitoring, system problems) are addressed in timely manner.
Ensure that daily risk and limit reports are produced timely to trading, senior management and regulatory stakeholders
Ensure VAR and capital components are reviewed, commented and signed off daily.
Review of stress test scenarios, results and provide commentaries of key drivers
Review market risk regulatory reporting and stress testing results submitted to Singapore regulators
Work closely and manage relationships with groups outside of Market Risk, such as Credit Risk, Research, Quantitative Research, Finance, Product Control, Middle Office, Market Risk Technology, Regulatory, and Internal Audit.
Requirements:
Candidates for the position should:
Minimum 3 years of experience in market risk function
Experience in Macro (FX and rates) products
Experience in market risk processes (eg. VAR, limits, stress testing)
Bachelor or Post graduate degree in a quantitative field preferred
Knowledgeable about developed and AEJ emerging markets
Ability to work autonomously and willingness to get involved and take responsibility for area covered.
Proficiency in Excel, VBA, python programing preferred
Strong analytical, communication and independent problem solving skills and able to deliver under tight deadlines.
Energetic, independent with aptitude to learn and improve processes.
Strong team player who can interact and work well with front office, senior risk managers and other control functions
Diversity Statement
Nomura is committed to an employment policy of equal opportunities, and is fundamentally opposed to any less favourable treatment accorded to existing or potential members of staff on the grounds of race, creed, colour, nationality, disability, marital status, pregnancy, gender or sexual orientation.

The management reserves the right to revise the job and may, at his or her discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
Nomura is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Head of Asia Growth Marketing - Advertising
company_info: AMAZON ASIA-PACIFIC HOLDINGS PRIVATE LIMITED Amazon is guided by four principles: customer obsession rather than competitor focus, passion for invention, commitment to operational excellence, and long-term thinking. Amazon strives to be Earth’s most customer-centric company, Earth’s best employer, and Earth’s safest place to work. Customer reviews, 1-Click shopping, personalized recommendations, Prime, Fulfillment by Amazon, AWS, Kindle Direct Publishing, Kindle, Career Choice, Fire tablets, Fire TV, Amazon Echo, Alexa, Just Walk Out technology, Amazon Studios, and The Climate Pledge are some of the things pioneered by Amazon.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At Amazon we continually look for opportunities to invent on behalf of our customers, helping them to find and discover virtually anything they want to buy online. To this end, we are building a range of products that help advertisers of all sizes connect with customers from discovery to purchase and enhance the customer experience with Amazon. We launched our first advertising program in 2006, and since then have built a global portfolio of advertising solutions on Amazon owned sites, mobile web and apps, Fire tablet and TV, out of home, and on thousands of external publishers on desktop and mobile through programmatic advertising.
Building on the success of helping China-based sellers advertise in marketplaces worldwide (North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, etc), we are building a Growth Marketing team focused on driving awareness, activation, and continued success of advertisers in Korea, Vietnam, and other Southeast Asian countries. We are looking for a strong candidate to lead this initiative, identifying opportunities and targeted initiatives across various seller origins/countries, coordinating with country, channel, and product leaders, and be a key leader in driving important product adoption/performance goals.

Key Responsibilities:
Drive business performance for Asia-based advertisers (excl. China) in global marketplaces (product adoption, retention, revenue)
Able to be an individual contributor at first and manage a small but high-performing team as the business ramps up. Hire and Develop talent within the team.
Set up overall business goals for Asia (excl. China). Define and Review goals and targets for your team and stakeholder teams.
Build strong relationships with senior leaders on internal stakeholder teams including Country Leaders, Marketing, Education, Ad Sales, and Product
Manage monthly, quarterly and annual planning cycles in partnership with Finance and the rest of the organization.
Create effective mechanisms to track key inputs to the business and report closely on their progress.

Basic qualifications
9+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience
Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements
Experience with Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables)
Experience building, executing and scaling cross-functional marketing programs
Experience driving direction and alignment with cross-functional teams
Preferred qualifications
Experience working cross-functionally with partner teams to drive adoption and usage of brand assets and messaging
Experience in strategic marketing management and market analysis and demonstrated ability to build and execute a strategy with clear goals and objectives to align to business and service objectives, and support portfolio objectives

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Description
Some careers shine brighter than others
If you’re looking for a career that will help you stand out, join HSBC and fulfil your potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.
Commercial Banking provides international financial services solutions that support businesses ranging from large corporates to mid-market enterprises in a variety of industry sectors all over the world. Leveraging the strength, scope and expertise of our global product network, Commercial Banking is positioned as an essential partner to large and mid-market enterprises seeking to maximise their potential internationally, offering streamlined business access to HSBC’s international network and broad range of market leading banking products and services.
We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Senior Manager, International Markets.
Principal Responsibilities
The role reports to the Regional Head of International Markets ASP CMB. This is a key leadership position responsible for enhancing our Business Development initiatives to support revenue growth while having oversight and responsibility for driving improved returns across the portfolios of International Markets and working on other strategic initiatives covering Sustainable Finance, People and Data & Analytics
Role Overview
The role reports to the Regional Head of International Markets ASP CMB. This is a key leadership position responsible for enhancing our Business Development initiatives to support revenue growth while having oversight and responsibility for driving improved returns across the portfolios of International Markets and working on other strategic initiatives covering Sustainable Finance, People and Data & Analytics
The Associate Director International Markets will be primarily responsible for:
Supporting the Regional Head of International Markets in the development and implementation of strategic initiatives to drive revenue growth and to manage the portfolio performance across eight International Markets
Providing effective strategic insights to Heads of WSB/CMB to support growth agenda across International markets and to engage with regional and local stakeholders across businesses, functions and different levels of seniority to ensure alignment and support for successful completion of key Client Coverage/Business Development initiatives
Champion and foster a culture of collaboration across products (GTRF/GLCM/GBM) and line of businesses (WPB/GB/PB) to maximize shareholder returns from International Markets and enabling safe growth
Lead in forums and committees to represent the perspective of International Markets, informing and influencing senior decision leaders in defining outcomes from strategic initiatives
Promoting best practice sharing and supporting relationship management teams through application of Business Insights/ Actionable Intelligence and enhancement of RM Portal/CME tools, aiming to strengthen our customer-centric proposition and to optimize customer experiences across markets
Supporting markets to develop a more consistent and effective portfolio management strategy to ensure WSB/CMB businesses remain well positioned from a capital / revenue / returns perspective in a changing environment by broad basing adoption of sound LPM practices / capability development
Working closely with Regional LPM / WMR teams for larger approvals, influencing decisions, assessing client plans and relationship strategies presented to Regional DPC
Working with relevant regional stakeholders (Regional LPM, Portfolio Management and Finance teams) to drive RWA improvements across International markets and to optimise return for balance sheet support in CMB
Managing overall portfolio performance by closely monitoring returns, tracking of committed ancillary income and recycling low returning capital
Working closely with country teams to anticipate changing market conditions and the associated impact towards certain industries or customer groups through thematic risk review. Lead and engage with WMR and other stakeholder groups to drive / enable business growth initiatives across markets as necessary
Actively collaborating with the various Sustainable Finance teams in Region and champions in country to drive growth in the Sustainable Finance portfolio and suitable transition plans are in place for higher impact sectors/customers across the International Markets
Qualifications
Strong understanding about the dynamics and the unique proposition of each of the International Markets
Having worked successfully in a frontline role with thorough understanding about the day-to-day activities conducted by an RM and the tools/ systems currently available &/or required for success
Strong relationship management and interpersonal skills with proven track record in communicating effectively and confidently at all levels
Ability to work collaboratively with other businesses and functions to ensure the best outcome for the organization and the ASP CMB International Markets franchise
Proven experience of working effectively with, and a detailed knowledge of the bank’s IT systems, HR Direct, Excel, Powerpoint, Word, Group Intranet, etc
Bachelor Degree with minimum 10 years of commercial banking experience
To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Your Role
We are looking for an experienced Brand Executive / Marketing Executive to support the Senior Marketing Manager in planning and executing Marketing calendar of activities to ensure smooth and timely execution of all campaigns, product launches and projects. You will be involved in the Marketing Communications, Product Management and Market Intelligence.
What Will You Do
Marketing Communications
To plan, create and implement marketing campaigns and promotions including both ATL and BTL for diverse portfolio of categories.
To manage the campaigns' timeline and new product launches
To prepare, monitor, and present accurate and timely campaign progress and post-mortem report and analysis to measure campaign effectiveness, derive key learning for business growth and decision-making.
To liaise, align, and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to conceptualize and ensure smooth execution of campaigns.
To prepare sales sell-in kit and product deck for new product launches.
To manage A&P budget for the assigned portfolio, forecasting and optimise spends.
To support the teams on both aspects of marketing and administration.
To maintain marketing data, categories’ assets, and materials

Product Management
To manage and maintain the development of the product packaging designs (Domestic market, Malaysia market & International markets) to ensure correct changes are being implemented and timely submission of artworks.
To develop new products that are aligned with the business and market needs using relevant market and consumer’s insights and trends.
To work closely with key stakeholders to ensure clear communication and timely approvals.
To apply to the relevant authorities for approval on packaging.
To update & maintain product information, packaging artworks, pack shots, catalogue, corporate website, product specifications and sales listing in materials whenever required
Market Intelligence
To manage external and internal data to analysis and review opportunities for business growth on a stipulated period.
To gather and monitor market and consumer trend and competitive information.
To conduct on-ground market visits to trade channels to understand consumers’ buying behaviours and upcoming product trends.
What Do You Need
At least a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or related field
Minimum 1-2 years of marketing experience, preferably in the Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG)
Meticulous and have a keen eye for details
Possess a high degree of initiative, self-motivated and able to multitask
Ability to Communicate and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure campaigns/project objectives are aligned and executed smoothly and timely

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us:
Canvass Technology is a dynamic and innovative technology company that specializes in data technology . We are passionate about driving innovation and empowering businesses with cutting-edge technology solutions. As we continue to expand our reach and offerings, we are looking for a talented Tech Marketing Manager to join our team and play a pivotal role in our growth.

Job Summary:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Tech Marketing Manager to lead our marketing efforts in the technology sector. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the tech industry, be well-versed in marketing strategies and tactics, and possess excellent communication and leadership skills. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and executing marketing campaigns, building brand awareness, and driving customer engagement within the tech sector.

Key Responsibilities:
Strategic Planning: Develop and implement comprehensive marketing strategies tailored to the technology sector to drive brand recognition and customer acquisition.
Content Creation: Create and oversee the production of high-quality marketing content, including blog posts, whitepapers, case studies, videos, and social media content, that showcases our expertise in the tech industry.
Product Positioning: Collaborate with product management teams to understand our products' unique value propositions and develop messaging that resonates with the tech audience.
Campaign Management: Plan and execute multi-channel marketing campaigns, including email marketing, social media marketing, SEO/SEM, and advertising, to reach and engage tech professionals and decision-makers.
Market Research: Stay up-to-date with industry trends, competitor activities, and market dynamics to identify opportunities and threats and adjust marketing strategies accordingly.
Lead Generation: Work closely with the sales team to generate qualified leads and support the conversion of leads into customers through targeted marketing efforts.
Analytics and Reporting: Monitor and analyze key performance metrics to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives and make data-driven recommendations for continuous improvement.
Budget Management: Manage the marketing budget for the tech sector, ensuring cost-effective allocation of resources to achieve marketing goals.
Team Leadership: Build and lead a high-performing marketing team, providing mentorship, guidance, and performance feedback.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree is a plus.
Proven experience (5+ years) in marketing, with a focus on the technology sector.
Strong knowledge of technology trends, products, and industry-specific terminology.
Demonstrated success in developing and executing marketing strategies that drive results.
Proficiency in digital marketing tools, analytics, and marketing automation platforms.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong leadership and team management capabilities.
Creative thinking and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Tatler is a luxury media brand that celebrates the best of Asia. We create exclusive content and unforgettable experiences for high-net-worth luxury consumers. Our award-winning digital, print and experiential products unite Asia's most influential communities and brands around shared passions.


About The Role:
We are seeking an experienced and proactive Marketing Manager to be based in Singapore. This position will help to develop regional campaign and event marketing with a strategic focus on audience growth, community engagement and brand building in Asia.

The position will assist in all aspects of the marketing department’s operations, with a focus on digital marketing campaign management for multimedia products, events, awards and experiences. In addition to managing marketing communications at a regional and local level, this role will help to enable and facilitate community building through best-practice first-party data management and customer relationship management.

To succeed, you’ll need a positive, can-do attitude, strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work proactively and independently across borders to achieve business and marketing objectives.

Local Responsibilities:
Manage the planning, implementation and delivery of marketing campaigns across all platforms within Tatler’s portfolio, such as event marketing, community building and engagement, circulation marketing, content marketing, social media amplification and new product launches
Conceptualise, coordinate and execute integrated event marketing campaigns with a focus on digital and data led activities across email, social media, content marketing, display, PPC and strategic partnerships

Write informative and engaging copy that inspires action

Identify and onboard strategic partnerships to increase brand awareness targeting HNWIs
Implement and communicate brand guidelines and ensure brand consistency in each market

Regional Responsibilities:
Oversee regional amplification initiatives and flagship marketing campaigns
Research, create and develop presentation materials for corporate presentations
Review marketing campaign performance and provide recommendations to maximise return on marketing investment
Strategically develop Tatler’s marketing activities through the use of analytics, data development and technology
Assist with the B2B marketing communications strategy

Requirements:
Minimum 5 years marketing experience, preferably in media, events and the luxury industry and 2 years experience in event marketing
Experience in executing and tracking digital marketing campaigns that involve live/virtual events, website, content and social media marketing within the APAC environment
Research skills and the ability to synthesise data and prepare easy to read presentations

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Sales and Marketing Manager Job Description
We are looking for an organized sales and marketing manager to assist in the advertising and selling of our company's products and to create competitive advantages for our company in the market industry. The sales and marketing manager's responsibilities include generating unique sales plans, creating engaging advertisements, emails, and promotional literature, developing pricing strategies, and meeting marketing and sales human resource objectives. The sales and marketing manager represents the company's brand and drives strategies to increase product awareness by observing the market, competitors, and industry trends.
To be a successful sales and marketing manager, you should have strong interpersonal, leadership, and communication skills. You should also possess an in-depth knowledge and understanding of sales and marketing.
Sales and Marketing Manager Responsibilities:
Promoting the company's existing brands and introducing new products to the market.
Analyzing budgets, preparing annual budget plans, scheduling expenditures, and ensuring that the sales team meets their quotas and goals.
Researching and developing marketing opportunities and plans, understanding consumer requirements, identifying market trends, and suggesting system improvements to achieve the company's marketing goals.

title: Games / Product Marketing Manager
company_info: Reimagine a Play-and-Earn Metaverse, where the virtual and real world converge! Affyn is a blockchain-powered Metaverse project with a Free-to-Play, Play-to-Earn mobile game that integrates the best of both the virtual world and the real world. Utilising geolocation technology, augmented reality ("AR") mechanics and blockchain technology such as non-fungible tokens ("NFT"), Affyn aims to create an ecosystem that is fun and practical, both virtually and in real life. Read more about us at https://www.affyn.com/ https://finance.yahoo.com/news/singapore-play-earn-metaverse-affyn-071900971.html https://coindesk.cc/affyn-s-fyn-gathers-attention-after-successful-fundraise-77725.html
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Reimagine a Play-and-Earn Metaverse, where the virtual and real world converge!
We are a well-funded start-up Singapore-based company with a global reach. We use blockchain-powered technology to develop mobile games with integrated geolocation and augmented reality capability. We are pioneering the gaming model with a sustainable play-and-earn economy where rewards earned in the virtual world can also be utilized in the real world.

We are seeking an experienced Games/Product Marketing Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for gaming and a strong marketing and product management background, with specific experience in game publishing in the Asian markets.

Responsibilities
Develop and execute go-to-market distribution strategies for game releases in targeted markets with a focus in Asia
Be a product expert and advocate, inserting yourself into conversations and establishing yourself as a pillar of knowledge for our product and target audiences
Utilize consumer insights, research and other data sources to craft customer profiles and champion the creation of the product position and messaging that caters to those audiences
Manage cross-functional efforts to execute marketing programs for content releases, brand collaborations, and game launches
Create open lines of communication as a true facilitator, opening communication channels and taking charge to coordinate cross functionally
Adopt a test and learn approach on GTM plan, looking for new ways to open up the funnel and find and capture new audiences
Take ownership in game localization, working closely with translators and other stakeholders to ensure that all aspects of the game, from the user interface to the dialogue, are properly localized.
Develop go-to-market and live phase product campaigns to build content and engage players
Work closely with the product and strategic marketing team to position and promote products and maximize ROI
Skills and Requirements
5+ years of marketing or live ops experience at a technology company or a history of success building and scaling a product, with specific experience in game publishing in the Asian markets
Experience in championing cross-functional leadership with Product, Art and creative, marketing and community teams
Experience working with and executing marketing strategy
A great communicator and strategic thinker
Shipped at least 1-2 Mobile App and passionate for games
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, including superb ability to dissect data and measure ROI
Ability to effectively present ideas; both verbally and visually
In-depth knowledge of up-to-date worldwide games industry trends, with specific expertise in the Asian market
Experience with blockchain and web3 technology is a plus
Fluent in English and at least one Asian language (e.g. Chinese, Korean, Japanese)

title: Regional Digital Marketing Manager - APAC
company_info: Crimson Education was founded in 2013 from the idea that through personalised education, we can transform students into the world leaders of tomorrow. Since then, we have rapidly grown a mission-driven team who are dedicated to building the education system for the 22nd century. Our network includes 2,400 tutors and consultants worldwide who work with over 20,000 students. Our tech platform connects tutors and mentors to high school students aiming to achieve admission and scholarships to top universities in the US, UK and beyond.
job_category: Advertising / Media, Consulting, Education and Training, Marketing / Public Relations, Professional Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
New Zealand-based Edutech company Crimson Education was founded in 2013 from the idea that through personalised education, we can transform students into the world leaders of tomorrow. Since then, we have rapidly grown a mission-driven team that is dedicated to building the education system for the 22nd century. Our network includes 2,400 tutors and consultants worldwide who work with over 20,000 students.
Our tech platform connects tutors and mentors to high school students aiming to achieve admission and scholarships to top universities in the US, Canada, UK, and beyond.
Looking to be involved in a growing, global team? With our Digital marketing team members across the globe, this role has the unique opportunity to dive headfirst into driving paid digital marketing strategy and activity across Asia, working with our country managers and local area marketing teams.
This is a full-time position, based remotely or at one of our office's across the globe, you will be required to be based in or near the APAC region.
What are the main responsibilities for this role?
As a Regional Digital Marketing Manager you will be responsible for implementing effective paid digital advertising campaigns to attract qualified prospects with cost effective strategies across Facebook, Google and other paid advertising platforms. Day to day, you will drive campaign strategy development, planning, campaign building, A/B testing, data analysis, and stakeholder communication management. You will be responsible for Crimson’s paid digital marketing activity across Asia, working with Crimson’s country managers, local area marketing teams and the global digital marketing team, reporting directly to Crimson’s Head of Performance Marketing.
You might be the person we're looking for if:
3+ years of experience developing and executing social media strategies and paid advertising campaigns across Facebook and Google
Experience working with other paid advertising platforms such as or similar to WeChat, YouTube, LinkedIn, Snapchat, and TikTok
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience managing multiple projects in a fast-paced environment with other team members and stakeholders.
Ability to productively and efficiently collaborate with a globally dispersed team
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
Exceptional learning agility
Experience with Google Analytics, Marketo, Salesforce, Tableau or close equivalents for each is preferred
Basic understanding of the UK and US admissions process
Why work for Crimson?
Flexible working environment, you will be empowered to structure how you work
Option to work from our many locations/remotely around the globe (role dependant) with us!
Limitless development and exposure- our internal promotions/role changes made up 33% of all recruitment last year.
$1,000 training budget per year- we love to level up!
Psychologist on staff
Impressive fireside chats and workshops to help the team continuously level up
Radical Candour is a feedback approach we live by
We’re a global player with 28 markets (and growing) across the globe!
If you're passionate about education and people and looking for a fast-paced, collaborative environment, and want to work with cutting-edge technology then we'd love to hear from you!

title: Digital Marketing Manager
company_info: Nautilus Labs is advancing the efficiency of ocean commerce through artificial intelligence. With hubs in New York and Singapore, the firm is trusted by clients across the globe to help make better, real-time decisions that ultimately unlock transformative outcomes—at sea and on shore. By partnering with Nautilus, ocean shipping leaders can maximize returns for every vessel and voyage while driving cross-team collaboration, greater transparency, and stronger accountability for their companies, shareholders, and the planet we all share.
address: MARINA ONE WEST TOWER, 9 STRAITS VIEW 018937
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Nautilus.
Nautilus is building artificial intelligence to advance the efficiency of ocean commerce. We deliver technology to help shipping companies minimize fuel consumption, maximize operational efficiency, and optimize fleet performance. By arming ship owners and operators with real-time predictive decision support, Nautilus is reducing greenhouse gas emissions and making global trade sustainable.
Ocean shipping consumes over $100 billion dollars of fuel every year, and up to 30% of it can be saved. For owner-operators, reliance on manually collected and analyzed data makes it difficult to optimize fleet performance in real-time. By providing a unified data platform that leverages machine learning, Nautilus helps its clients make better decisions to maximize the return on each ship and every voyage. For our clients, this means they drive closer collaboration, greater transparency, and stronger accountability across their global teams every day.

About You.
You’re not looking to work in an established corporate company. You don’t want to be a cog in a machine. You relish the challenge of working at a scale-up where you have to work out how to solve the problems facing you.
You want to work at a mission-driven company that is making a genuine difference to the world. You care about the environment and you’d feel proud to know you’re helping reduce carbon emissions in the shipping industry. As a bonus, you know a bit about the maritime sector, or you’ve got an interest in the ocean.
You love all aspects of digital marketing, and like the variety it offers, especially in a scale-up. You like the fact that you’ve got a huge number of different things to do, and that you’re the one who can decide how they get done.
But in particular, you’ve got experience running effective paid media campaigns; developing and implementing SEO strategies; managing organic social media; and reporting on the real impact of all marketing activities.
You blend an analytical, numbers driven approach with a creative mindset. You’re equally happy creating a marketing report as you are drafting a social post or creating a graphic. But you’re also more than willing to try your hand at whatever needs doing to solve the immediate problem, even if you don’t have the experience.
You’re very happy working as part of a team, but being responsible for your specific tasks. You get satisfaction from being given a problem to solve without always being told how to solve it.

Outcomes For The Role.
Develop and implement our website’s SEO strategy to increase relevant traffic
Manage our paid social and PPC activity to increase awareness and increase conversions
Create organic social media posts and manage our organic social media channels
Create social media graphics using existing templates
Manage our marketing reporting and analytics through Hubspot and Google Analytics
Maintain the website, ensuring the site is optimised for SEO and conversions
Provide local marketing support where needed
Manage our conversion tracking using Google Tag manager, Dealfront and Hubspot
Proficiencies.
5+ years of experience in digital marketing for a B2B company, ideally at the start-up or scale-up stage
Fluent English speaker with flawless writing skills
Demonstrable experience of managing SEO for a B2B company
Very good writing skills in a range of formats, from social posts to blogs
Experience using Hubspot, especially the reporting and analytics features
Experience of the entire Google product suite, especially Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Google Ads and Google Search Console
Deep experience with SEMRush or equivalent (Ahrefs)
Experience of running LinkedIn and Twitter advertising campaigns generating demonstrable ROI
Certified in Google Ads and Google Analytics
Some experience of graphic design software such as Figma or Adobe Photoshop
BONUS: Maritime industry experience or exposure!
Our Core Values.
Get ready to join a group of diverse, smart, talented, and driven individuals. We are looking for people who are motivated by environmentalism and a future where shipping is sustainable and safe. A team member joining Nautilus is...
We’re THOUGHTFUL, with a bias towards action.
We’re an INCLUSIVE crew, and we are not passengers along for the ride.
We’re DIRECT and we ask the tough questions.
We EMPATHIZE with humanity.
Location: Singapore [Hybrid].
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Digital Marketing Executive
company: JUMBO GROUP OF RESTAURANTS PTE. LTD.
company_info: Company Overview Jumbo Group of Restaurants began with Jumbo Seafood, a home-grown seafood restaurant that was established in 1987 and best known for its chilli and black pepper crabs. The Jumbo story soon evolved after years of restaurant management experience and now includes six diverse dining concepts that serve more than 4,000 diners daily. In 2009, we established a Central Kitchen at our corporate headquarters to conduct R&D as well as to achieve better consistency in food quality across our various dining brands. As such, we have been able to innovate and implement a greater variety of cuisine creations to meet our diners' changing tastes and expectations, while continuing to serve quality food at reasonable prices. With a team of dedicated and innovative F&B professionals that has placed gastronomic and service excellence at the heart of all that we do. Jumbo has achieved a number of culinary and service awards over the years. JUMBO. Bonding people through food.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities

We are looking for a Senior / Digital Marketing Executive who possesses a proactive, creative, and positive mindset to join our dynamic team. He/she is primarily responsible for editorial and content management and reports to the Digital Marketing Manager.
Beyond this, he/she has a diverse range of skills, knowledge, and experience relating to social listening, social copywriting, performance reporting, paid media management, and Google Analytics.

company_info: The Institute of Singapore Chartered Accountants (ISCA) is the national accountancy body of Singapore. ISCA’s vision is to be a globally recognised professional accountancy body, bringing value to our members, the profession and wider community. There are over 32,000 ISCA members making their stride in businesses across industries in Singapore and around the world. Established in 1963, ISCA is an advocate of the interests of the profession. Possessing a Global Mindset, with Asian Insights, ISCA leverages its regional expertise, knowledge, and networks with diverse stakeholders to contribute towards Singapore’s transformation into a global accountancy hub. ISCA is the Administrator of the Singapore CA Qualification and the Designated Entity to confer the Chartered Accountant of Singapore - CA (Singapore) - designation. ISCA is a member of Chartered Accountants Worldwide (CAW). CAW brings together 12 chartered accountancy bodies connecting and representing the interests of over 1.7 million members and students globally. For more information, visit www.isca.org.sg.

title: Marketing Manager
company_info: No information added.
address: TIONG BAHRU ORCHID, 107 JALAN BUKIT MERAH 160107
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A marketing manager is responsible for developing, implementing, and managing marketing strategies to achieve the company's goals. They play a crucial role in promoting the company's products or services, building brand awareness, and driving customer acquisition and retention.

The main responsibilities of a marketing manager include:

1. Developing marketing plans: This involves conducting market research, identifying target audiences, and creating strategies to reach them effectively.

2. Managing advertising campaigns: Marketing managers coordinate and oversee the creation and implementation of advertising campaigns across various channels, such as print, online, and social media.

3. Brand management: They ensure consistent brand messaging and positioning across all marketing initiatives, including managing brand guidelines, visual assets, and tone of voice.

4. Conducting market research: Marketing managers analyze market trends, competitor activities, and customer insights to identify opportunities and inform marketing strategies.

5. Managing digital marketing efforts: They oversee online marketing channels, including website, social media, email marketing, and search engine optimization (SEO) to drive traffic, engagement, and conversions.

6. Building and managing a marketing team: Marketing managers recruit, train, and mentor marketing professionals, ensuring the team is equipped to execute marketing strategies effectively.

7. Tracking and analyzing marketing performance: They use analytics tools to measure the success of marketing campaigns, identify areas for improvement, and make data-driven decisions.

8. Collaborating with other departments: Marketing managers work closely with sales, product development, and other teams to align marketing efforts with overall business objectives and ensure a cohesive customer experience.

Overall, a marketing manager needs to possess strong analytical, strategic thinking, and communication skills. They should be creative, adaptable, and able to thrive in a fast-paced and ever-changing marketing landscape.

title: Growth Marketing Manager
company_info: Secret Furnishing is Singapore's best-value home furnishing partner. Using technology to provide a one-stop solution for homeowners from consultation to installation with convenience and transparency. Since its launch in 2019, Secret Furnishing has showcased massive growth, having served over 11,000 homes and highly raved by new homeowners in Singapore. Our mission is to be the go-to choice for quality window treatment solutions in Singapore, to create the perfect living space for homeowners.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a performance-driven Growth Marketer who has a passion for learning and staying up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in digital marketing to join our team.

The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3 years of experience in digital marketing with strong marketing fundamentals and a good big picture understanding in digital marketing.

The candidate must have a unique skill set that combines creativity, technical expertise, and analytical abilities to drive and be confident to handle all parts of marketing from strategy, planning, execution to monitoring and optimisation.

Responsibilities:

Develop and execute performance-driven marketing campaigns that are optimised for customer acquisition, engagement and retention on major ad platforms, such as Google, Meta, and TikTok.
Strategise, plan and generate creative ideas for new and viral content that resonates with our audience.
Create objective-driven short-form video content on TikTok, Reels, Shorts, and other platforms.
Conduct A/B testing and optimization to improve conversion rates, click-through rates, and other key metrics.
Develop and maintain WordPress websites, ensuring they are user-friendly and optimised for search engines.
Manage search engine optimization (SEO) and search engine marketing (SEM) campaigns, utilising Google Analytics and other analytics tools.
Design graphics and images for use in marketing campaigns, including social media, email, and website graphics.
Familiarity with web development and coding languages such as HTML, CSS & Javascript to implement changes on the website and emails.
Set up and maintain analytics and tracking systems, including GTM, Pixels, GA4, Conversion Trackers, Heatmaps, and SEMrush.
Report on key metrics and analyse the effectiveness of campaigns, identifying areas for improvement and optimization.
Qualifications:

Minimum of 3 years of experience in digital marketing, with proven results in driving growth and acquisition.
Strong understanding of digital marketing channels and platforms, including social media, email, search engines, and advertising networks.
Experience in creating high-quality, objective-driven content that resonates with target audiences.
Ability to think creatively and develop new, innovative ideas for marketing campaigns.
Experience with website development and maintenance, particularly in WordPress.
Proficiency in SEO, SEM, and best practices, including keyword research, on-page optimization, and backlinking strategies.
Proficiency in graphic design software such as Photoshop, Illustrator, or Canva.
Experience with video editor tools on Tiktok, IG Reels, Capcut.
Basic understanding of HTML, CSS and Javascript.
Experience with analytics tools, such as Google Analytics, GA4, Heatmap, SEMrush, and other analytics tools.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to analyse data and make data-driven decisions.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project management skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.

Location at North Link Building

Application for Singaporean/ PR only
If you meet the above qualifications and are excited about the opportunity to drive growth for our business, we encourage you to apply for this position. Send your Resume and CV to career@secretfurnishing.co

Roles & Responsibilities
Our Client, a global leader in cloud software and a pioneer in hyperconverged infrastructure, who help customers simplify cloud complexity with an open, software-defined hybrid multicloud platform; is looking for a Partner Marketing Specialist to support countries within the APAC region.

Responsibilities

For nominated Client Partners
On-boarding & introduction
Quarterly review of nominated concierge list with Client’s team .
Outbound reach to the list of nominated partners
Introductory onboarding call and email to new partners; and support partner in campaign initiatives.
Set up 1-1 sessions with ALL nominated partners (new & existing) to run through current quarter campaigns on PDC, programs and tools.
Pitch and drive adoption rate of at least 1 campaign per quarter per partner.
Gather partner feedback
Weekly Follow up calls and emails to partners on status and feedback.
Expectation: Concierge will help and support partner to execute end-to-end campaign(All PDC (Zift Platform) – Digital, Social & Microsite campaigns).
Influence and remind all partner to opt in for lead registrations (or manual leads upload)
Periodically promote PDC digital footprints - campaigns, social assets, emails, microsites, event in a box etc
For New Partners acquisition
1-2 new partners to be added to the list quarterly
Concierge to work directly with distributors in nominating 1-2 new partners to try out Partner Demand Centre
Concierge to report and inform local region partner marketing manager on new partners onboarded.
Once approved, set up 1-1 Session per partner (may include more than one attendee from the same partner)
Introductory onboarding call & email to new partners – support partner in campaign initiatives.
Run through current quarter campaigns on PDC, programs and tools.
Pitch and drive adoption rate of at least 1 campaign per quarter per partner.
Gather partner feedback
Weekly Follow up calls and emails to partners on status and feedback.
For Client Distributors.
1x Quarterly webinar per distributor hosted by the concierge in region to introduce Partner Demand Centre Capabilities
Webinar topic to include PDC overview and training on PDC capabilities - Email campaigns, social syndication, microsites etc
Total of at least 2 webinars with 2 distributors per quarter
Host webinar to introduce PDC with distributors – to be completed within the first month of the new quarter.
Drive registrations for webinar through distributors
Gather list of partner registrations and attendees and submit to Client partner marketing team after webinar ended
Reporting
Weekly, monthly & quarterly review
Provide consolidate view/summary of activities to Client team on a monthly basis
Provide a consolidated reporting view of all partner activities to determine new suggested partners on a quarterly basis.
Client will provide quarterly Marketing KPIs, such as Marketing qualified leads, Marketing influenced pipeline and Marketing activities target, and measured against them on a best effort basis.
Requirements:
5+ years of marketing experience related to channel/partner marketing management
Demonstrated track record of developing marketing strategies and end-to-end partner related programs that effectively achieve strategic objectives.
Possesses an enthusiastic personality and self-motivated nature, with the ability to multiple tasks and work well under pressure.
Exhibits strong relationship-building skills, capable of managing relationships at all levels within the organization.
Demonstrates the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team, including collaborating with remote colleagues and partners.

title: Marketing Manager
company_info: Antz Capital is a boutique corporate advisory firm that partners entrepreneurs, industry leaders and financial industry leaders to assist Small & Medium Enterprises (SMEs) to achieve their growth aspirations. In particular, our strength is in accelerating the business expansion plans of medium-sized companies as we provide high value advise on capital markets, Initial Public Offering (IPO) in local and overseas exchanges Mergers & Acquisitions (M&As), corporate restructuring, private equity and more. Management Consulting & Corporate Advisory – From management consulting to corporate advisory, we work hand-in-hand with entrepreneurs on business transformation and corporate strategy so as to attract investors, business partnerships and talents. Sell-side Advisory – We support entrepreneurs in investor-matching opportunities from angel investors to institutional funders, venture capitalists and investment bankers. Buy-side Investment – We focus on investing our resources and expertise in selected businesses. As such, the chosen entrepreneurs are guided, mentored, coached and trained to grow from entrepreneurs to investors. We also have an investor club where selected projects are shown to buy-side UHNWs, funds, family offices and others.
job_category: Advertising / Media, Consulting, Events / Promotions, Marketing / Public Relations, Professional Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Our Company
Antz Capital is a boutique corporate advisory firm that partners entrepreneurs, industry leaders and financial industry leaders to assist Small & Medium Enterprises (SMEs) to achieve their growth aspirations. In particular, our strength is in accelerating the business expansion plans of medium-sized companies as we provide high value advise on capital markets, Initial Public Offering (IPO) in local and overseas exchanges Mergers & Acquisitions (M&As), corporate restructuring, private equity and more.
Management Consulting & Corporate Advisory – From management consulting to corporate advisory, we work hand-in-hand with entrepreneurs on business transformation and corporate strategy so as to attract investors, business partnerships and talents.
Sell-side Advisory – We support entrepreneurs in investor-matching opportunities from angel investors to institutional funders, venture capitalists and investment bankers.
Buy-side Investment – We focus on investing our resources and expertise in selected businesses. As such, the chosen entrepreneurs are guided, mentored, coached and trained to grow from entrepreneurs to investors. We also have an investor club where selected projects are shown to buy-side UHNWs, funds, family offices and others.

About the Role
We are looking to hire a Marketing Manager who will be in charge of leading our company's marketing efforts. As a successful hire, you will be responsible for providing guidance to our marketing department by evaluating and developing marketing strategies, planning and coordinating marketing efforts, communicating the marketing plans to those involved, and building awareness and positioning for our company's brands. You will also be working closely with our sales department to develop a pricing strategy that will help us maximize profits and market share. Finally, you will be in charge of organizing company seminars, conferences, trade shows, and major events.
This is a hands-on, execution-focused role, with the ideal candidate given the opportunity to head their own team in the future. Please note that Events, Marcomm and Digital Marketing experience is a must for this role. The ideal candidate needs to be fluent in both Mandarin and English as the role required strong design and copywriting skills in both languages.
Responsibilities:
· Skilled in lead generation through marketing funnels, lead generation tools.
· Planning, directing, and coordinating events, communications, PR, marketing efforts.
· Working with sales department to develop pricing strategies to maximize profits and market share while balancing customer satisfaction.
· Understanding and developing budgets and finance, including expenditures, research and development appropriations, return-on-investment and profit-loss projections.
· Developing and managing advertising campaigns.
· Building brand awareness and positioning.
· Supporting sales and lead generation efforts.
· Organizing company conferences, trade shows, and major events.
· Overseeing social media marketing strategy and content marketing.
Requirements:
· Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, communications, or related field
· Experience in marketing and running a marketing team, with at least 5 years for Marketing Manager
· Strong copywriting skills
· Proven ability to manage budgets.
· Experience with digital marketing forms such as social media, content marketing, SEO, GDN, Facebook Ads, Outbrain etc.
· Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
